campaign.story:
The Dark Trails RPG is a game which pays homage to the popular weird West genre.  It can be used as a standalone game or as the perfect complement to a growing line of products that all utilize the rules found in the Dungeon Crawl Classics (DCC) RPG.   As a player, you’ll find a wealth of material that allows you to assume the role of one of 11 unique classes, with descriptive names like: the Calavera, the Bedlamite, and the Sin-Eater.   As a Judge, you’ll find over 400 pages of material giving you a wealth of resources for designing and running fantastic adventures set against the haunted landscapes of an unforgiving weird West. 
You may be wondering about the above mentioned game that Dark Trails is tethered to. Dungeon Crawl Classics is a Fantasy RPG written by Joseph Goodman of Goodman Games. Since debuting in 2012, the book has gone through seven (7) printings and spawned a wonderful community of passionate gamers both new and old. DCC continues to grow by leaps and bounds by way of exciting adventures penned by some of the best writers in the industry, including third-party publishers using the system to fuel their own creative fires.
Fortunately, the Dark Master (Joseph Goodman) has granted permission to include a modified version of the DCC ruleset within the pages of Dark Trails to make it the first 3rd party published work to include the necessary rules for play. You don’t need anything other than the Dark Trails RPG to play the game aside from some dice, paper, and pencils. 
Some of the DCC rules were purposefully left out when weighed against their place in a weird West setting, but these omitted rules can easily be added to Dark Trails should you own a copy of DCC and wish to include them.
 This Kickstarter funds the standalone hardcover book for the game. Funds raised will be used to pay for additional art, editing, and layout for a quality book made by traditional offset methods to ensure it is as durable as it is beautiful. 
 Dark Trails is the product of three years of writing and playtesting by author David Baity. You may remember David from his first DCC adventure “Carnival of the Damned” published by  Purple Sorcerer Games. While David has handled the majority of the writing chores with the Dark Trails RPG, lots of folks have thrown their name into the hat to help flesh out the magic and bestiary sections. Daniel J. Bishop, Brandon Goeringer, Bob Brinkman, Diogo Nogueira, and Jeff Scifert are just a few of the talented minds that have worked their magic to make Dark Trails something truly special.
For one of the two editions of the game we've commissioned none other than the legendary SanJulian to grace us with a beautifully painted cover filled to the brim with "weird." You can see a few more of SanJulian's DCC covers below, and be sure to check out his website  for several works you've probably seen grace the covers of your favorite novels and other publications over the years.
Who else is on board to help to bring the world of Dark Trails to life? Over the last two years, the author has recruited some of the best up-and-coming artists in the industry. The Dark Trails RPG currently features work by Angga Augustiya, Todd McGowan, Christopher Torres, Simon Todd, Danny Prescott, Adam Slivka, David Hoskins, Aaron Robinson, MARCINs, David Coppoletti, and Diogo Nogueira.
Additional funds raised by the Kickstarter will help continue to fund new art from the above-mentioned artists, in addition to work by Stefan Poag, Peter Mullen, and Bradley K. McDevitt, just to name a few!
 Dark Trails will be printed in two editions (standard and limited edition), both are hardcover books  8.5” x 11” trim size. The books will be printed in the USA by offset printing methods to ensure the quality of the book meets consumer expectations.  Currently, we plan to keep the interior printed in B&W on 60# paper and stitched binding. 
 The standard edition will feature a full-color cover painted by iconic artist, Sanjulian (Creepy magazine, Vampirella, etc.) while the limited edition will feature a leatherette cover, accented with metallic foil stamping and an embossed version of the Dark Trails RPG logo. The ultimate goal with the limited edition is to create something that looks like it was pulled right out of the Old West! 
Below, you can see mock ups of each book to give you an idea of what we're visualizing. The painting used to represent the standard edition is not the final Sanjulian cover, and both covers are subject to change. 
A mock-up of the standard edition. This is not the actual cover and all elements are subject to change
A mock-up of the limited edition leatherette edition. All elements are subject to change.


 The weird West genre is certainly well represented in the RPG industry, but those wishing to find a fully developed weird West RPG that utilizes a class-based system based upon the DCC RPG will be sadly disappointed. Dark Trails fills a niche for a DCC based weird West RPG by providing 11 original character classes paired with innovative rules designed to leave your players feeling like they’ve just spent several hours adventuring in a Western landscape where the emphasis is placed upon the weird!


You’ll find several classes to choose from within the pages of the book, so let’s give you a basic rundown of what you’ll find. 
Bedlamite: Absent-minded inventors constantly constructing inventions that defy all logic, including “wondrous” contraptions that are brought to life by their creator’s sheer force of will. Bedlamites often become addle-brained and introverted, preferring the company of their automatons to that of their allies.
Calavera: Spirit-mediums, most often female, that can both see and speak to the nearby dead wandering the closest regions of the Spirit Lands. The calavera shines like a beacon in the night to the restless dead, eager to have her deliver a message, or perform one last task that will put the spirit to rest. Aiding in those tasks marks her as a veritable queen of the underworld and the dead are not only willing to share some of their dark secrets but also have been known to reach across the grave to protect their only connection to the land of the living.
Gambler: With the big changes running through the weird West, the gambler could be called the chosen paladin of Lady Luck, able to manipulate the ebb and flow of chance like an occultist weaves arcane energy. Gamblers alter the probability of events going on in their surroundings and have a skill set that favors thievery and subterfuge.
Gunslinger: Sometimes, a poor soul is cut down before their time, and when that person is a law-dog or hardened soldier even death isn’t enough to discourage them from staying in the fight. These restless spirits possess the guns they died with and send out a call to those deemed worthy of carrying them. Gunslingers find their uncanny skill at gunplay supernaturally elevated by the spirits of vengeance that choose them.
Luchador: A luchador is most often a person noble of heart seeking the thrill of martial combat in and out of the sacred ring. In addition to high-flying acrobatics coupled with raw strength and fortitude, luchadores gain the ability to tap into their inner spirit, channeling it through their masks for supernatural effects.
Mountebank: The typical “snake oil salesman” of the frontier, these amateur alchemists and full-time showmen find that the events of the Seven Days of Night have unlocked a doorway to the mind that reveals recipes that defy all logic and, once brewed, resemble the magic potions of legend.
Mystic Monk: Trained in the sacred art of martial arts and schooled by master philosophers, the mystic monk is a humble warrior wandering the weird West in search of enlightenment. In addition to being a master of martial arts, the mystic monk can summon his inner chi, a virtual battery of spiritual energy used to perform superhuman feats.
Occultist: Occultists devote their lives to the mastery of the ambient arcane energies constantly flowing around all living things, learning to weave and channel them to miraculous effect through spell work. Occultists are considered master investigators and have a nose for all things arcane and unusual.
Revelator: The revelator serves as a bastion of faith to those seeking refuge from the madness infecting the world. They can perform divine healing and miracles in addition to serving as a bane to evil creatures—both living and dead—all while serving as a pillar of faith to those that still believe in the comforting words of The Good Book.
Sin-Eater: During the Seven Days of Night, no souls were granted passage to the Underworld and instead were cursed to wander the Spirit World where they were preyed upon by creatures native to the realm, or worse, taken as slaves by their own kind. Charon, lord of the ferrymen, knows an abundance of restless spirits could potentially unravel the barrier between worlds. Some ferrymen are hand selected by their lord to return to the surface world in order to shepherd lost souls to the afterlife and destroy those that prey upon them by using River Rites and the soul-aegis, a weapon that strikes fear in the hearts of the wicked.
Tommyknocker: Sometimes, a soul is just too pissed off to pass on and needs to get a slice of vengeance before taking that ride into the sunset. Tommyknockers are walking corpses for almost all intents and purposes, but the strength of their soul is such that it acts as a furnace, providing a means to animate its corpse-shell to take care of unfinished business. In addition to an unnatural strength, the tommyknocker is one of the toughest hombres found in the weird West.
If you’re a fan of the DCC magic system, you’ll be familiar with how things are done. If you’re new to DCC styled magic you’re in for a real treat! Spells can be cast multiple times if you continually roll high enough. Roll low and you might lose the spell for a day, or worse, suffer from the effects of corruption! On top of being able to cast known spells multiple times, the total of your roll means potentially casting that low-level magic missile spell with effects so strong that you just might wipe the playing field with your trusty “finger guns.” In addition to a full complement of spells and miracles found within the pages of Dark Trails, you can import any of the 120+ existing spells found in the Dungeon Crawl Classics RPG into your game, should you own the book.
You’ll find over 150 spells, wondrous contraptions, elixirs, and miracles within the pages of Dark Trails, but we didn’t stop there. In addition to the above, you’ll find a reliquary of beneficial and cursed magic items, along with rules and tables for crafting magical firearms. 
The author of the Dark Trails RPG really wants to present you with a game that has some innovative rules that help capture the feel of a Western-themed game. You’ll find several interesting mechanics scattered throughout the book (some that you may even wish to port to your DCC game), but the main rules that make the Dark Trails RPG a horse you’d want to throw a saddle on include:
New rules for firearms that incorporate a standard poker deck, including specialized critical hit and fumble tables.
Boons & Hexes represent a run of good/bad luck your character might be having during a typical session. They’re awarded based on things like exceptionally good/bad die rolls, true heroics, and great role playing.  Boons earned can be spent for in-game perks, while Hexes increase your chances of receiving more disastrous results on fumble and fear charts. In addition, they affect how NPC interactions pan out—consider the unlucky cowboy to have a dark cloud following him around.
A new system that replaces the “standard” alignment mechanics found in most RPGs. The new system helps tell the story of how decisions determine the path a character may walk and how that path affects their reputation when dealing with NPCs.
An innovative system for fear and madness that simulates a character’s ability to handle both physical and emotional stress during the adventure, including an extensive list of mental disorders for those who slip too deeply down the rabbit hole!

 Lot's of folks are hard at work putting their twist on the weird West genre. For starters, you can check out Thick Skull Adventures "The Last WIll and Testament of Obediah Felkner." Author Stephen Newton is close to launching his exciting take on a weird West adventure that blends perfectly with the Dark Trails RPG. You can find more info at Thick Skull Adventures 
You can also take comfort in knowing some talented up-and-coming writers in the gaming community have become so inspired by past playtests that they’ve taken the initiative to start writing Dark Trails adventures. 
There’s no bigger compliment for an author than to learn folks think enough of their game to create material before the book is even released! The author has big plans to produce both free and paid content once the book is released into the wild. This includes supporting those who wish to produce their own Dark Trails material!
You’re going to love the bestiary in this book! Over seventy-five creatures have been pulled from the works of Lovecraft and the pages of folklore from all around the world! Several notable folks have thrown their passion into helping make the bestiary something special, including but not limited to: Daniel J. Bishop, Jon Hook, Brandon Goeringer, Bob Brinkman and more! 
You’ll also find that several included creatures contain charts with all sorts of tweaks and nasty surprises to make each encounter terrifying and unique!

Sometimes, a Judge has a hard enough time wrangling up a posse, let alone coming up with a trail-ready adventure to keep'em busy! Don't you worry, partner, we got you covered! You’ll find a complete 0-1st level action-packed adventure included within the pages, and a ready-made town filled with personalities to get you started on the trail.  As we reach stretch goals, more material gets added.  
 What Kickstarter would be worth its weight in whiskey if it didn't have some awesome stretch goals to sweeten the pot? We hope we'll see some of these reached, and if you surprise us and beat them all, we'll just have to up our game and bring something bigger to the table!
US $12,000: Congrats to the posse! Check your irons and saddle the horses cause we ride at dawn!
US $14,000: We’ll throw in a satin ribbon bookmark in both physical versions (standard and limited edition) of the book.
US $16,000: We need a bigger zoo! As it stands, there are 75 creatures for you to pluck from the pages of the book, but the author thinks you could stand for a little extra tooth and tentacle! If the project hits US $16,000, we’ll raise the count to 100 agents of darkness!
US $18,000: The Dark Trails RPG already comes with a bountiful arcanum filled with wondrous contraptions, potent elixirs, and powerful spells, but there’s room for more! If we reach the US $18,000 mark, we’ll add an additional 50 spells and miracles to raise the total entries to 200!
US $20,000: How do you expect to get around in the weird West without a map to properly represent the states and territories as they currently stand? The Seven Days of Night brought about supernatural changes to all things, including much of the land! If we reach US $20,000, we’ll bring on master cartographer Jared Blando to craft a black and white map to be used for end sheets.
US $22,000: Dark Trails is filled to the gills with 11 playable classes, but there’s room for one more, as we love even numbers! If we can reach US $22,000, author Pete Spahn (Operation White Box) has agreed to throw a 12th class into the book.
US $24,000: Judges bringing the weird West to the table are going to need something pretty to spruce up those custom screens, and it needs to be as functional as it is purdy! Once we hit the US $24,000 mark, we’ll make PDF screen inserts and have one of our artists create some original full-cover art to show the players.
US $26,000: The limited-edition hardback already comes with foil stamping, but if we can reach the US $26,000 mark, we’ll throw some “shiny” on the standard-edition cover and spine as well!
US $28,000: The Dark Trails RPG already comes with an adventure to get you up and running, but if we reach the US $28,000 mark, we’ll include a second adventure penned by the legendary Daniel J. Bishop! Daniel is eager to have a go at bringing terror to the world of Dark Trails, and we’re excited to be able to include an adventure from his twisted mind.
US $30,000: Remember that black and white map we mentioned way back at US $20,000? Well, let's bump it up to full color to get a real taste of what a Western map might look like back in the day! Take a gander at Jared's color work.
US $34,000: We're going to offer up a form fillable character sheet for both the funnel style and higher level character sheets! Now, you can show up to the campfire with a spiffy character sheet on your favorite electronic device!
US $36,000: Bob Brinkman, my go to guy for all things Cthulhu, has agreed to lend a hand by way of writing a complete adventure to add to the growing library of material available for the Dark Trails line! Bob has a long list of writing credits to his name (DCC, MCC, Lankhmar DCC and Dying Earth MCC) and can also be heard on the amazing Sanctum Secorum Podcast . 
All backers will receive the digital PDF version of the yet to be named adventure for free by way of DriveThruRPG at the time of fulfillment. The adventure will also be made available as a physical add-on at the discounted price of $12.00 (retail $15.00). Expect to see this adventure sometime in the 1st quarter of 2020.
US $40,000: I can't let my friends hog all of the fun, so at this level you'll have another adventure thrown into the stew-pot written by yours truly! Don't take my word for it! Ask anyone who's played through my published adventure "Carnival of the Damned".or in any of my convention games, and you'll get the idea of how much creepy I inject into all things related to RPGs! 
All backers will receive the PDF version of the yet to be named adventure for free by way of DriveThruRPG at the time of fulfillment. The adventure will also be made available as a physical add-on at the discounted price of $12.00 (retail $15.00). Expect to see this adventure sometime in the 1st quarter of 2020.
US $44,000: I'm totally stoked to announce this one! If you've played Dungeon Crawl Classics then chances are you've played, or run an adventure by the legendary DCC author,  Michael Curtis ! Michael is the main man behind the popular Chained Coffin boxed set , and the soon to be released Lankhmar boxed set . This is in addition to a treasure trove of other Dungeon Crawl Classics adventures.
Michael has agreed to lend his talents to a Dark Trails adventure! I can't tell you how excited I am by this stretch goal, and if you're a DCC fan I'm sure you'll be just as giddy! 
All backers will receive the digital PDF version of the yet to be named adventure for free by way of DriveThruRPG at the time of the adventures fulfillment. The adventure will also be made available as a physical add-on at the discounted price of $12.00 (retail $15.00). 
Due to Michael's busy schedule we can only promise that the adventure will be delivered sometime in 2020. 
US $47,000: What kind of scoundrel would I be if I didn't offer you up a poster of the magnificent cover Sanjulian painted for the project. If we reach the 47K mark you will receive one folded 11x17 poster of the cover image free of charge. Free? Yep, that's right, amigo!It's my way of saying thanks for saddling up for this weird posse on the trail! Posters will ship with all standard and limited edition versions of the Dark Trails RPG. 
US $50,000: What would make for an awesome new stretch goal for the Dark Trails RPG campaign? How about if I throw in another original adventure penned by none other than the legendary Harley Stroh? Yep, polish yer' boots up cause Harley's coming to the dance, and he's loaded for bear! 
For those not familiar with Mr.Stroh, you can check out his amazing contributions to the hobby through the years here.  Harley is well known for the amazing "Peril on the Purple Planet" boxed set in addition to a slew of adventures that most folks consider a must have when running Dungeon Crawl Classics! 
All backers will receive the digital PDF version of the yet to be named adventure for free by way of DriveThruRPG at the time of the adventures fulfillment. The adventure will also be made available as a physical add-on at the discounted price of $12.00 (retail $15.00).You will be invoiced separately for shipping once it is ready for fulfillment. 
Due to Harley's busy schedule we can only promise that the adventure will be delivered sometime in 2020. 
 US $53,000: Hang on to your hats, partner! I'm not done with you quite yet when it comes to DCC writers! How about if we throw one last original adventure into the stew-pot to see just how hungry you really are while you're waiting in the proverbial chow line ? I can personally attest to the madness festering in the mind of the DCC madman known as, Brendan LaSalle! Anyone who has ever attended a convention where Brendan was a guest will agree that this man has an addictive energy about him that makes for one of the best judges you'll ever get to roll bones with. 
Brendan is responsible for several exciting DCC/MCC adventures, and is the creator of the addictive Xcrawl RPG (And version is currently in the works for the Dungeon Crawl Classics RPG!). If you are lucky enough to find a seat at one of his games, tell him Baity sent you and see what sort of horrific death your character suffers!
All backers will receive the digital PDF version of the yet to be named adventure for free by way of DriveThruRPG at the time of the adventures fulfillment. The adventure will also be made available as a physical add-on at the discounted price of $12.00 (retail $15.00). You will be invoiced separately for shipping once it is ready for fulfillment. 
Due to Brendan's busy schedule we can only promise that the adventure will be delivered sometime in 2020. 
US $55,000: You will receive a free folded copy of the map being created for Dark Trails by Jared Blando! I've been searching for a company that can handle the task, and I think I've finally settled upon a good choice. The exact dimensions of the map have yet to be determined, but you will have something close to a 34"x 22" map. Final size will depend upon folding dimensions, as we want to be sure the map will fit neatly inside the cover of the hardback. Maps will ship with all physical standard and limited editions of the Dark Trails RPG. 
US $56,000: With all the content included in the Dark Trails RPG you're going to need another way to keep those important sections marked! We're going to throw in a second ribbon bookmark to help keep you from forming blisters on your fingers while flipping pages! Bookmarks will only be included in physical copies of the standard and limited edition book!

Need some fancy doo-dads to help your time on the trail go a little smoother? We've got a few items that just might help ease you into the saddle.
Physical copy of Bob Brinkman's stretch goal adventure $12 : You'll receive a physical copy of the stretch goal adventure written by the author. Shipping to be determined at the time of fulfillment.
 Physical copy of Dark Trails RPG author David Baity's stretch goal adventure $12 : You'll receive a physical copy of the stretch goal adventure written by the author. Shipping to be determined at the time of fulfillment.
 Physical copy of Dark Trails RPG author Michael Curtis's stretch goal adventure $12 : You'll receive a physical copy of the stretch goal adventure written by the author.  Signed and numbered Sanjulian print $35: Add an extra $35 to your pledge and you'll have the option to select a signed print upon receiving your backerkit survey.  Shipping is not included, and you will be invoiced separately once the prints are signed and on hand for mailing. Prints will be poly bagged and mailed in a hard mailer tube.
 Dark Trails dice bag $25 : Add an extra $25 dollars to your pledge to have a proper saddlebag to take those weird dice on the trail! Shipping not included. You will be invoiced for shipping separately once the dice bags are in hand and ready to go out! Dice bags will arrive well before the hardbacks are sent to the printer.
 Additional hardback (standard edition) $65 : Add an extra $65 dollars to your pledge per book you wish to add to your order. The purchase of extra books will help you save on shipping costs which will be determined at the time of fulfillment.

Character sheet pad 50 count (funnel) $5  : Part of the fun of playing the Dark Trails RPG is experiencing the funnel adventure that weeds out the bad eggs from those destined for the role of hero. You'll receive a pad of printed character sheets specifically geared for funnels. Price does not include shipping.
Character sheet pad 50 count (standard) $5 : Once you survive your first brush with things that'd turn most men "yeller," you'll be ready to walk the path Lady Fate has laid out for you. Having a printed character sheet geared for levels 1st thru 6th certainly helps! You'll receive a pad of printed character sheets good for higher level adventures. Price does not include shipping.
Dark Trails T-Shirt $25: Men's S-XL (2XL, 3XL, 4XL add $2). Let evil know you're hitting the trail! This is a black two sided t-shirt with the logo on the front, and "Dark Trails RPG" with our web address on the back. Shirts will be shipped separately from physical book(s) and arrive before the completion of the Dark Trails RPG. You will be invoiced separately for shipping once they're ready to be mailed out.

Dice Blocks $6: One of the most popular dice runs I've made for Dark Trails is back! You'll get three pairs of the pictured dice to present to your posse, or pull out of your bag to instantly roll some heat during character generation (Baity dice are legendary!). Dice are only being sold in sets of six to keep us reasonably sane! This item will be shipped separately from phsyical book(s) and arrive before the completion of the Dark Trails RPG. You will be invoiced separately for shipping once the dice are ready to be mailed out.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Backing someone with no Kickstarters under their belt can certainly make one hesitant to pull the trigger on any project. 

Author David Baity has been an active member in the DCC community for several years and made sure the project was near completion before launching any form of crowdfunding to help wrap the book up. He has spent several thousand dollars of his personal funds over the years to purchase art, promotional items and freelance writing with the larger chapters of the book. 

With the rough draft complete, work will begin immediately at the end of the Kickstarter, with editing and layout handled by a team of talented veterans with several products under their belt. Additional art has already been commissioned along with the gathering multiple quotes for a quality hardback book that really represents the years of hard work put into the Dark Trails RPG.

In short, we've tried to cover all of our bases before launching the Kickstarter and feel the risk to you as our backer has been minimized. We hope to make this the first in a long line of products to keep your weird west games going for years to come.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

support.title: Cowpoke
support.descp:
You ain’t quite ready to brave the dangers of the trail yet, but you figure it’s worth a few bucks to help those who want to ride in the saddle!
Your pledge will keep you in the know with updates on the Kickstarter as they roll out.

support.title: Shopkeeper
support.descp:
You've no dog in this fight, but you do your part by keepin’ the shelves stocked with the goods brave folks need to face the rising tide of darkness!
You will be contacted at the end of the Kickstarter. At that time you can order the items you want, as available, at a discounted price. Shipping will be calculated and invoiced at the time of fulfillment.

This reward is for verified brick and mortar retail stores only.
Your pledge will keep you in the know with updates on the Kickstarter as they roll out. Shipping will be charged at the time of your order.

support.title: Buckaroo
support.descp:
You’re up for a little adventure but still not sure whether you’ll be able to stomach the horrors lurking on the trail.
You’ll receive a PDF copy of the Dark Trails RPG quick-start rules (fulfilled through DriveThruRPG shortly after the Kickstarter funds). The quick-start rules are included at all higher levels as well.

support.title: Rustler
support.descp:
You reckon it ain’t right to let other folks take to the trail while you warm your heels by the fire. Time to load them irons and saddle up!
You’ll receive a PDF copy of the Dark Trails RPG (fulfilled through DriveThruRPG once fulfillment begins) in addition to any digital stretch goals.
This pledge level also entitles you to a copy of the Dark Trails RPG quick-start PDF.

support.title: Gaucho
support.descp:
You fully intend to drop the plow and saddle up that “glue bucket” to set off on a trail of righteous glory where you’re sure to face things that’ll make anyone’s blood run cold!
You’ll receive a standard hardback copy of the Dark Trails RPG shipped directly to you in addition to receiving a complimentary copy of the Dark Trails RPG PDF (fulfilled through DriveThruRPG once fulfillment begins).
Pledging at this level also qualifies you for all physical and digital stretch goals and a copy of the Dark Trails RPG quick-start PDF. Pledge levels here and higher that receive physical items will be charged shipping at the time of fulfillment.

support.title: Night Hawk
support.descp:
You ain’t from around here, but that won’t stop you from fillin’ anything sprouting tentacles with lead! Just keep your wits about you till you get the lay of the land.
You’ll receive a coupon good for one POD hardback copy of the Dark Trails RPG as close to cost as possible through DriveThruRPG once fulfillment begins. You will also receive a complimentary copy of the Dark Trails RPG PDF (fulfilled through DriveThruRPG once fulfillment begins). You will also receive one copy of the Dark Trails RPG quick-start rules PDF.
Note: This pledge level was created for folks who live out of the United States to help avoid heavy shipping costs. You are still responsible for shipping costs which will be charged by way of DriveThruRPG from the closest facility to your country

support.title: Nighthawk 2 (we made a boo boo*)
support.descp:
You ain’t from around here, but that won’t stop you from fillin’ anything sprouting tentacles with lead! Just keep your wits about you till you get the lay of the land.
You will receive one print on demand (POD) hardback copy of the Dark Trails RPG fulfilled by DriveThruRPG. You will also receive a complimentary PDF copy of the Dark Trails RPG (fulfilled through DriveThruRPG).
This pledge level also entitles you to all digital stretch goals, including a PDF copy of the quick-start rules.
Note: This pledge level was created for folks who live outside the United States to help avoid expensive shipping. You are still responsible for shipping costs for which you will be invoiced at the time of fulfillment from the POD facility closest to your address.
*This is a revised reward. Unfortunately, we can't edit a reward level once it receives a pledge and the original Nighthawk reward contained a mistake. See the FAQ for more info.

support.title: Desperado
support.descp:
Folks might say a lot of things about ya’, but one thing they can’t say is that you show up to the big dance dressed in rags. Fighting evil is paramount, but so’s lookin’ good when you get in the thick of a good scrap.
You’ll receive a limited-edition hardback copy of the Dark Trails RPG shipped directly to you. This will be a leatherette version of the book with foil stamping on the spine and cover and an embossed, or debossed logo. Rest assured the book will be a gorgeous volume with a full-on Western look and feel.
In addition to the limited-edition hardback, you’ll receive a complimentary copy of the Dark Trails RPG PDF (fulfilled through DriveThruRPG once fulfillment begins). Pledging at this level also qualifies you for all physical and digital stretch goals and a copy of the Dark Trails RPG quick-start PDF. Pledge levels here and higher that receive physical items will be charged shipping at the time of fulfillment.

support.title: Gunslinger
support.descp:
You were known to get into the thick of it before things went bad, and now that the shadows often come equipped with claws and teeth, you figure it’s best to carry a backup for times when your fat’s in the fire!
You’ll receive one copy of the standard hardback Dark Trails RPG along with one copy of the limited-edition hardback Dark Trails RPG shipped directly to you, and you’ll also receive a complimentary copy of the Dark Trails RPG PDF (fulfilled through DriveThruRPG once fulfillment begins).
Pledging at this level also qualifies you for all physical and digital stretch goals and a copy of the Dark Trails RPG quick-start PDF. Shipping will be charged at the time of fulfillment.

updates.update_userinfo: One Tube to Rule Them All
updates.update_content:
Heya, everyone!

I wanted to wait until the last minute tonight to post an update, in hopes I'd have something super cool to share with you on the core book. Sadly, I don't have the news I thought I would, but I do have some cool news, so let's get the core book update out of the way first?
As I wrote about in the last update, we're in the final stages of readying the document to go to print. Some things were apparent while we were going through the final pass. First, Gilbert commented on some of the pages having too much "white space", which I agreed with. I'm way over budget on art, so I'd hoped we could get by with it, but when Gilbert brought it up I knew it needed to be addressed and immediately hired some of the regular Weird Frontier artists to kick something out fast, and the end result is the art that will fill up those ugly pages with too much "empty". Take a look at a couple of the pieces.

Heya!

I just wanted to give you guys an update on where things are right now. It has mostly been a waiting game to get the final edits plugged in and turned in to Matt for layout. We've taken everything that folks have submitted by way of the living bug-squashing document and added the things we found on our own to make one master list. While there were a few that were left out we still made a long list of changes to make to the document. 
The list of changes was submitted to Matt to plug into the layout this week and he's already gotten the document back to me. The only thing that remains is to make one last pass and make the index. As you can tell by the size of the document this is no small task, but we're on it and I'm hoping we'll be wrapped up by end of next week. Once we have the index I'll get the updated PDF to you and also submit the document to the printer.

I have the correct color dice on hand from Chessex and the dice bags were delivered today.  I hope you like the bags! I loaded one up for its modelling shoot and it comfortably ate 225 d6's, so you'll have plenty of space for those bones you love to throw.

I wanted to send out a quick update that relates to any third-party publishers that may be interested in creating something for the Weird Frontiers RPG. Those of you that are familiar with DCC/ MCC published by Joseph Goodman of Goodman games probably already know that Joseph supports, and often carries zines, adventures, and related merch created by third-party publishers.  Weird Frontiers wouldn't exist were it not for Joseph's generosity and strong desire to create such a broad and creative community!
I'll be following in Joseph's footsteps by offering the same option to those aspiring to create their own material for the Weird Frontiers RPG following the OGL that can be found in the back of the Weird Frontiers RPG, or the DCC/ MCC books.

I wanted to drop an update on you today to let you know what we've been up to since the release of the PDF document.  Before I get started I want to remind everyone that the PDF is currently out for backers, so if you haven't received it please reach out to me by way of a message here, or by e-mail at weirdfrontiersrpg@gmail.com

Typo Hunt- I'll be finishing up going through the document this evening looking for anything that needs a small tweak, or for typos. I'll be submitting my list to Gilbert Isla to compile with the online document you folks have been gracious enough to submit for us! I'll leave the ability to report any bugs open until this Sunday,  April 11th, so submit anything you find by following the link

updates.update_userinfo: Map and PDF Typos, Dice and Dice Bags
updates.update_content:
Hey Guys,
I wanted to drop a quick update to keep you up to date with things. Please remember that we are looking for typos we may have missed during the editing process. I'm sure we have quite a few, considering the page count of the book, so please take some time to read through and if you find something check the online form to see if it has already been noted. If you don't see the error take the time and let us know what you've found? Once we go to the printer I won't be able to make corrections, so any amount of time you can spend on the document is a HUGE help!

Hey Everyone!

It's getting late, so I'm going to make this one real short. I haven't heard from my Pledgemanager folks today and I'd hoped to send out the map through their site, however, I also said I'd have it out by today, so I fooled around with DriveThru and finally figured some things out that were needed to send the file out.

updates.update_userinfo: Help us reel in any typos
updates.update_content: Hey guys! I hope you're finding something cool within the pages of the PDF. So far, the feedback has been very kind and I can't tell you what that means to the folks that have worked on the book. As many times as we've gone over it, there are still going to be things that slipped past us, so we need your help! If you take any time in the next 30 days to read through the book and spot something wrong, please take a moment and use the link provided to leave us a note. It would mean a lot if you would make sure the suggestion hasn't already been made before posting. Here's the link Squash the Typo

I just wanted to send a follow-up to tell everyone to check their e-mail for anything from Pledgemanager today. I have been getting notified that the document is going out, so you should have it very shortly! Feel free to let me know and have a great weekend!

Dave

I wanted to make a quick update amidst trying to get prepared for Goodman Games upcoming Spawn of Cyclops Con to give you some news I think you'll appreciate. The PDF is complete and ready to be uploaded and sent out! We're so excited for you to get a peek at what we've been working on! I hope you guys will find some things you love about it!

I plan to use Pledgemanager to send the PDF out, so please check your spam if you don't have anything by tomorrow night. My hopes are that I can upload it in the morning and send it out around lunchtime! This is my first go at sending something out this route, and we may end up going through DriveThru, but for now, it'll be less of a headache to use PM.

campaign.story:
Beholden to the gods of dice and dungeons, Eldritch Foundry brings miniatures from the far reaches of the outer planes. But not any miniatures. Our expert team of Gnome Wizards work tirelessly to bring the most customizable and powerful figures for your character. Our sleek, seamless, flash-less miniatures are unrivaled in appearance and each is blessed by a team of Clerics. 
    Can’t find the perfect miniature for your Dwarven Fighter?  
Eldritch Foundry.
    Are the only miniatures available carrying a broadsword instead of a warhammer? 
Eldritch Foundry.
    Is the figure’s beard too short for your perfect avatar? 
Eldritch Foundry.
    Through dark and forbidden rituals, we have given you, the player, the ability to select everything about your character. Complete customization is now in the hands of the player. Whatever hands, head, tail, wings, clothes, weapons, and practically anything else you can think of, we can do. Even the most mundane of coin purses will look amazing on your character – through our high-quality 3D printing.  
 This project combines everything you want from a miniature - the original creative art, with the best quality that can be found for a customized unique printed miniatures.
*Warning: Miniatures may contain bonus Experience Points 
     The Eldritch Foundry has partnered with the leading US 3D printer manufacturer, 3DSystems, and our in-house printers utilize the most advanced technology available on the market. As such, we are printing at a quality that is substantially higher than anyone else. We print at about 40% higher definition than anyone else on the market.
Most miniatures currently available on the market are printed at around 50 microns. An Eldritch Foundry miniature is printed at around 32 microns. In addition, we use wax supports. This process means your miniatures will have no flash, no mold lines, and no seams. 
       Our character creator interface is like nothing you’ve seen before, except perhaps in video games. We have developed a one-of-a-kind character creator to a look and feel that closely resembles the character creators in Baldur’s Gate, Planescape, Torment, or even Skyrim (well, at least the starting bit). The interface is intuitive and easy to use, while providing for a maximum level of customization for your miniature.
    Each and every character choice, from race and class, to armor and weapons, has a unique lore associated with it. We have partnered with several brilliant writers (most notably- the amazing Patrick Stuart!) to create a lore that is as unique as our character creator. 
    This process, from the unique character creator to the expansive and in-depth lore,  makes creating a high quality and custom miniature more immersive and helps create a world-building experience.
       We have developed the first and only conditional marker base for your miniatures. This base allows for the quick and easy identification of conditional statuses of your character, without the need for conditional rings or milk jug rings. The conditions available on your unique Eldritch Foundry miniature base include poisoned, restrained, concentration, deafened, petrified, grappled, blinded, and frightened. We have even provided conditional marker bases that are blank, if you prefer to draw your own. We’ll even have an option where you can choose which conditions you want on your base (but that’s a bit more down the line).
      In order to bring you the finest quality miniatures, every piece is first individually drawn by gentle hands of our Tiefling concept artists. Then, these sketches are animated, given sentience, and turned into 3-dimensional models.  Our miniatures are then crafted from these models by an expert team of Gnome Wizards. This process is designed to bring you the highest-quality, unique, and magically enchanted miniatures possible. 
      To bring you more, we must first provide offerings to the lords of darkness and miniatures, who enslave hapless concept artists for no less than 99 years. These concept artists provide us with all the exquisite art, in order to bring the most realistic and beautifully rendered miniatures to you, the player.  Through this project we intend to bring you more items, races, mounts, perhaps a campaign setting, and even a little thing we think of as "the bits box".
       The Eldritch Foundry's founders are gamers, like you. We would like to let gamers take their character from the imaginary and make them a reality. To provide miniatures of the highest quality, both in the form of the model and in the quality, while using the latest in 3D printing quality available. More than that, table-top gaming is a community experience. As such, we provide services both with online sales and through friendly local gaming stores.  
Enjoyable and intuitive site - for the quick and easy customization of your characters.
Unique and original craftsmanship -of all the items, armor, weapons, clothes, and accessories your character will ever need.
Built-in status indicator bases - for quick and easy identification of character status' 
New origin lore written for Eldritch Foundry - making the character creation process much more immersive and interesting. 
Quality 3D printing - showing the finest detail available on the market, exactly as designed by you, the player.
      The Eldritch Foundry, a group of nerds and geeks dedicated to bringing the most unique and customizable miniatures available. We are committed to improving your games. And we are enthusiastic about our mission.
The Eldritch Foundry loves the TTRPG community- and acts on it with a business model that is geared towards helping your local gaming store thrive. We incentivize foot traffic by offering free shipping if you send your avatar to your local gaming store. We share in every miniature sale made within store grounds, and for every miniature sent to stores.
Retailers- feel free to reach out, we'd love to discuss this in person!
Our partner FLGS, Knight's Watch Games:
  "Eldritch Foundry is a revolutionary company that bridges the gap between producers, retailers and customers.  The ability for a customer to design, purchase and pick-up their customized miniature at the brick and mortar store facilitates better relationships between buyer and seller, guarantees a better shopping experience, and higher customer satisfaction. The immersive process of personalizing a character and reading the powerful descriptions for the various options makes building your dream character super entertaining!" - Brenda and Paraic Mulgrew of Knight's Watch Games
The Eldritch Foundry is a firm believer that the TTRPG community is just that- a community. We strive to work with everybody- from stores, to local artists, to gaming streams, and beyond. As such, we've begun partnering with the D4 D&D stream (go check them out!) to provide their gaming miniatures.
We've also started working with artists from the community which we love- first and foremost- the Griffon's Saddlebag (you can see his Retaliating Shield on some of our minis, even!).
      Based on past experience, we will be charging shipping after the Kickstarter concludes, based on the actual costs incurred to ship. We will collect this via our pledge manager after the campaign ends. This is so we can be fair to all our backers as shipping is rarely one size fits all.
US shipping (to your local gaming store)- FREE!
Rest of the world - shipping will cost $10.
 What is the Eldritch Foundry?
      We are two friends, who quit our day jobs, and founded Eldritch Foundry. We provide miniatures of the highest quality, both in the form of your miniature’s model and in the quality, while using the latest in 3D printing technology available. This process will give your miniatures a sleek, seamless, flash-less appearance not available in any other product on the market.
How do the miniature coupons work?
      All rewards for “custom miniature coupon(s)” are presented as coupons, and as such, are good indefinitely. This allows you to redeem at any point and even for future releases and features.  
When will the Miniatures Ship?
      Tricky question! Our full Character Foundry will be up and running August 1st, when we debut at Gen Con. We are currently gunning for a weeks turnaround (1-2 days to print, 3-6 days of shipping in the US), but a two week turnaround is a bit more likely (especially if we have a huge backlog). 
It should be noted that we will be adding more and more items, races, weapons and… stuff(?) as time progress, so if you have a specific idea for your mini, look up our development schedule on our site!
What about international shipping?
      Shipping to the US is free of charge. Shipping to Western Europe is going to add about 10$ on top of your pledge level.
How do I select more than one pledge goal?
     In Kickstarter you can only really select one pledge goal, but no worries. If none of the pledge levels are just right, pick the one closest to what you want, and you can adjust upwards later in our backer kit. 
Retailers - What are the typical cost of an Eldritch Foundry miniature in a retail store?
      Our current pricing point for a single miniature is about MSRP 35$. The conditional marker base should add another 10$ on top of that. Oversized models will run you about 10$ extra. 
We’re still looking into “bits” pricing and quantities, so that’s a big WIP right now.
     New to Kickstarter? No problem! Just follow these simple steps: 
This project is promoted by Green Inbox
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
1) Development challenges

 We have been accepted as exhibitors at Gen Con 2019. As such, we have a hard deadline to have our character creator site up and running by August 2019. With this in mind, our current plan is to launch as soon as possible, with various additional features being introduced later on in the development phase. These additional features, which are being considered non-essential for initial launch, are thus marked down as a phase 2. For example, these additional features consist of features like “bits” purchasing and social media sharing with cool filters are lower on our priority list.
 In all regards, development of the product is largely complete with high-quality highly detailed miniatures. This project is intended to raise capital in financially reasonable way.


2) Asset creation:

 Our asset creation timeline is very much dependent on how successful the Kickstarter campaign is. Our current funding is enough to let us reach Gen Con 2019 with an already assembled asset library of high Fantasy weapon and armor sets, and the base races of Humans, Elves (& half-Elves), Dwarves, Goliaths and Halflings.
 The greater our success, the faster we hope to add additional assets and features to the system. However, there is an upper limit to how fast we can add additional assets, while still maintaining a high-quality of production. We will have a production schedule posted on our home website once we see how far ahead, we are. This will allow Eldritch Foundry fans to come and see new products and plan ahead for when their favorite race and genres come online.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Anime Mini Mad Jester Wendel
Anime Miniatures from Hyper Minis

I started modeling and sculpting my own 3D chibi anime miniatures during Christmas time in 2018. The journey that brought me to this point was that I had already collected all of the sets of chibi minis I could find on the market to paint for my D&D campaign, but I found out that the company I was following would no longer be making minis.
I love playing D&D, but once I had set my sights on a more anime style, the usual minis just wouldn't cut it. The first 5 minis in the Starter Pack are actually the original 5 players' characters in the campaign I'm currently running.
There are a few reasons I'm running this campaign. The first is that I invested some start up funds in getting together the illustrations for these ten. I plan to invest funds from this campaign into more illustrations for future projects.
The second reason is that I plan to look into more tools like a drawing tablet, zBrush, which I see many others in the space using with amazing results, and increased marketing efforts to build a social media presence I can go to for ideas and inspiration.
My final reason for running this project is a very long way out, but I've been inspired by fantasy board games that use minis like these and I'd like to one day make my own. If I can continue to create models and illustrations, it will be that much easier to convert them into collectible characters. 
Please Note: This campaign IS NOT for a boardgame, and it IS NOT for physical merchandise. The rewards include digital .STL files for 3D printing and .PNG files for digital art.
Magnetic Modular Japanese Gate Wall
I created this Japanese Gate set to appeal to anyone-not just fans of minis. Each piece is designed with a hole that you can drop a magnet in before gluing the roof on.
*Miniatures for Scale - Credit to Ninja Division
Japanese Wall Gate Miniature Terrain
*Miniature for scale. I did create this miniature; she's available for Free on Thingiverse.
*Miniatures for scale. Credit goes to WizKids (I think that's the name of the official D&D minis...)

https://www.impactminiatures.com/
https://www.facebook.com/impact.miniatures/

Anime Mini Faerie Dragon Aleris
2. This model of my real life cat, Sammy! To get this one, go find the Facebook post at  https://www.facebook.com/HyperMinis 
If you like and share the post, and then message me your email address, I'll email all 6 of the Sammy Cat Clan right to you!
Now, Let's Get To The Heroes!
Pirate Warlock Sereva:
Anime Mini Pirate Warlock Sereva
Anime Miniature Pirate Warlock Sereva
Sereva comes from a family of very wealthy merchants, but her own father had her kidnapped by pirates at a young age for acting too free spirited; a quality he feared in Sereva’s mother. 
Rather than act like a damsel in peril, Sereva put her leadership skills and business savvy to work and was able to become the captain of the pirates who once captured her.
Sereva derives her magical abilities from a mermaid spirit she made a pact with out at sea and believes she is destined to find the magical item said to control the very waves: The Heart of the Sea.
Steadfast Fighter Cimon:
Anime Mini Steadfast Fighter Cimon
 From the northern reaches of Andraste, Cimon serves the Kingdom of the walled city of Locaste with great pride. The brother of an exiled fortune teller and a dragon master, he grew up struggling to make an honorable name for his family.
Cimon’s blue scimitars hold a secret. Sent to him by his mysterious brother, he continues to find clues about his own path, and that of his family.
The swords themselves aren’t the only piece of the puzzle. The note that came with them included writing from his brother, but also writing from an unidentified source.
Orphan Rogue Mahi:

Mahi is a young wood elf who was orphaned at a very young age. Not knowing her parents, she grew up feeling isolated and was met with great hardship even trying to find daily meals.
Naturally, she honed her skills to ensure her survival. Stealing food meant living another day, and this is what drove her forward.
Mahi enrolled in the military and protects her kingdom to achieve her two simple goals: Get 3 square meals a day and find friends to share them with.
Alice of Ravens:
 Alice grew up in a large family with five older siblings. Being the youngest in the bunch, she found herself overshadowed by their vast range of talents.
Once her family moved from the magical floating city of 
Eukalade to the non-magical walled city of Locaste, Alice dearly missed the days she could cast magic freely.
She strategically joined the military to gain access to the few areas of the walled city where magic was permitted and began to master her techniques with her raven staff in hand.
Nature's Protector Odessa:
 Odessa spent her childhood growing up within Locaste’s thirty walls. Coming from a family of bakers, fighting was never in her blood.
She got a taste for protecting others when a large, rabid dog broke loose and started attacking some nearby children.
Following her faith of the goddess Archena, Odessa decided on her paladin oaths and set forth to make the country safer for all.
Lolita Vampire Lobelia:
 Little is known about Lobelia the vampire; she seems to come and go as she pleases. It is rumored that she’s a fearsome fighter, but nobody seems to be able to provide an eye-witness account.
In truth, this playful devil loves to mess around with her “toys”—a word she uses to describe the unsuspecting victims of her games.
Her parasol keeps her safe from the sun’s harsh rays, but she’ll use it as a masterful weapon when the need arises.
Deadly Smile Ellie:
 Ellie suffered her first defeat at the age of three when her entire family was murdered by bandits. Sadness was never an option for her; there was one lesson to learn.
“The strongest are the killers, and they’re the ones that survive.”
This mantra fueled her every decision and she soon found herself standing atop a metaphorical mountain of the hundreds of lives she had taken.
“You certainly look strong. Let’s play a little...”
Plague Doctor Rust:
 If you’ve ever received treatment from Rust, consider yourself among the lucky ones. Rumors of this mysterious, seemingly decrepit man are many and varied, but it’s agreed that anyone who sees the shadows that follow him will die.
Rust will not talk to you, and it’s unknown if he’s even able to speak at all. He’s been seen deep in speechless conversation with small animals and birds, but one has to wonder if he looks upon them with evil intentions.
Just what is in those potions of his?
Healing Scripture Basil:
 Basil: the gentle angel sent from the heavens. His calm demeanor is certain to put you at ease as he remedies your ailments with his powerful healing magic, but you can’t help but wonder what his personal goals might actually be.
While the young angel appears to be an ally of the kingdom, he’s said to have been seen healing the crown’s enemies. Is he just so kind that he’s willing to heal those who are good and evil, or is there something deeper behind his actions?
“I’ve ensured you’ll all survive, but I must ask that you be more careful in the future.”
Rain of Fire Kress:
 Kress grew up in the western country of Robur. Here, his family has been stationed on the giant wall called the Thievesguard, where their sworn duty is to keep the thieves of the country Genii from invading their allied nation of Lenus.
Kress understands the importance of his duty on the wall, but what he truly wants is a change of scene. Channeling his innate magic to bring fire to the skies with his bright arrows, Kress tries his best to stay distracted from boredom.
“The wall’s greatest strength is it’s ability to stand still forever—my greatest disappointment.”
Stretch Goals
Please note that I do not already have the illustrations completed for the stretch goals, as I'm relying on the success of this project to finance them. On the launch of this campaign, I've finished 4/6 of my originally planned stretch goal models in multiple poses, and I'm working on the final 2.
If the project surpasses all of my stretch goals, I will come up with more.
[LOCKED] $1500 Stretch Goal: Thousand Fists Orka | 3 Poses

[LOCKED] $2000 Stretch Goal: One-Man Fortress Goldar | 2 Poses + Helmet Variant

[LOCKED] $2500 Stretch Goal: Summer Solstice Folia | 2 Poses

[LOCKED] $3000 Stretch Goal: Tricky, Tricky
[LOCKED] $5000 Stretch Goal: Musical Twins
Credits:
All of the illustration work was done by Kari, who you can find at:  https://www.facebook.com/karissamoloney/ 
The music I used in my video was provided by Brenden Obuck, who you can find at:  https://brendenobuck.com/ 
Special thanks to my girlfriend Alex for her fantastic mini painting work!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The format of providing 3D-printable digital files means minimal risk for me. At the time of launch, the only possible risks I see pertain to the stretch goals. I have 4 of them sculpted already, but I am relying on the success of this project before investing in illustrations, so timelines are a little more up in the air on those.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

So I'm sitting here thinking about how this is my first Kickstarter and I realize: 
"Why would someone pledge for the stretch goals if it doesn't look like we're going to reach any?"
Rookie Mistake, Zack! Here's what I'm going to do instead, as I LOVE my supporters. I'm going to create 4 additional miniatures to give to anyone in the $20 category REGARDLESS of whether or not we hit those stretch goals.

campaign.story:
Goal
Hello! Our goal is to create a wide variety of high quality 3D printable miniatures priced affordably for $1!

Beginning
We are starting off with our $1 Miniature Set - Viking Raiders. If you back this set we will send the images displayed to one of our partnering professional 3D modelers, who will turn our sketches into 3D printable models for you!

Future
We have a voting page with access renewed monthly. If you select to back our project with a tier including voting rights you will gain access to our SCoFA page for the month the Quickstarter ends + the following month. We will submit ideas for future models to our SCoFA page for decisions on what models we should pursue next, as well as votes for other things we are working on.
We will also make all model miniature sets available on our website once they are developed, and you have our word that any models made under our $1 Miniature Set title will always remain $1 for everyone forever.

Ancient Cityscape
Our $10 tier includes a 50% off ($10 coupon) for our modular city core set. This is available on our website, and is comprised of 17 .stl 3D print files allowing you to build a custom ancient city. It also includes all tiers before it.
If you are interested, we have plans to develop a lot of add-on sets for this which we will make available in the future!
www.iungogames.com
Our $20 tier includes a 100% off ($20 coupon) for our modular city core set. Plus it includes a $3 coupon (worth 3 models) to our Grid Crates terrain scenery models. It also includes all tiers before it (*with the exception of the $10 coupon, as this is an upgrade to that).

Stretch Goals!
Available to all backers $3 and up! 
For every $200 increment above our Goal, you will receive another printable model!
We will hold votes with our SCoFA Voting Members to decide what these Stretch Goal models will look like. Next, we will develop the models with the Stretch Goal Kickstarter funds, and then will deliver them, in addition to our Viking Raiders set, to you!

Why are there double Tiers?
This is our very first Kickstarter, and we forgot to add clear stretch goals at the outset of our campaign! Once someone backs a tier we become unable to edit it, so we had to create duplicate tiers to add the Stretch Goal reward to them.

The Viking Raiders
We paid an artist to illustrate these three characters (Viking Raiders), and with our goal funded we will work with our partnering 3D modeler to make them 3D printable model miniatures!
We had a poll in which our backers voted to decide what position/pose they want these models to be in, and we have updated the illustrations to what they voted on!

Horns on the Helmets
We received feedback from our backers, almost half of them, would prefer a version of the models without horns on the helmets. Our 3D modeler has agreed to create this variation on the two models with helmets for an additional $20. We will pay this extra cost, and deliver both versions of the models to any backers of either the Sword Raider or the Axe Raider! So for backing 1 model, you will receive both variations!

Check out the illustrated character!

Examples From Our Partnering 3D Modeler
Here are several example images of our partnering artist's work, so that you can see what level of detail to expect! This is the link to his Fiverr page, with 24 '5 Star' reviews!

Other Recommended Kickstarters
If you have time you should check these out!

Custom terrain for Warhammer, 40K, Mordheim, Dungeons & Dragons, more ...

campaign.story:
Animal Adventures brings intelligent animal character to your favourite fantasy roleplaying game! Cats and Catacombs is the second in a planned series of Animal Adventures releases! It is a set of highly detailed miniatures combining some your favourite cat breeds with different classes of the fifth edition of the world's greatest roleplaying game!
Hesta, Indy and Pawkus prepare for a new adventure.
This set features not only the miniatures in preassembled ready-to-play or paint PVC, but also a bespoke set of fifth edition compatible rules for using your Animal Adventure miniatures and playing as cats in ANY campaign setting.
Solan, Whisper and Pawkus lead the way!
You will be able to mix feline characters with your regular adventuring party or create an entire team of kitty heroes to save the world! The miniatures also make perfect companions and familiars for your existing characters in any fantasy setting or game.
Dare you enter the lair of the Necromeowncer?
Indy the Ragdoll Bard
Our range of feline characters are true cats, four legged companions true of heart and pure of souls! We have chosen to further our range of 'non-humanoid' minis to offer as much of a unique play experience as we possibly could.
Each cat has been lovingly designed and sculpted, by some serious cat fans, to be bursting with personality and detail. From the rune engraved robes of Hesta, the Wizard, to the Twin Fish of Harmony & balance on Han, the Monk, care has been taken to add charm and sophistication to every model.
Pawkus the Bobtail Barbarian
Whisper the Sphynx Sorcerer
Solan the Persian Warlock
Brook the Scottish Fold Cleric
Hesta the Abyssinian Wizard
The Necromeowncer
The Meow! Pledge $35/£27
After the success and the incredible feedback we received with our last campaign with Dungeons and Doggies, we have chosen to keep the same simple formula as it makes it easy for us to support and also ensures a smooth and swift delivery.
The Meow! Pledge brings you 13 kitty miniatures along with the Rules and Adventure Companion PDF's as well as art prints from our incredible art team!
Rather than include stretch goals that would complicate the process, in an attempt to encourage more participation, we are keeping things really easy with only one pledge level, that gets you everything we can cram into this campaign!
The future is looking very bright for Animal Adventures, and with your continued amazing support we are going to be bringing more animals on many more adventures!
The cats are all designed to go on 20mm bases and scaled to fit in with existing RPG miniature ranges. And, although we are providing full rules to create your own kitty adventures, each miniature comes with its own pre-generated character, complete with character sheet and short story! Whether you fancy being Verdandi, the Norwegian forest druid or Brook, the Scottish fold cleric, there's a cat for every player.
Alongside our range of miniatures, we are proud to present and include in our campaign a full set of digital rules and a unique adventure that provides a perfect setting for a great one-shot RPG experience, for absolutely free!
Our rules set contains OGL fifth edition racial rules for creating a courageous cat, unique feline feats and class options, feline feats and class options, notes on the Welcoming Dark, the Special Demiplane of cats,  world lore and trickster patrons and a host of feline magic items for your heroes to bat about and knock off shelves! 
The accompanying adventure, titled "The Lair of the Necromeowncer", is designed to be played either with the characters included in the rules or with any party of equivalent level (even dogs!) and tells of a dark magic at work deep underground, where sinister arcane power and mad science threaten devastation and ruin!   
Russ Charles is part of the team and principal sculptor behind Painting & Polygons which brought you Dungeons and Doggies! Russ has worked in the games industry for many years and has contributed to projects as wide ranging as Reaper Bones, Dr Who, Warmachine, Resident Evil 2, Guild Ball, Critical Role and more recently the Humblewood D&D setting. He currently works full time as lead in-house sculptor for SFG. 
Featuring stunning art from the likes of April Prime, who's previous work includes the excellent Baby Bestiary for Metal Weave Games and also our very own Dungeons and Doggies! We'd also like to welcome Vikki Gavrilenko to the team who has worked on DC's Injustice 2!
If you would like to find out more about the work both these amazing artists have produced then give them a follow on Twitter.
 www.artstation.com/april-prime, or by following her on Twitter, @April_Prime
 www.artstation.com/viccolatte, or by following her on Twitter, @viccolatte  
Also returning from the Dungeon and Doggies project is Kate who provided us all with the wonderful tales and lore that we all adored and Baz n' Gaz who provide us with the rules and mechanics allowing our animal friends to really come to life! 


Shipping will be charged after the Kickstarter finishes based on actual costs incurred to ship and is collected via our pledge manager system. This allows us to charge fairly for all backers and avoid a 'one size fits all' mentality to shipping 
We will ship your pledges to several hubs around the world at our cost. Your pledge will arrive via one of the following hubs: 

United Kingdom (UK, Europe **and Rest of the World backers) 
USA (US backers)  
Canada (Canada backers) 

Below are our initial rough estimates for shipping the sets. These are just estimates, and may change:  
UNITED KINGDOM: £6. Channel Islands, Highlands and NI £6-£13  
USA: £7-£11 to the contiguous US and the US Virgin Islands. £17-20 to Alaska, Hawaii,         and Puerto Rico.  
CANADA: £7-£15 to most cities.  
EUROPE: £8-£20 to most countries. £20-£30 to non-EU countries.  
LATIN AMERICA: £25-£40 to most countries.  
ASIA: £15-£25 to most countries.  
OCEANIA: £9-£18 to Australia and New Zealand.  
AFRICA/OTHER: £25-£50 to most countries.

Unfortunately, different import laws and customs mean we are unable to ship pledge rewards to the following countries: 
Afghanistan, Argentina, Belarus, Bolivia, Brazil, Burma, Burundi, Central African Republic, Chile, Colombia, Costa Rica, Democratic Republic of the Congo, Ecuador, Egypt, Eritrea, Falkland Islands, French Guiana, French Polynesia, Republic of Guinea, Republic of Guinea-Bissau, Gyana, Iran, Iraq, Lebanon and Syria, Libya, Mali, Martinique, Mexico, New Caledonia, North Korea, Paraguay, Peru, Puerto Rico, Reunion Island, Somalia, South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands, South Sudan, Sudan, Suriname, Syria, The Republic of Maldives, Tunisia, Ukraine, Uruguay, Venezuela, Yemen, Zimbabwe, the Canadian province of Quebec and American State of Rhode Island.
If your country is listed above we hope to be able to offer this product to you at retail but are unable to commit to shipping to these territories during the Kickstarter. 
Whilst we will strive to deliver your rewards in a timely manner, you may not receive your reward before the product is available for purchase at retail, or other promotional opportunities such as conventions. We have ensured that the pledge reward offered is packed with fantastic value and Kickstarter exclusives to compensate for any potential delays. However, if this unacceptable to you, please do not back this project and instead wait for the retail release. Thank you for your understanding. 
Any pledges confirmed after our pledge manager deadline will be shipped from the UK hub at a later date and will likely incur increased shipping costs.  
** There is a degree of uncertainty on the UK's future trade relationship with the EU due to Brexit. In the event no custom's friendly agreement is reached when it is time to fulfil this Kickstarter, an alternative hub will be sourced for EU fulfilment. 
 We are unable to ship to PO Boxes.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
=========
Challenges
=========

This is now our second Kickstarter project, even though our first project met all expectations and was a success, we are fully aware of the potential delays that may happen with products that are produced in China, the common ones being delays in production, shipping, and customs.

We have estimated delivery for January 2020, but please understand this is only an estimate. Due to the global logistics involved in shipping, some regions may receive their pledges sooner than others.

=======
Refunds
=======

We have prepared as much as possible with our production for a successful Kickstarter; however, we will refund pledges if for some unforeseen reason the product cannot be delivered at all.

Refunds may be given within 60 days of the campaign ending, including fees. After that time, refunds may be given minus the Kickstarter and payment processing fees, as we will not be able to claim those back after 90 days.

We are unable to issue refunds once we have begun the packaging and shipment stages of the project (around 6–8 weeks before the actual shipping date).

Refunds within 60 days are reversed via Stripe to your credit/debit card. Refunds after 60 days of the campaign ending are processed via PayPal only.

This is a GBP Kickstarter and refunds will be processed in GBP for the amount received, excluding any applicable fees dependent on the day on which the refund is processed as detailed above.

=================
Terms and Conditions
=================

If you do not confirm your shipping and pledge details within 10 weeks of our notification via email to confirm them, your pledge will be treated as abandoned. We will, however, look at each case sympathetically and try our best to satisfy each customer.

By pledging on this Kickstarter you agree that our responsibility to you is for shipping your order as entered into the pledge management system. You are responsible for import or other duties that may be payable to relevant tax authorities. You also accept that you are fully liable for incorrect shipping details and will risk your pledge being unable to be delivered or lost in transit.

By pledging on this Kickstarter you acknowledge that the final look and contents of the pledges may change and differ from what is presented at the start of the campaign.

If you do not accept the proposed terms please do not pledge on this Kickstarter project and wait for the global general release.


This project will be manufactured and distributed by SFG - the same company who did the manufacturing and distribution of Dungeons and Doggies.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Hear ye, hear ye!
Introducing Townsfolke 2: the Free Folke, a sequel to the original Townsfolke campaign that was funded in 2018. This time around we've got civilian/NPC miniatures from the varied fantasy races to help diversify your RPG/wargaming experience.
WHAT IS TOWNSFOLKE?
Townsfolke is a range of 3d-printable miniatures designed by us (Ill Gotten Games). This campaign is for the digital files (not finished miniatures). Townsfolke models (like much of our catalog) are designed to be easy to print at stock settings, and print without support material.
The miniatures from the core rewards printed in resin.
Each Townsfolke model can be printed with or without a textured base. Though optimized for stock FDM printing (with detail levels to match), you can print these models in resin as well (and can do so without support that way too).

WHAT DO I GET?
The base pledge ($15) gets you all 15 miniature files included in the core set:

IS THERE MORE?
You bet! Not only do we have an extensive range of existing Townsfolke sets available on our storefront (and included with a higher pledge level), but as we unlock stretch goals, every backer at the $25 level and higher will get bonus sets added to their haul. We'll update this space as stretch goals are revealed/added.

In addition to these new sets, we have an extensive range of Townsfolke sets that are currently available for purchase. These sets will also be added to pledges at the $70 level and higher.
Plus, we have a free starter set, featuring tavern patrons, town guards, a(n ominous looking) ferryman, and more!
And- we've released a special set, the Interplanar Dutchess with Pet Mimic, that's available for free via Thingivere! 

WHAT SCALE ARE THESE MINIATURES?
Townsfolke are firmly in the 32mm scale, which means they'll be compatible in size with Reaper Miniatures, CMON, modern Games Workshop models, Hero Forge, and most other contemporary/mainstream ranges. However, if you play in a specialty scale, you can easily re-size the models before printing. (If re-scaling, you'll probably want to print the base-free versions and base them afterward to keep fidelity with the rest of your collection.)
The guidelines above should work, but when in doubt, eyeball the scale change next to a model that you know is in the scale you want.

WHAT IF I DON'T HAVE A 3D PRINTER?
If you don't own a 3d printer (or know someone that does), some of our Patreon members are licensed to sell our Townsfolke models (along with the rest of our catalog of designs), and you can find a list of licensed printers here. It's not necessary for you to back this campaign to buy printed versions from our patrons, simply reach out to them and place an order!

MINIATURE GALLERY
Dwarf Traveler (on and off base) printed by Patreon supporter, Scott Frega
Various FDM prints (Ender 3) by Patreon supporter, Mike Sheridan.
Dwarf travelers on a journey, printed and painted by Patreon supporter, Stephen Renwick.
Pixie Pickpockets printed by Patreon supporter, Scott Frega
The Interplanar Dutchess taking Blue (her pet mimic) out for an off-leash stroll.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Any models we show have been successfully prototyped, so once funding clears, we'll be ready to deliver your rewards as promised.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Well, we did it again, folkes, and all thanks to you!
We hit the final stretch goal (Orcish Nobodies) in that last bit, so when funding comes through (takes Kickstarter a couple of weeks or so), we'll have the whole spread for you! Putting the finishing touches on the last couple of models, so we'll have an update before then.
Thanks again, and we'll be in touch,

Hey, folkes.
Well, we've met the Wood Elf Wedding stretch goal (which means it'll be added to all pledges at $25 and higher), and we've updated the page to include the next stretch goal, "Orcish Nobodies."

Just dropping by with a preview from the work bench. This is the ‘Florence Nightingale’ of the orc world, saving orc lives with her (t)rusty saw and a bottle of (what is assumed to be very weak) booze. She’ll be part of the ‘Orcish Nobodies’ stretch goal set (in regular and ‘pig-nosed/p’orc’ flavors). This’ll be next after we hit the Wood Elf Wedding.
More soon,
-Dutchmogul
