updates.update_userinfo: Relaunch on Monday! Preview Link Up
updates.update_content:
Things are progressing nicely for our relaunch on Monday, and as part of that I wanted to let you know & give you a chance to preview the new campaign.  If you like, you can take a look around and let me know what you think of the changes, and you can click the little '♥ Save' button in the upper-right hand corner, and Kickstarter will send you a message as soon as we launch so you can get in right away. Also, this link will automatically update to the campaign when we go live.  Click Here To Preview Now
Just as a quick review of the items that have been updated:
The Reward Levels have been updated, now with a Game/Minis level & a Game/Minis/Coins/Mat level to make it as easy as possible to get exactly what you want.

Hello friends, you may have noticed that I’ve canceled the campaign - for now. Terminus Breach will relaunch in 6 days on Monday December 10th, and will only run for 10 days. This was not an easy decision to make, and there are more than a few deciding factors.
At this point, it looks like we may fund, but just barely. While this is the goal of the campaign, and everything would be fine if that had happened (to be clear, this was not a clerical error), i realized that it was just not true to my vision of the game. Just barely funding would have meant the thinnest cards available, the thinnest cardboard box and board, and a folded paper insert. When this fact was staring me in the face, I realized that the game that I want you to have, the experience I want you to have when you play this game, was in jeopardy. I waited to see what kind of an effect the final 48 hours would have, but it was not as dramatic as we needed in order to ensure the quality of game you deserve, thus triggering the plan to cancel & reboot.

campaign.story:
Available at our Webstore. Click above.
The campaign is huge by standards and as such we have split it up into categories. We offer Dragons, Heroes, Regiments and Terrain, below you have a more visual breakdown of what is available.
So let us begin, let me show you through our wares, lets start with Dragons... 
                                                                                                                      Printing Dragon Body Video
 Printing Dragon Wings Video
     We have included 5 different dragons. Each dragon has 3 versions which are specially thought out for different modes of game play. We have included a 'Wargames', a 'RolePlay', and a 'Diorama' sculpt for each dragon. Pledge for '66€ Dragon Hoarder' and get all the dragons plus all the stretch goals.
 WARGAMES VERSION   
The Wargame version is meant to be used in tabletop battles along with other fantasy armies and regiments. These models are more pose constricted and carry a compatible wargame square base.  
ROLEPLAY VERSION  
The Roleplay version has a larger circular base and has a unique dynamic pose for each dragon, that is meant to be used when roleplaying with your RPG party. The dragons are sculpted without armor or harnesses as found natural in wilderness or dungeon.  
DIORAMA VERSION The Diorama is the most dramatic and dynamic of all the sculpt types and shows the dragon mid scene interacting with its environment. This model can be used in games, but it is meant for the modeller or painter that wishes to immortalize a scene on his mantle piece.   
FDM & SLA Samples
Dwarf Regiment 
The dwarf regiment comes with 2 command figures, a standard bearer and a musician. The 'Hero' pack above contains 2 additional figures, a dwarf hero and commander. There are 6 unique posed infantry miniatures to choose from bearing different weapons and combat styles.
IMPERIAL REGIMENT   
The Imperial regiment comes with 2 command figures, a standard bearer and a musician. The 'Hero' pack above contains 2 additional figures, a dwarf hero and commander. There are 6 unique posed infantry miniatures to choose from bearing different weapons and combat styles.   
Bridgton at 28mm with some of the houses printed at same scale.
Add-on to your current pledge to receive the reward after the campaign through our pledge manager. Example: current pledge 66Euro Dragon Hoarder + 88Euro for Jungle Fever = Total pledge 154Euro.
88€ Jungle Fever 
Check Kickstarer here: Jungle Fever.  
88€ All Roads Lead to Rome 
Check Kickstarter here: Rome.
PLAY

Dwarf War Blimp
All unlocked stretch goals will be rewarded with the pledging of any amount 66 Euro or over. The stretch goals will be slowly revealed as the project grows with your pledges.  
New stretch goals will be added along with renders and extra descriptions, so be sure to come back and review this page during its run. 
Make sure to spread the word and help us gain more backing so you can benefit from all the extra designs available through the stretch goal program. 
Renders and details for each individual goal will be included as the funding increases.
                                          Chris Spotts (The spotted Painter) 
PLAY

 Work for Half-orc Printing 
Credit &Thanks  
Paul Deeming (WOWBuildings)
We want to bring Paul Deeming to the attention of the backers. Paul has contributed much to this Kickstarter in terms of ideas and support. He prepared the main structure for the bridge model in 'Bridgeton' and 'The Tower Keep' piece. Apart from this he has contributed many of his own pieces so that I may re-master and present them as stretch goals in this Kickstarter, as co-sculpted editions of his work. Paul Deeming and Iain Lovecraft pieces, a Co-sculpting first for the 3D Printing community.
Paul Deeming is a very talented modeller who has a keen eye for architecture and emulating it in 3D. We have learnt from him that it is always best to over deliver on your kickstarters, something which he has done repeatedly on all his projects.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our forth Kickstarter and with three successful Kickstarters under our belt, so we are well versed with Kickstarter ways and envisage no problems.

Delivery dates are a rough guideline and we will always try to deliver before the estimated date proposed.

DIGITAL MEDIA: 
We strive to produce models that will print with as little support and parts as possible. Some models print in one go whilst most are split up into parts which must be printed separately and then assembled.

The file format of choice will be .STL and the models shall be zipped and made available to the user for download. The user is responsible for downloading their product and must have a valid internet connection and email with which to collect their reward, via internet download. We will keep the files on our system for at least three months after the first date of issue. The user must ensure that he collects the files within this time frame or risk forfeit.

Backers must realize that the resolution you obtain on your print is down to the system you use. Our high resolution files will give you almost render quality prints on high end SLA machines, whilst the same files will produce lesser resolution prints on standard FDM printers. At any rate, all the files have been previously tested on SLA and FDM printers and have shown satisfactory produce.

We recommend FDM Prints with at least a 400micron nozzle and 200 micron layer height for terrain. A 100 micron layer height will give you outstanding prints all round. We have also tested the files with larger nozzles, at 500 microns and decent results are possible on most prints, if the layer height and temperature is controlled correctly. 0.5(500 micron) nozzles are not recommended for miniature printing.

SLA printers should have no problems obtaining excellent resolution and finish even at 100 micron layer height although 50 micron layer height is recommended for minute sculpt detail clarity. We will try our best to split models so they will fit in smaller print beds like those found on SLA machines. Although miniatures and figurines can be split into smaller parts, large terrain pieces will require a standard 220x220mm print bed. Standard for FDM Printers like the 'Ender3'

We supply the user with a design that has been tested on conventional home hobby printers and is proven to print.

All the models are tested and sliced with 'Cura' software which is freeware and available to all backers for use. We recommend that backers use 'Cura' as it is fully tested with our models and we can offer customer support, if any problems are encountered. We are unable to give customer support for other slicing software and backers use this at their own risk. 

When using our digital media, we do not hold ourselves responsible for the production or manufacturing process of the design, this is exclusively up to the user.

Users may modify models and files at their own risk and only for their own personal use. Modified files are not guaranteed by us and as such, users do this under their own risk and know how.

The Images shown on the campaign page are just for visualization and although they may come very close, they are not an exact representation of the final design or printed model, which may vary.

We reserve the right to alter any of the models shown, at any time, before delivery, with the intent of improving the design, or efficiency of production.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi everyone,
We have updated the last release of the Dwarf War Blimp. Feel free to drop by your account and download the latest version of this fantastic model. Even after delivery, we seek to listen to your feedback and improve our models for you.
Modifications were made so that the model would print faster and more efficiently. Please find some renders of the model below.

Hi everyone,
We have updated the last release of the High Elven Tower. Feel free to drop by your account and download the latest version of this fantastic model. Even after delivery, we seek to listen to your feedback and improve our models for you.
Modifications were made so that the model would print faster and more efficiently. Please find some photos of our test prints for the model below.

Hi everyone,
We have reviewed the Blacksmith files we released a few weeks ago and have made some subtle changes to help improve printing and to modify the scale of the model slightly. Currently the scale of the model is at 32mm, but we have received feedback from backers who want the models kept at a 28mm standard.
The model has been changed to reflect this and is now at 28mm scale. The two top floors were reduced by approximately 20% and the bottom floor's height was reduced by 15% to better scale with 28mm miniatures.

Hi everyone,
Another great delivery and already giving out the last of the Stretch Goals. After finishing the delivery of our CORE packs, we are uploading most of the Stretch Goals. There are still a few key models left which we will be giving out during the next few weeks, but the end is in sight.
Notably the 'High Elven Tower' and 'Dwarf War Blimp' are receiving the finishing touches and will soon be delivered ready for printing!

Hi everyone,
Pleased to announce our scheduled weekly delivery, for our campaign, of the following files.
Bridgeton Houses
These can now be downloaded from your Lovecraft account page and are ready for you to print. This concludes the core level delivery for the Bridgeton pledge.

updates.update_content: Tomb Guardians just wanted to say hello and keep in touch.  A lot has occurred over the past year and we are excited to catch up with everyone.  Its hard to believe nearly a year has gone by since the dwarfs were released but time flies when your having fun!  We are excited to announce we are going to add 7 additional dwarfs to our collection early next year!   Those being, Female Dwarven Rouge, Dwarven Herbalist, Dwarven Barbarian, Female Dwarven Paladin, Female Dwarven Sorcerous, and 2 Dwarven Miners.  More details on their release to come later this year.

updates.update_userinfo: Monsters Are Shipping. Vampires on the Rise
updates.update_content:
Good Morning Everyone,
We have a few updates this morning and we are very excited. First, the monsters are here and we started shipping them yesterday and will continue over the next week or two. We appreciate your patiences and your support of our company. There are 4 pieces that still have not arrived but expected next week and those will be shipped. Those pieces are the Black Dragon, Mountain Ogre, Large Earth Elemental, and Treasure Hoard. Like we said those will be shipped shortly.
Lastly our Velraths Vampire Kickstarter campaign is in full motion. Our set of Vampires and undead Miniatures are outstanding. That set of Miniatures has funded and we hit our first stretch goal the other day. We will hit our second stretch goal very shortly. If you haven’t pledged hurry cause there is only 13 days left in this undead collection. Thank you again for all your support, we know there is a risk in supporting a new company but we would never leave you high and dry. Have a great day! To pledge our other campaign click below:

updates.update_userinfo: First Stretch Goal Announced On our Velrath's Vampire Kickstarter
updates.update_content: We are excited to announce our First Stretch goal in our Velrath's Vampire campaign!!!  We are off to a great start with now 50% of our goal obtained.  This is the first of 6 skeletons planned for our stretch goals.  The Skeleton with Axe, was sculpted by Bobby Jackson.  Help us raise these skeletons from the grave and pass the word onto everyone!  Hurry now to get all our stretch goals pledge today!

updates.update_userinfo: Velrath's Vampires Kickstarter is Now Live!
updates.update_content:
Velrath's Vampires Tomb is now Open!  Come and help raise the vampires and the army of the dead.  These 21 outstanding 28mm miniatures have been sculpted by Jason Wiebe, Bobby Jackson, and Patrick Keith.  
Click the link below to be directed:
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/tombguardians/queen-of-the-damned-velraths-vampires?ref=82t6yk

updates.update_userinfo: Queen of the Damned - Velrath's Vampires Kickstarter Opens Tomorrow!
updates.update_content:
Velrath's Vampires Queen of the Damned opens tomorrow morning at 8am EST/7am CST/5am PST!!! 
Prepare yourself for this amazing set of 28mm fantasy/horror miniatures!  There are 21 total miniatures set for this Kickstarter.  From Vampire heroes, such as a Vampire Queen to Vampire mage, from anti-paladine vampire knight to corrupted orcs and elfs.

updates.update_userinfo: KICKSTARTER: Queen of The Damned - Valreth's Vampires and Undead Army
updates.update_content: We are excited to inform everyone about our upcoming Kickstarter to be released March 12th, 2019!  Valreth's Vampires and undead army will include 20 metal 28-mm miniatures sculpted by Jason Weibe, Bobby Jackson and Patrick Keith!  Please join us and help raise these Vampires and undead army from their graves!  More details to come in the near future.

updates.update_userinfo: 2019 Is Upon Us and We Are So Excited!!!
updates.update_content:
We want to give our first update of the year cause we are excited about whats to come.  So we wont waste anyone's time and get right too it.   
1.  "The Queen of the Damned - Velrath's Vampires" release date has been set for of March 12th, 2019.  This Kickstarter release will include 10 Vampire Heroes, undead miniatures and other exciting features.  Further pictures and updates will come in the near future.
2.  Tomb Guardians wants to start the New Years with a special promotion and we know that with the holidays now over money is always tight in January.  So saying that, we are offering   This will end at midnight on January 31st.  We look forward to a great year with a lot of many new miniatures coming.

Happy New Years!!
Tomb Guardians wants to say thank you to everyone that has supported us this past year. We want everyone to use our miniatures this coming year and cant wait for the new line of miniatures to be released in March, May, July and October of this year!  So we are giving everyone $5.00 FREE DOLLARS to spend at our website to get any miniature you want. Offer ends on the 5th

The final days of our end of the year sale are approaching.  Only 2 days left to save 25% on all our products till December 31st!  Don't Wait or you will miss out!
1.  Go to our website, www.tombguardians.com, to order the figures you want today!  
2.  Use the discount code:  Kickstarter1825 at checkout to receive 25% off of your order.
Tomb Guardians wishes everyone a Safe and Happy New Years!    If you have any questions or ordering needs, you can email us at tombguardians@gmail.com

Tomb Guardians is proud to announce the Exclusive Collectible Painted Miniature Series!!!  
There will only be 100 of each miniature released that will be painted in this collection.  Cass Suwinski, the owner of Tomb Guardians Miniatures, has agreed to exclusively paint each one of these miniatures! The line of miniatures will come with their own authenticity papers, numbered, photographed, and signed by Cass Suwinski.  You need to hurry, because supplies won't last!!!

campaign.story:
The Quirky Feather Confectionery was a place unlike any other. By backing this project you will be able to always have a piece of The Quirky Feather in your home. From the classic favorites like Crossroad Cookies and S'mores Blondies to the most requested treats such as macraons and tiramisu, all of the recipes for your favorite treats will be included. 
Two versions will be available. The recipes only No Frills Edition, which will have simple spiral binding and  a no nonsense layout, is perfect for everyone but jerks, bigots, and people who take up more than one parking space who want to be able to make TQFC treats at home.
For people who loved the atmosphere and spirit of the Quirky Feather we are excited to offer the Recipes and Memories edition, which will not only include all of the recipes from the No Frills Edition presented in an elegantly designed layout but will also include photographs, illustrations, and memory pages that will keep the spirit of the Quirky Feather alive and with you always. Every reward level that includes the Recipes and Memories edition will also include a set of the cocktail recipe cards from the No Frills with a Twist reward level. 
The cover design pictured is subject to change. 
If you would like multiple copies of either book please choose the highest reward level and add the amount needed for the number of extra copies you wish to order during checkout.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The main challenge of this project will be getting enough people to back the Recipes and Memories Edition that the price per book will remain reasonable. If this project does not reach the goal we plan to try again with a campaign that consists of only the No Frills Edition.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.creator_bio:
Sabrina Wilson
2 created · 14 backed
Sabrina Wilson (formerly Wernicke) was one of the owners of The Quirky Feather Confectionery from 2015 until it closed in 2018. She now...See more

support.title: Friend of the Quirky Feather
support.descp: Friends of the Quirky Feather will have their name printed on the Thank You page at the end of the Recipes and Memories edition of The Quirky Feather Confectionery Cookbook.

support.title: No Frills Edition
support.descp: This spiral bound text only edition will be printed in black and white, it will contain all of the recipes but it will not include photographs, illustrations, or memory pages that will be in the Recipes and Memories edition. Backers at this level will have their name printed on the Thank You pages at the end of the Recipes and Memories Edition.

support.title: No Frills with a Twist
support.descp: This reward level includes a copy of the No Frills Edition cookbook and a set of cocktail recipe cards that will include all of our signature cocktails and the most popular weekly cocktail recipes.

support.title: Recipes and Memories Edition
support.descp: This cloth bound hardcover edition will feature a foil embossed cover and spine as well as a beautiful dust jacket. It will include all of the recipes in the No Frills Edition with a more elegant layout. This edition will also be enhanced with photographs of everyone's favorite treats and illustrated tips, tricks, and recipe variations printed in full color and crisp clarity on glossy paper. Most importantly, this edition will include pages of photographs and stories of the staff's behind-the-counter shenanigans as well as photographs and memories from regulars of The Quirky Feather. This edition will not only bring home the recipes of The Quirky Feather, it will also encapsulate the spirit that made TQFC such a special place. Backers at this level will also have their named printed on the Thank You page at the end of this edition.

support.title: Kitchen and Coffee Table Bundle
support.descp: This bundle includes a copy of the No Frills Edition and a copy of the Recipes and Memories Edition. It is a perfect bundle for anyone who would like to both recreate TQFC treats and be able to re-live the experience of TQFC through the Recipes and Memories edition without the risk of the book being damaged by potential kitchen mishaps. This reward level will also include having your named printed on the Thank You page of the Recipes and Memories Edition and the cocktail recipe cards from the No Frills with a Twist reward level.

support.title: Quirky Feather Family Reunion
support.descp: Backers at this level will receive the Kitchen and Coffee Table Bundle with free domestic shipping. Instead of having your name printed on the Thank You page at the end of the Recipes and Memories Edition your name will be printed on the dedication page. Most importantly, backers at this level will receive an invitation for you and a guest to attend a reunion where you will be able to catch up and share memories with available TQFC team members and other regulars who love and miss The Quirky Feather as much as you do. The reunion will take place during the spring. Date, time, and location to be determined. A selection of favorite TQFC treats will be provided.

support.title: Early Bird Kitchen & Coffee Table Bundle
support.descp: This bundle includes a copy of the No Frills Edition and a copy of the Recipes and Memories Edition at a discounted price for the first 25 backers who would like to both recreate TQFC treats and be able to re-live the experience of TQFC through the Recipes and Memories edition without the risk of the book being damaged by potential kitchen mishaps. This reward level will also include having your named printed on the Thank You page of the Recipes and Memories Edition. The early bird bundle also includes free domestic shipping!

campaign.story:
Known only through whispers and rumors, the DCC RPG Annual is a legend before its time. Those few who have seen its pages are now but blasted ash. It's your turn, mortal. Be careful when you turn its pages...
Thanks everyone for a terrific Kickstarter! If you missed it, you can find the finished product at www.goodman-games.com once it's in print!
Color cover to the DCC Annual! By Doug Kovacs
The Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game, also known as DCC RPG, is the most fun you’ll ever have playing an RPG. It is also a game founded in principle. Important amongst those principles is an aversion to rules bloat. The DCC RPG core rulebook is but a single book. There are no splatbooks, sourcebooks, character books, monster manuals, or other supplements for DCC RPG. They are not needed. Incumbent upon the judge is the need to create: yon horizon is filled with adventure, and it is your adventure. You have worlds inside you: find them.
Yet the urge to create is a hungry god, and gods demand nourishment. It was originally conceived that an annual publication would exist in some form to showcase the brilliance of the DCC RPG community. This would be the DCC RPG Annual, published each year to distribute these gaming creations.
The best of things happened: the DCC RPG Annual was never needed. The DCC community burst forth a verdant jungle of inspiration, with ripe fruit on every limb. Blogs and personal posts; zines; community publications; the Gongfarmer’s Almanac; officially licensed third-party works: there is a vast supply of inspiration from whence the DCC judge can draw and iterate.
And thus we come here to Kickstart a volume which has no place. If you are a DCC fan, you absolutely do not need to support this Kickstarter. Should you to desire to do so, however, you will receive a book that has become a legend, despite never before being published.
Foil cover to the DCC Annual! By Doug Kovacs. Imagine this printed in gold foil on a leatherette background.
The DCC RPG Annual
Spoken about for half a decade in hoary whispers, at long last Goodman Games brings you: the DCC RPG Annual. Much of the material for the DCC Annual was written between 2012 and 2014, when the original need was perceived. In many ways, it springs forth from the original inspirations of DCC RPG, which were psychically close at that time. There are magic swords. There are patrons. There are even more tables for making monsters unique. There are rules for making cleric deities more distinctive. There are rules for patron weapons and magic rings. There is the lost continent of Mu, and the hidden places between worlds. And there are rules for magical moustaches.
The DCC Annual is a hardcover estimated at 160 pages finished length. Like the original DCC RPG core rulebook, it is available in two cover options: a full-color and foil cover edition. It is organized in the same manner as the DCC RPG core rulebook: chapter three is equipment, chapter five is magic, and chapter nine is monsters, just as in the core rulebook. There is no chapter two, because the skills section of the core rulebook has no expansion material in the Annual.
The DCC Annual comes in two cover versions. The color cover is painted by Doug Kovacs and features Hugh the Barbarian and his Band. There's a story in this cover, a chapter of the Band history, for those who can find it. There is also a foil edition featuring a new foil design (and someone’s decapitated head). For this Kickstarter, the foil edition will be printed in gold foil. The distribution version will be printed in silver foil. And never fear, art fans – the foil edition also features Doug's amazing cover art from the color cover edition (reproduced on the interior pages of the foil edition).
You absolutely do not need the DCC Annual to play DCC RPG, nor does any material in the Annual supersede or otherwise change the baseline game experience as expressed in the core rulebook. There is no rules bloat: only new vistas of imagination.
And with every gift from the gods, comes a toll. Not only does this Kickstarter offer the DCC Annual, but it also offers three other artifacts to show your devotion: a new printing of the DCC RPG core book featuring yet more amazing art; a new hardcover edition of DCC #83: The Chained Coffin; and an opening offer of the DCC Quick Start Rules for new initiates. Read on! 
The Shanna Dahaka cover to the DCC Core Rulebook! By Doug Kovacs
New Fans, Welcome!
We invite newcomers to join the Cult of DCC! As part of this Kickstarter, we are offering the DCC RPG Quick Start rules, in print+PDF format, for the ridiculously low price of $2.00. That price includes postage to anywhere in the world. If you haven’t experienced DCC RPG, this is your chance to get in very affordably. The Quick Start Rules include everything needed to get your character from level 0 to level 2, and also include two one-session adventure modules. This pledge level also includes three free PDF adventures of our choosing.
We are also giving away a PDF of the Quick Start Rules for free at this link right here. If you’re not sure what DCC RPG is, this is a great way to test the waters!
And finally, if you as a newcomer decide you want to jump in a little deeper, we invite you to check out the Three Best Pledge Levels, detailed below. The Favored Retainer level offers an affordable way to get started on DCC RPG. 
The pterodactyl-wizard cover to the DCC core rulebook! By Sanjulian
DCC RPG Core Rulebook, 7th printing
Also offered in this Kickstarter are two other items of interest to the DCC gamer: a new printing of the core rulebook, including new cover art, and a compiled hardcover edition of DCC #83: the Chained Coffin.
The DCC RPG core rulebook has been through 4 hardcover and 2 softcover printings prior to this run. (And wow, isn’t that amazing? Thanks everyone for the support!) Now that the hardcover is once again out of print, we are doing another printing.
As always, the content is materially identical to prior printings (except for fixing a couple typos). There will be a new adventure substituted in the back, as we do for each printing This printing includes "Yddgrrl's Maze," a level 2 adventure by Michael Curtis. In addition, this print run will be distinguished by the covers. We are offering three covers on this hardcover edition:
· The “basic blue” cover, the classic Doug Kovacs cover we all know and love.
· The Sanjulian cover. Fans of 1970's fantasy and sci-fi art will know Sanjulian's art from Warren magazines like Creepy and Eerie, as well as his run of Conan covers. This is the red-and-yellow “pterodactyl-wizard” cover you see above. The Kickstarter edition will include an exclusive foil imprint over the DCC logo.
· Doug’s new Shanna Dahaka cover. The Kickstarter edition will include an exclusive foil imprint over the DCC logo. 
The hardcover 2nd printing of DCC #83: The Chained Coffin. Cover art by Ken Kelly
DCC #83: The Chained Coffin (hardcover 2nd printing)
DCC #83: The Chained Coffin was originally released way back in 2014. The boxed set proved immensely popular, and not just for the spinning map puzzle. The Appalachian-style fantasy setting of The Shudder Mountains, inspired by the works of Appendix N author Manly Wade Wellman, provides a unique place for your characters to adventure. Michael Curtis did a wonderful job of bringing The Shudder Mountains alive, and several supplemental volumes were published.
Now that the original boxed set is out of print, we are offering a hardcover book that compiles all material from the original DCC #83: The Chained Coffin boxed set, including all the stretch goal booklets, as well as much, much more:
· All content from DCC #83.1: Tales of the Shudder Mountains and DCC #83.2: Death Among the Pines
· The Shudder Mountain material published in several Gen Con Program Guides
· Moon Eyes and Fire-Flies, a new adventure set in the Shudder Mountains
· Buzzard Hollow, a new Shudder Mountains mini-setting
· Ma Bigginty’s Book of Backwoods Wisdom,a collection of inspiration material that will bring the Shudder Mountains to life in your game
The DCC #83 hardcover is estimated at 160 pages and yes, it will also include the spinning map puzzle! (We are working with the printer on logistics, but the most likely scenario is having the map tucked inside the back cover of each hardcover.)
One last thing. Doug’s original art for DCC #83 is amazing, but you know we like variety. The hardcover edition features new art by none other than fantasy legend Ken Kelly. Fans of 1970s Warren magazines like Creepy and Eerie will also recognize the work of Ken Kelly, whose career also includes a long stretch of amazing illustrations. And his illustration builds on Doug’s original design for the chained coffin itself. And don’t worry, Doug’s original cover art will also appear in the hardcover edition.
DCC #83 will also be available in a foil edition, featuring the same amazing image that was printed on the limited-run foil editions of the original module. This cover art is timeless and deserves to remain in print. The Kickstarter edition will feature a different foil color than the distribution edition.
The original "blue cover" edition of DCC RPG core rulebook. By Doug Kovacs
The Three Best Pledge Levels
If you'd like to buy copies individually, the table below shows their cost. You can add on funds to purchase more than one book. However, there are some bundle deals that offer a great value. See the summary after the table: 
The Three Best Pledge Levels. We are offering three great deals that make it easy to back multiple books in this Kickstarter. If you’re a new fan, a dedicated fan, or a diehard collector, one of these is for you.
Favored Retainer: You are new to the adventure, and you have promise. This pledge level is for new DCC fans and offers a $120 of product for $100. You’ll receive the color-cover editions of the DCC Annual, core rulebook, and DCC #83: The Chained Coffin. If you would like to have the Sanjulian or Shanna Dahaka covers for the DCC Core Rulebook, pledge for this level and add an extra +$20 for the price difference.
 Name Level: Your fame precedes you within the DCC community. This $150 pledge is a $30 savings on the cover price of $180. At the Name Level pledge, you’ll receive DCC Annual (Kickstarter-exclusive foil cover), DCC #83: The Chained Coffin (Kickstarter-exclusive foil cover), and a copy of the DCC RPG core rulebook, with your choice of either the Sanjulian or Doug Kovacs cover.
Landed Lord: Other fans make pilgrimage to witness to your legendary collection. This $300 pledge is a $60 savings on the cover price of $360. As a Landed Lord, you will receive everything offered in the Kickstarter, which is seven books: both covers of the DCC Annual, both covers of DCC #83: The Chained Coffin, and all three covers of the DCC RPG core rulebook (7th printing).
Print + PDF
Every print copy of the DCC Annual, DCC core rulebook, and DCC #83: The Chained Coffin books offered in this Kickstarter also includes a PDF edition.
Kickstarter Exclusives
This is stated elsewhere but also to call it out explicitly: this Kickstarter features cover variants that are exclusive as follows:
· DCC RPG core rulebook, Sanjulian edition: the DCC RPG logo will be foil-printed
· DCC RPG core rulebook, Doug Kovacs Shanna Dahaka edition: the DCC RPG logo will be foil-printed
· DCC Annual, foil cover edition: the foil will be printed in gold. The distribution edition will be printed in silver.
· DCC #83: The Chained Coffin: the foil will be printed in gold. The distribution edition will be printed in silver.
Shipping Costs
Please note that shipping costs are not included in the pledge levels. Shipping costs will be assessed at a later date via Backer Kit. 
USA shipments will ship via media mail, bound printed matter or equivalent rates.
International shipments will ship via a tracked service, most likely FedEx or UPS. We will endeavor to find the cheapest option, and also partner with international shipping partners where possible to reduce VAT charges via local-market shipping. 
The exact cost of each shipment will vary according to the content but please be aware that the hardcover books in this Kickstarter are heavy. International backers should expect to pay minimum postage charges for a single book of at least $20-$25 for Canada, $30-$35 for Europe, and $35-$40 for Australia and Asia. Additional books will obviously add to this cost. Final cost will be assessed via Backer Kit. 
Stretch Goals
We have learned over the years that there are so many ways to make these books cool! We’ve already worked out a couple options as options for stretch goals, which are listed below. As the project progresses we are open to suggestions from fans on others!
At $40,000: CLEARED!We will print new color art on the endsheets of the DCC Annual.
At $65,000: CLEARED! We will print maps on the endsheets of DCC #83: The Chained Coffin. PLUS we will include a free 11x17 poster print of one piece of cover art with every print pledge!
At $80,000: CLEARED!Free adventure! For every book you buy, you'll get one free DCC adventure module in PDF format (exact module to be determined). (The $2 quick start rules don't count!)
At $100,000: CLEARED! We will include satin ribbon bookmarks in the DCC Core Rulebook and DCC #83: The Chained Coffin.
At $125,000: CLEARED!We will include printed 11”x17” posters of the cover art. There will be several “checkpoints” on this stretch goal and we’ll use backer feedback to decide which posters to print – the Chained Coffin cover, the Annual cover, the Sanjulian cover, etc. (Or maybe we’ll just blow past this stretch goal and print them all!)
Beyond that: We have some fun ideas. We would like to print custom dust jackets featuring the Deadly Hands of DCC art that premiered at Gen Con 2018. Some fans have requested books bound in real leather, and that may be an option we unlock. And we’re open to your ideas as well!
The Demon Skull Add-On
We are also producing a version of the DCC RPG core rulebook that features the original iconic demon skull image. You can add it on for +$60. Read this update for full details!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Goodman Games has run and fulfilled nearly 20 Kickstarters. The biggest risk is success - we typically land a lot of stretch goals which can delay projects!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

support.title: Funnel fodder (just watching).
support.descp: Pledge $1 to get project updates and nothing else. Stretch goals and add-ons do not apply to this level.

support.title: Retailer pledge level
support.descp: RETAILERS ONLY. Pledge now for $1 and we will contact you when we are ready to ship. At that time you can order the items you want at a wholesale discount. You will also have the option to add other DCC items, all at a wholesale discount. This reward is for verified brick and mortar retail stores only. Shipping to be assessed when products ship.

support.title: DCC Quick Start Rules (Print+PDF)
support.descp: The 48-page DCC Quick Start Rules, covering play from levels 0-2 plus two short adventures, in print and PDF. You will also receive 3 randomly determined DCC modules in PDF format. updates.update_userinfo: Bonus PDF: The Deadly Hands Of Dungeon Crawl Classics
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone,
Some of you may have noticed that the shipping on the DCC Annual Kickstarter was a little challenging. As the saying goes, "Our bad." Sorry about the hassles that many of you experienced!
There are many things we're doing to remedy this on future Kickstarters, not least of which is moving to a different fulfillment company (already complete). While we take care of that on our end, we feel like we should thank you backers for your patience throughout this entire process.

Hello everyone!
First, happy new year!
Secondly, the latest shipping update. Pretty similar to the last one - for the various categories of "makeup orders", shipments continue to go out. Over the last week (and as recently as yesterday) we have been messaging backers with tracking numbers.

Hi everyone,
A brief update on shipping. Makeup shipments continue to go out, similar to the last update. A couple updates:
A large batch of orders went out last week. We have messaged affected backers with tracking numbers.
The fulfillment partner has another batch packaged and ready to go out. We expect to receive these tracking numbers early this coming week, and we will send them to you as we get them.

Hi everyone,
This update is primarily for the folks who are still waiting on various "makeup shipments" (items missing from their original pledge shipment, and/or arrived damaged). This is still a couple dozen people at this point. If you're not in that group, you probably don't need to read this. But if you are in that group -
First of all, sorry for the radio silence. There was a slowdown in the pace of shipping. I kept waiting to post that "things are on their way," and should have just posted a "holding steady" message.

Hi everyone,
Well, the good news is these updates are getting shorter and shorter. For those of you still awaiting some or all of your shipment, here is the latest news. For everyone, regardless of current order status, we do intend to keep our commitment to send you a little something extra to make up for all the hassle on shipping, as mentioned in the Roundup on our Nov. 9 update. More to come on that - but be advised that it's in the works and Harley, Mike and Brendan are involved.

Hi everyone, 
Here is the latest update on shipping! Since DCC Annual and DCC Lankhmar international shipping has converged, we are cross-posting this update. Although most of the news is related to DCC Annual at this point, so I expect this to be the last cross-posted update.
International Shipping

campaign.story:
[Note To Backers: "This is a micro-kickstarter, specifically aimed at  producing the Dragon one more time for those people who missed it first time around and as such there are no outrageous stretch goals planned other than me closing the main shop to speed things up or hiring reliable third party contract casters if funding goes high enough to cover the increased costs, as I need to keep the main goal (make dragons) focussed and achievable. Although you can simply add anything you want from the main shop as an add-on, if you like!" ~Andy]
 £8,000 STRETCH GOAL KLAXON!
If we hit £8,000 the New Alternate Dragon Head will be unlocked and everyone can swap it for their Original head or add it for £15 to their pledge.
Yeah ignore what I said above, sort of. Not a crazy stretch goal, though but a very cool one - people asked me to make a new head and I couldn't resist, so if we make it to £8,000 (about 5 dragons away at the time of writing) then everyone can either swap their original Dragon head for this new Alternate one, or add it to their pledge as an extra head for £15.00. It will be used on the next Dragon that Andy makes, in I dunno, a few years' time? Who can say, eh? but if wee hit £8k then Andy will make it fit the current Dragon's body. (Note: above picture is early stage work in progress, it'll have lots more little spines and stuff.)
The Heresy Dragon. 
What a beast! (For an assembly video, check out Update #4, which is Andy assembling a Dragon for your delight)
Long story short, this model caused a lot of problems during it's original production run; with ALL of those problems solved there's nothing stopping Heresy from making a short second run of models for those people who missed out on the first run, other than the amount of money, time and intensive labour it takes to make a full set of moulds for the beast, and to cast them. it's a glorious kit and will totally steal the show in your display cabinet!
Dragon painted and given a wonderful scenic base by Sean Powers
Dragon painted and given a wonderful scenic base by Sean Powers
 All 330+ Dragons of the original production run were finally completed in August 2015. Swearing never to even think of bringing it back into proper production after such a gargantuan effort, Andy gladly drew a line under it and plunged into the Return Of the Monsters Kickstarter production (that campaign is all but completed, the final model, the Light Vs Dark diorama should be finished over the Christmas break, for those last 8 backers waiting for it) but since then, email after email has come in from people who somehow missed their chance to buy a Dragon for themselves. They ask him about it at shows or on the telephone. Without fail.

And so, the tempting whispers have won. The Dragon's Master model castings are all safely stored, ready for moulding again, and here in 2018, Andy has decided that enough time has passed to distance himself from the emotional attachments surrounding his fight to bring the original production run to fruition, to allow himself to face the Great Enemy one more time. This thing is totally ready to go!
Dragon painted by Daemonslave
EXPERTS ONLY 
This is an Expert Kit. Do not buy this kit if you are not expecting to have to put some work in to assemble this beast. Although the joins are incredibly good (weeks of work went into making them as good as possible at the time), you will still have to do some gluing and a bit of gap filling with the putty of your choice, as you would with any multi-part resin model kit. The Dragon is supplied unpainted and unassembled. There is no painted option available, sorry.  Andy recorded a video of him assembling it for Update #3, Well that Worked Well, which should give you an idea of what is involved and if you could cope with it. Click the link above.
The kit is produced using a paintable mould release spray but we still advise that, prior to assembly, you wash the parts in warm soapy water to remove any residue of release spray, rinse and dry throughly and prime with a paint suitable for plastic surfaces.  Any minor mould lines can be gently scraped away with a knife or fine file, etc. It would be an ideal model to use airbrushes and oil washes on, in Andy's opinion. If any parts have bent or distorted during the casting process (quality control is extremely high but oversights can happen) simply immerse them in hot water for 20-40 seconds or so and carefully bend into desired position.
The Dragon uses a phenomenal amount of silicone and resin in it's casting process, over 21kgs of silicone and the final model is around 750 grams of resin. It is double cast to ensure the best bubble free castings, parts being both vacuum and pressure cast. It takes an entire day to produce one casting and clean all the moulds ready for the next one.
The finished model is around 30cm from base of rock to extended wingtip, and approx 44cm wide and 34cm long, in the pose as pictured. It (carefully) fits into an Ikea display cabinet, although you might have to take a shelf out to allow for the height.
After this production wave is done, there will be a significant gap before the next one, if at all. So don't miss out this time around!
If this project funds, the first ten dragons will be ready by the end of January 2019. The next ten are scheduled for May just in case, because the Salute show comes along in April and really ruins everything production wise. Last year Andy worked so hard prepping for Salute he gave himself Type 2 Diabetes, so he's allowing plenty of time for it next year. However, if funding hits £8,000 he will be able to speed things up and make extra moulds so some of those second ten will no doubt be ready in February, ahead of schedule.
The Dragon vs the Heresy Giant, Mucklegeet, vs a 30mm human figure, Brother Lucius, to give you a sense of size.
PLEDGE MANAGER AND ADD-ONS - PLEASE NOTE: 
There will be no pledge manager for this campaign. It adds so much complication to things for a one-man business and Andy wants things to go smoothly and simply this time around. You will be able to add models to your pledge later via the regular Heresy Miniatures shop once your Dragon is ready, or, if you really do want to pay for them now via Kickstarter, you can add any model from the main shop to your pledge by increasing your pledge enough to cover the cost of the models you are adding. MAKE A NOTE OF WHAT YOU WANT. A lot of people immediately forget what they pledged for after a campaign finishes. Surveys will be sent out almost immediately after the campaign so that you can tell us if you want any extras. 
If you want to make a separate order right away to be sent out with your Dragon, you can do so by visiting the shop, adding whichever models you like to your basket, and then choosing the shipping option ADD TO DRAGON KICKSTARTER. This will not charge you for shipping, but you will be asked to pay correct shipping once your Dragon is ready to be sent. (Do you see why this suddenly makes things get more complicated for a one-man business now?). If you want to add any items from the normal shop to your pledge, simply click 'edit pledge' in the side menu, and add the total amount of add-ons to your existing pledge. Make a note of what you want, I repeat, for convenience. Kickstarter will charge your card during the payment process, which will be during the 14 day period after the campaign ends. You may receive a gentle reminder message from Andy if your card does not get charged sucessfully, as these things happen and often people don't realise they haven't paid for something. We all assume things will go smoothly, but banks are fickle creatures and, for example, can block payments for 'security reasons', especially if your card is used online at some site you haven't used before, for example.
You will be emailed/messaged once your dragon is ready, so please keep your contact details up to date on Kickstarter.
Add a Winged Netherlord II to your pledge for £140
Or perhaps you would like the sensuous, sexy Madame? Add £99 to your pledge, or go to the main shop by clicking this link, make an order for her and anything else you want, and choose Add to Dragon Kickstarter Pledge as the shipping
                     Andy really does love making ridiculously big models. Here's Mucklegeet the Giant from the last kickstarter, add him to your pledge for £110.00gbp
I will add some more Add-On examples during the campaign  just to keep things vaguely amusing for you all.
REFUNDS: 
If you change your mind and want a refund, you must do so within 13 days of the end of the campaign, as Kickstarter deducts fees from your payment and does not return them to Heresy if you request a refund from the campaign after 13 days. Refunds will not be given lightly, as every pound of this money is needed to produce the Dragons, so if you're the kind of person who buys things on a whim and then demands their money back two days later, DO NOT BUY THIS MODEL. It is not for you. This is for serious, patient, collectors only, who expect to wait months to get their Dragon, and are happy to do so. There will not be years of waiting like the first time around, but even so, be prepared to wait, because Expecting the Unexpected is an absolute requirement of the resin casting process. See the pledges for approximated dates for delivery (these have been exaggerated to allow for unforeseen delays) If you have a legitimate reason for requesting a refund after the 13 days period, and within 30 days of the campaign ending, any refund that can be made to you will be made, less the amount deducted by Kickstarter for their fees and payment processing.
SHIPPING: 
Shipping will be worldwide, you will be contacted individually for the additional payment once your Dragon is ready to ship. As each dragon weighs around 1.4kgs packed, expect to pay around £22 for shipping to the USA (or Australia) via Royal Mail Tracked and Signed, or a courier can be arranged if preferred, although those services tend to be a little more expensive (faster too) and will incur a minimal fee at your end from the courier in your country. Royal Mail usually puts its prices up in April each year by a small amount. You will be responsible for paying any import duties and taxes.
Brexit may mean that import duties apply to the European Union countries that the UK is currently a member of, unless some miracle occurs and we manage to stay in the EU Customs Union. I will try to get as many dragons out before March as I can, just in case! Currently typical costs are around £16.00gbp for European shipping
UK parcels will be sent via Recorded Delivery or Special Delivery as each backer prefers, fortunately the costs are much lower for that here in the UK!
 RECASTERS and OUR RIGHT TO REFUSE
Recently there has been a sharp upturn in the number of recasters producing models from various one-man independent miniatures companies such as Heresy and our friends. By buying recasts, you are probably supporting much more nefarious industries and practices in the countries producing the pirated miniatures. We reserve the right to cancel the pledge of any backer who is a known recaster or associate of such or who lives in a country renowned for producing counterfeit miniatures. It's simply not on. We also reserve the right to refuse service for any other reason.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Every possible problem that could happen, happened the first time around (there's a whole depressing blog about it on Andy's blog) and can now be dealt with through Andy's hard won experience. You don't cast 330+ of these beasts without learning everything there is to know about it. 

The main thing that would affect this production run would be weather conditions - if it gets really cold in the workshop, it prevents the silicone moulds curing, and especially the resin wings from curing as quickly as desired, but the production schedule hopefully allows for this. The first set of production moulds would be completed just before the Christmas break, allowing production to begin in January after the holidays.

The Dragon will be being produced alongside other Heresy models, which also slows things down, but this is also allowed for in the production schedule. The time scale given is exaggerated because I always expect the unexpected these days, when it comes to resin casting.

If the campaign proves wildly successful, Andy will shut the main shop if necessary to concentrate on only producing Dragons until things have been calmed down, or will engage the services of one or more trusted casting companies to help produce the extra dragons if it looks like there will be too much work for him to handle alone.

Other than that, injury etc would be the main threats, as with any one-man business, but you can't really plan for that.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Will start on wave 2 Dragons a.s.a.p. as I'm heading into the Salute show production run period now and things are going to get stupid crazy busy, as expected. (That was why Wave 2 was given a May shipping date, because it's impossible to 100% promise *anything* between now and the show in April. Last year I burnt myself out so completely from overwork preparing for Salute, that I gave myself diabetes type 2 and mental health problems from the associated blood sugar levels - something I was not aware could happen!  It was a whole

updates.update_userinfo: You Have...One...New Message... Message One... BEEEEEEP
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone!
Please do check your message inbox if you backed for a separate head, or are a Wave 1 Dragon backer - I have a pile of heads and actual dragons here waiting for you all to pay for shipping/add any extras and have had very few replies! 
Almost done on Wave 1, got 3 more Dragons to cast to cover it (I'll be messaging the remaining Wave 1 backers this week about those as they come out of the moulds) and then I'll be onto Wave 2 backers. I know I said they'd go out after Salute but I was secretly going to send them out as soon as possible all along. Surprise! You'll be getting your dragons sooner than you thought, Wave 2! They will be slightly slower as I have to cast a fair bit fo stuff for Salute now, but they should all get done by the start of March.

Hello! It's 2019 already! Etc!
Just a quick note to say that I am now back at work following my two weeks at home for Christmas and I am casting up the new head - as well as all the other dragon bits obviously - and am aiming to cast up a good pile of those new heads before I start contacting you all. Got 12 so far, need 40...you almost all wanted the new head instead of the original! Will try to contact a bunch of you this weekend that are just needing the new head for your pledge, in order of pledge number.

The funds have cleared at last, almost three weeks after the event, and there were a couple of dropped pledges unfortunately, so i am having to work my plans around the reduced amount, but I have ordered fresh silicone and resin and started making a new set of moulds and casting up the dragons. All should be on schedule for end of January, with no issues.
Here is a picture of the mould for the front torso, which is a huge single piece mould that was then cut open by me, with a scalpel, aiming to split it along an ideal line that was drawn on the master in red sharpie, staining the silicone pink where it touched the resin, to let me know where to cut, roughly... If only I'd had a second person on hand, to hold it open whilst I cut, it would have been a lot easier! The silicone is super firm and resistant to pulling. My hands and arms hurt from the effort of doing it one-handed!

Thank you to everyone who has backed this project and also to those who shared it to their friends etc as without the extra exposure it wouldn't have been this successful!
There now follows a two week period where Kickstarter collects the funds so make sure your cards etc are able to cover your pledge!
And for those who pledged for an extra head and wanted the new one, well, even though I didn't get the £8,000 I wanted, i'll make sure that you're still covered, don't worry!

Hi everyone! 
3 hours to go!
Let's get this over that £8k mark! Share the link to all your friends, if we can get over £8k not only will the new head be available, but I can make an extra set of moulds and speed things up!

updates.update_userinfo: Difficult But Not Impossible Is What I Do
"You've got to get a head." A Stretch Goal!
updates.update_content:
Hahaha You people and your ideas.
I am making a new head thanks to you lot putting that in my brain. I can't resist a spur of the moment sculpt, I really can't!

OK, in the worldwide stakes of Being A Plum, it probably does quite well, but in my defense, the Kickstarter Live option is stupid and the people who made it should feel terrible about themselves. I just did 1hr 41minutes of me talking to camera at length whilst assembling a dragon, only to realise that IT WAS NOT STREAMING AT ALL at the end.
Sorry about that, i know a couple of you were expecting to watch me.
The good news is, I planned on something going wrong and was simultaneously streaming it on Facebook Live via my phone, for close-up shots, because KS Live only uses the desktop built-in camera which was awful anyway.

project_data.project_name: The Heresy Miniatures Dragon - Production Wave II

campaign.story:
Welcome to my Kickstarter!  
** To make it clear on the SIZE of these models, please note:
- Busts are measured from bottom of base to top of head, and are 75mm TALL.  The 193mm Bust is 193mm from bottom of base to top of head.
- Figures are measured from bottom of foot to eye.
30mm figures painted by Frozen Ninja 3D are now available, see the Add-On section for more details!  I have added some examples of my painting to the end of the Add-On section as well.  
My name is Mark Norton, and I am working full-time as a sculptor going by the name Frozen Ninja 3D. I am designing and sculpting my own line of highly detailed figures with the hopes of bringing people together for fun hobby times. In addition to sculpting, I also enjoy painting miniatures and making dioramas. I even received a silver at ReaperCon this year!
This is the third Kickstarter project that I have run, and the second project that features figures entirely designed and sculpted by me.  My previous Kickstarter projects were run under the name "M&K Adventures", but all projects going forward will be under my "Frozen Ninja 3D" name to distinguish the fact that I am doing all of the designing and sculpting of the figures.
What is being offered in this project?
Each figure is cast in high quality resin, and is supplied un-assembled and un-painted.  
** The Add-On List below will be kept up-to-date with all available figures and will be updated once Stretch-Goal figures are unlocked.  The list is located after these cool pictures : **
Let's get right to it and check out the miniatures.
Presenting the first set of figures/busts, "Summoning a Dragon 1".  She is in the middle of summoning a dragon, and everything seems to be going as she had planned.  She is available as a Huge 193mm Bust, a 75mm Bust, a 54mm Figure, and a standard 30mm gaming Figure.  The 2 Busts feature a Wizard's Tower as the base. 
"Summoning a Dragon 1" 30mm and 54mm figures
"Summoning a Dragon 1" 193mm Bust, painted by James Wappel
 Watch the Painting Tutorial by James Wappel here :
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0_JQpTGyB3k&t=4721s
"Summoning a Dragon 1" Bust
The busts! Here you can get a better look at her face as she summons her dragon. :-)
The second figure available is "The Cowgirl".  She has a futuristic gun and case, and some goggles on her hat, making her perfect for any western or steampunk setting.  She is available in 30mm and 54mm sizes.
"The Cowgirl"
"The Cowgirl" 30mm & 54mm sizes
The third figure available is "The Barbarian 1".  He is ready to fight and defend with his hammer!  He looks great as a normal barbarian, and he looks amazing as a frost giant!  He is available in 30mm and 54mm sizes.
"The Barbarian 1" 30mm and 54mm size figures.
"The Barbarian 1", painted to look like a frost giant by Dave Coulson
The fourth available figure is "The Big Guy", an Oni Warrior.  Duel-wielding a hammer and a mace, he is ready for combat.  He is available in 28mm and 55mm sizes.  He was the first miniature I ever made, and will always remain one of my favorites.
"The Big Guy" 28mm & 55mm, painted by Joshua Davis
"The Big Guy" 28mm & 55mm, painted by Joshua Davis
The fifth figure available is "The Cyborg Bust".  She is covered in various metals and seems to be staring down her next target.  She is a 75mm Bust that includes the base.
"The Cyborg" 75mm Bust
The sixth available figure is "The Sun Warrior".  She makes a great town-guard or adventuring fighter, and is available as a 30mm figure.
"Sun Warrior" 30mm Figure
Add-On List
Here is a list of all of the figures that are currently available in this Kickstarter project. I will continue to update this list as stretch goals are reached.  
All of these prices are BELOW the retail price... for example, the Summoning a Dragon 1, 75mm Bust costs $30 in this Kickstarter but will retail at $40.  The 30mm figures normally retail at $13-16, and the 54mm figures normally retail at $25.  
Shipping will be charged separately, please refer to the shipping chart below for rates.
NOW AVAILABLE - Painting services!  If you want some of your 30mm figures painted by me, here is your chance!  Just add $15 for each figure you want painted (for example, it would be $12 for the figure and $15 to paint it = $27 total).  I will do a nice tabletop level paintjob for you, on a plain black base.  This should not affect delivery of the figures, as I will begin painting them as soon as I know which ones you want painted. 
Please send any questions!
Here you can see an example of my painting! I am offering Tabletop level painting, with blank bases. The bases I provide on my painted miniatures will not have the flock and grass as seen below, but the figures will be painted to this quality, (if you want me to do the base on your miniature, let me know and we can work it out.) 
Painted by Frozen Ninja 3D !
Painted by Frozen Ninja 3D !
Stretch Goals
These are the figures that will be available once we hit certain funding levels. 
UNLOCKED and AVAILABLE NOW - The first stretch goal was "The Alchemist".  He is a 75mm Bust that includes the base.  He carries a rather large backpack full to the brim with everything a traveling alchemist would need. 
The Alchemist Bust, painted by James Wappel
Watch James Wappel show how he painted The Alchemist Bust in his latest tutorial!
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZPaeaE_NCyk&fbclid=IwAR3lpaM7sZxDVv3lcqY8UEXi0hwx24Ueex4l9mLR2HazMaefSfzXB-zB1Y4
UNLOCKED and AVAILABLE NOW - We have unlocked "Dead Robot Base" early! This is a highly detailed base featuring a destroyed robot, in 55mm and 75mm sizes. The poor robot is being taken over by those vine things!
Here are some pics of the master resin casts in my hand so you can see their size. 
55mm and 75mm Dead Robot Bases, in my hand
UNLOCKED and AVAILABLE NOW - The Cowboy 30mm and 54mm figures have been Unlocked !  He has worked a hard day, and is ready for a bit of rest...
UNLOCKED and AVAILABLE NOW - "Summoning a Dragon 2" 75mm Bust !  This guy looks like he read from the wrong book.  Oops!  I hope that Dragon is friendly...  This Bust is 75mm from the bottom of the base to the top of the Wizards Head !  It will be $40 in this Kickstarter but will retail at least $10 more than that.
UNLOCKED and AVAILABLE NOW - "Summoning a Dragon 2" 54mm Figure!  Comes with the base featuring a little library that has exotic books!  
PRESENTING - "Flower Girl" 75mm Bust - This is a WORK IN PROGRESS, but I hope this picture gives you an idea of how she will look.  
Follow the Frozen Ninja through the snow in search of new miniatures!
More information...
All of my figures and busts are cast in high quality resin.  They will be supplied un-assembled and un-painted. The figures do not include bases.  The Busts include a custom base/stand for each one. 
In addition to designing and sculpting, I also quality check each piece. If you ever receive a defective piece, please notify me directly and I will make it right. 
Why Kickstarter?
I am bringing these figures to Kickstarter in order to help fund the production molds and casts.  I have paid for the 3D prints and master molds for every figure except for some of the final stretch goals.  
Shipping Chart
Shipping will be charged after the project ends.  Please refer to this shipping chart to estimate the shipping for your pledge.  The Minimum amounts listed are for a single figure.  The Maximum amounts listed would be the maximum amount you would be charged if your order includes a lot of figures, or if your order includes the 193mm Huge Bust :
Please send me any questions you have!
Shipping Date
I have set the shipping date for April 2019, although I will do my best to deliver it sooner than that. 
A Little History...
My wife Kimberly and I founded M&K Adventures back in 2012. Our goal was to create fun miniatures, and that still remains our goal today.  We ran our first Kickstarter in 2015, which was successful and fulfilled on time.  :-)  After that we were very excited and began working towards launching Frozen Ninja 3D where I would begin showing off my own sculptures.  In 2017 we launched our second Kickstarter project, and it had figures completely designed and sculpted by me, Mark.   Once again the project was successful and it also was fulfilled on time.   Here is a link to our previous Kickstarter project :
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/670874743/30mm-to-110mm-fantasy-miniatures-and-sculptures?ref=nav_search&result=project&term=30mm%20to%20110mm
2018 has been an exciting year.  I have been working hard to make this Kickstarter the best it can be.  In addition, Kimberly and I presented all of our figures in our first role as Vendor at ReaperCon in August 2018.  It was an amazing time, and we met a lot of great people.
We are looking forward to a bright and thrilling future!
Our Booth at ReaperCon! There's Kim!!!
Our Kickstarter figures on display at ReaperCon
The Huge 193mm Bust was also on display at ReaperCon
Interview Link :
Here is a link to an "Artist Spotlight" interview that was done by Justin Smith from Tales of a Mini Painter.  Check it out to learn a little more about me...
https://talesofaminipainter.wordpress.com/2018/10/09/artist-spotlight-frozen-ninja/?fbclid=IwAR0GOdQyFRhmtQ4iOOTPhUKNWUJo67fug-JMePOUUV4t-uF8-Y5_EmFj8ZM
Podcast :
Here is a link to a podcast from Models Workshop After Hours.  It was a lot of fun!
"Yeji, Jim, and Chris are joined by Mark from Frozen Ninja 3d to talk about their upcoming Kickstarter, 3d sculpting on the computer and ReaperCon! So sit and kickback, grab those paints and brushes and get ready to paint paint those miniatures, with Models Workshop After Hours!"
http://modelsworkshop.libsyn.com/after-hours-ep-101-frozen-ninja-3d-computer-sculpting-and-reapercon?fbclid=IwAR3e-KiWbe6ptaHQrnAg5N2rtdSo5VXp0Ver8IRpbNBqJA2YznY-qcVyF-Y
Special Thanks...
I want to thank the following for all of their help and support :
Kimberly Norton - My wife and supporter of everything I do, helping with all aspects whenever she is needed. As an Accountant and Human Resources expert, her advice is legendary.
Trenchworx - Printing beautiful 3D prints, and making some awesome resin casts.
Mini Painting Studio - Providing great livestream painting videos, and doing incredible paint jobs on my figures!
James Wappel - Painting the "Summoning a Dragon 1" Bust, and "The Alchemist" Bust!  (Coming soon!!!)
Dave Coulson - Painting up "The Barbarian" to look like an awesome frost giant!
Tales of a Mini Painter - For the excellent "Artist Spotlight" interview!
Craze Music Productions - For the awesome music in my video!
Models Workshop After Hours - For the fun and informative podcast!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I have tried my best to minimize the risks associated with this project. I have paid for the 3D printing and master molds of almost every figure to ensure that my quality expectations are met. 

Overall, this is the 3rd Kickstarter campaign that I have run. And this is the 2nd campaign featuring figures that were entirely designed and sculpted by me.

I have been working on this project full-time, and I will continue to work hard to ensure that every backer recieves their rewards in a timely manner.

Thank you for reading this far! Please feel free to send any questions.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

support.title: Thank you for your support !
