updates.update_userinfo: The Alpha Version of the Rule-book's issue and our side of the story
updates.update_content:
Dear Backers:
During the last few days the campaign took a drastic turn after some of our backers pointed out that the rule-book we had shared was plagiarized from Massive Darkness. 
Some harsh words have been said about our integrity and authenticity of this project and we would like to share our side of the story and then leave the matter in your hand. 
Most backers may have realized that not being native speakers, we showed certain language related issues in the game as well as the campaign. Typos, grammatical and syntax errors were constantly pointed out which we admit were made by us.

updates.update_userinfo: Level 2: A peek inside one of the most challenging levels
updates.update_content: As we are nearing the end of this campaign, we wanted to give you a tour of a really challenging story level. Half of that level was already covered in one of our last videos but here is what you will be facing:

Hi everyone,
The rule-book is finally up. Its for the core gameplay elements and will be much more detailed with scenarios which we have not detailed here for the sake of keeping the story under the wraps. 
We cant thank you all enough for your patience and assure you that the rulebook and all the English language based elements will be proofread and corrected by multiple native content developers which comprises of Neil Amswych, editor for rule-books for Blood & Plunder, and also for Zephyr: Winds of Change.

So lets talk about the expansions
Artifacts have a very unique value in the world of Overturn. Possessing them grants players a unique advantages in the main campaigns or boss bights. Some artifacts can be found by interacting with NPCs through investigations or side quests while some have their own expansions like this one. 
Know that the boss fights can be tough. Even if you are well stocked with supplies, they can last very long if you havent discovered the boss' weakness or dont have an artifact with unique characteristics.
PLAY

updates.update_userinfo: History of Oasis Lands Part II
updates.update_content:
Year 500 of the Great Migration  
Too much prosperity breeds contempt and greed. The kingdoms of Oasis Lands flushed with life giving water and trade from the rich kingdoms of the North were soon at each other’s throats. 50 years of bloodshed and dirty politics brought ruin to the people of all the four cities but their kings refused to put aside their petty differences. 
The bloodshed continued until the coronation of King Korish in Drish Barahir who was wise enough to see that the warring kingdoms will swallow one another before the desert. A brilliant tactician, he offered a truce to the remaining kings of the Oasis Lands. Known as the Charter of Bloodline brought the four Kingdoms together and decreed that every Kingdom in the Oasis Land will work in the unison to defend each other against any external threat, promote trade and safeguard the blessing of King Solomon that brought gave life to the region in the form of blessed Wells.

Three thousand years ago, Oasis Land was nothing but a mass of perpetually swirling dunes that makes up the great desert of Eternal Sands now. The land was barren and nothing but sand and brimstone survived under the merciless glare of the sun. Eternal Sands have been the oldest known part of the planet. Made up of bone dry ridges and primordial dunes, Eternal Sands has always been home to Ifrits, a race of sentient creatures made out of smokeless fire and stone. Ifrits ruled the dunes of Eternal Sands in the form of tribes with Tilism Hoshruba as the seat of their dead and barren kingdom.

campaign.story:
Miss the campaign? It's probably too late to buy!
When Cutie Met Patootie is a Kickstarter Exclusive Game. That means the only copies of this game are available via Kickstarter. In 2019, I will launch Game Two of the Entanglement Series, Children of the Wildlight. When Cutie Met Patootie may be available in that campaign as an add-on, but that decision has not been finalized. Stay tuned for more announcements by subscribing to The Daniel Zayas Company newsletter! Every new subscriber adds $1 to the money headed to The Dian Fossey Gorilla Fund International from me in December!
Test the game for FREE on Tabletopia!
                                     Special thanks to The Dice Tower for including When Cutie Met Patootie in the FOMO segment! 
Derek and Lizzy from Board Game Spotlight played a 2-player version of the game!
 Doug Shute from Victory Condition Gaming had me on for an interview!
Jambalaya Plays Games stopped to talk with me about the game at Origins!
Check out a mention of When Cutie Met Patootie on the June Hype Train Podcast from Board Game Closet below!
You can read the full preview from Rob Kalajian on his blog, A Pawn's Perspective. Also, check out his solo play video below!
In Chapter One, we learn of the Visitors, and how they arrived on Earth. What dangers await?
In Chapter Two, we learn of the Citizens of Kodiak Harbor and how Cutie gets mixed up in this adventure!
In Chapter Three, we learn of the evil mage, Rewind, and his ability to corrupt our mysterious glowing face to his bidding! What dangers await us in the final chapter?
 In Chapter Four, our heroes have made their way almost to the top of the mountain, but watch out! Rewind has caught up with them! What dangers will befall our heroes in the final chapter of When Cutie Met Patootie?
Shipping is super simple on this campaign. US is FREE, EU/UK is $8, CA and Mexico is $9, AU/NZ is $10, and affordable rates everywhere else! If you prefer to avoid the shipping entirely, have your approved Friendly Local Game Shop pledge for the retail bulk buy option!
THERE WILL BE NO LATE PLEDGES AVAILABLE FOR THIS GAME OR THROUGH REGULAR DISTRIBUTION. YOU MUST PLEDGE FOR A COPY HERE IN THE CAMPAIGN.
Please note that some shipping rates to high-risk countries have an added cost reflected in their shipping.
Retailers: I'd love for you to carry my game in your store! Click here for more info.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This will be my first published game under The Daniel Zayas Company banner, but it is far from my first experience on the Kickstarter platform or the board game industry. I have officially collaborated on multiple campaigns as a verified Kickstarter Expert for more than a year, and before that, I helped launch 10 campaigns for Eagle-Gryphon Games as their Marketing Director. I also currently work as the US Sales Manager for LongPack Games Manufacturing.

When Cutie Met Patootie is 95% complete. After the campaign's successful completion, I will have the artist get to work on the Citizens of Kodiak Harbor promo cards as well as do a couple UX touchups on the graphic design of the cards. The quotes are in from LongPack Games on production, and I have multiple quotes in place for fulfillment to backers. There really isn't much left to do on the creative side to get this in your hands. It will be mostly logistics from here on out.

As a backer, please expect monthly updates until the campaign fully fulfills. Delays are part of the process, but I have built in enough lead time that I am confident we will ship the games on time or beforehand. I consider you the backer as an integral part of this project for your investment and confidence in me. I want to be as transparent as possible with you through every step of the adventure.

Thanks for your support and I am excited to bring When Cutie Met Patootie to your table!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
As you all have started to receive the games, I wanted to clear up the content in the back referring to future games. This game rulebook was finalized with artwork and pages etc. quite some time ago. While I have plans and ideas for all of those games, it is not totally accurate at this time that the people who started the games with me will continue development on those games. Keep an eye out for the titles, but also know I am trying to fulfill Tangled Timelines before asking for more money from the KS community.
Be well and I hope you enjoy When Cutie Met Patootie. A lot of love went into this first publishing of mine.

Hello, backers! Here are the latest updates for the fulfillment of When Cutie Met Patootie.
I have received today the confirmation that the games have left the fulfillment center. They had to reprint the shipping labels for some reason, which caused a small delay. They have been very upfront and communicative lately, so that is a good sign.
The facility has also assured me that you should receive a shipping notice via email at some point soon. Check your spam before claiming you didn't get one. (Chinese email servers bounce a lot).
If you sent me via PM any updates to your addresses as of 2 weeks ago, that was accepted by the fulfillment center and they should be headed to the correct place. I cannot update addresses anymore, unfortunately.
I intentionally shipped the game with extra gems so as to avoid costly replacement shipping. Please play with the correct number as depicted in the rulebook (20 per color gem).

Thank you all for your patience while I navigated the fulfillment process I selected for When Cutie Met Patootie. It was a risk to try an experiment and it really took a lot longer to communicate back and forth with the provider than I thought was possible. However, I have great news. 
Per the fulfillment house, these games will ship this coming week and should arrive   to your homes 2-3 weeks after they ship. This was the big reveal I was hoping for and it actually paid off. Success!

updates.update_userinfo: Shipping Update! Headed out of the factory!
updates.update_content: Just got this photo from LongPack late last night.

Hey, friends! 
I have certainly overestimated my ability to stay on schedule with you while also doing my regular work through LongPack Games. Truth be told, I have spent a total of about three weeks home this entire Summer while convention season demanded most of my attention. I traveled all over, from China to Gen Con to Origins to Orlando to Minneapolis to all sorts of other great cities meeting with factories and clients and business collaborators. It has certainly been a whirlwind which has unfortunately pulled me away from regular updates here.

updates.update_userinfo: June Update: Closing Down the Surveys!
May Update: Mass Manufacturing is Already Underway!
updates.update_content:
Factory News
I got word from my teammates at LongPack Games that we are currently mass manufacturing When Cutie Met Patootie! I received the samples last month and made a few requested changes based on that, and we got that sorted. Now we are on the home stretch!

updates.update_userinfo: April Update - Print the Game Today!
updates.update_content:
Hello, friends!
The Print n Play is ready!
A backer asked me if I would send it out soon, and I replied that I would likely send it out next month. But it's ready, so I thought... why wait?!

Apologies for missing last month. I would be the first to chide a fellow creator for abandoning good communication with backers, but all things are moving forward. We had a slight delay in figuring out how to best make the collectors box and those of you receiving one are really in for a treat. We are doing something I don't think has been widely replicated but is a genius engineering solution. I have Dan from Tectonic Craft Studios to thank for his incredible design skills. I highly recommend you use them for your custom project needs. But just what am I talking about? Well, I had Dan send me a prototype of what we have been working on. Please note the prototype is MDF but the final product will be a much nicer looking material.

updates.update_userinfo: January Update: No News is Good News!
updates.update_content:
This is more of a "I promised to update you once per month" more so than having any real progress updates for this game. Everything is going well with this project, and the latest DZC game is actually doing really well as well.  You can check out Tangled Timelines here.
All the files are with LongPack. We decided to postpone production until after Chinese New Year rather than make the games and have them sit in the warehouse until the shippers get back to work after the holidays.

campaign.story:
Even though TwixT has received multiple awards and accolades in its history, we are excited to share a recent honor that TwixT received that we are extremely proud of!
This re-launched version of TwixT has earned STEM.org's highest product honor, the Approved STEM Trustmark. STEM is the widely used acronym for the educational concept of "Science, Technology, Engineering & Math", and is used as an educational methodology in schools. Products that possess a STEM accreditation assist children in cultivating important reasoning skills and greatly improve their learning experience. TwixT was selected for this honor based upon the success of displaying the concepts of Engineering & Math.
Played by two people, the goal of TwixT is to build a fence from one side of the game board to the other, each player both defending their fence, as well as preventing their opponent from doing the same. Blue and Red build their fences from behind each of their respective color borders to the other side of the board.
Red must connect their pegs from the left to the right of the board, behind the border rows.
Blue must connect their pegs from the top to the bottom of the board, behind the border rows.
GAME PIECES
Pegs
Pegs may be placed anywhere on the board by each player, with the exception of behind the colored border rows of the opposing player. For example, Red may not place a pegs behind Blue's border rows, and vice versa.
Connector Fences
Connector Fences may be placed to connect two pegs of the same color to secure a border between one or more segments of the fence. 
GAME PLAY
1. Player 1 (Red) plays first. The Red Player will place a peg anywhere on the board - with the exception of behind Blue’s two border rows.
2. To prevent an advantage to Player 1, Player 2 (Blue) may invoke the “Swap Rule” which will force a swap in sides. Player 1’s color changes to Blue, and Player 2’s color changes to Red. In the event that this rule is invoked, Player 1 may have one more turn to put one Peg of his or her new color on the board. The Swap Rule may only be invoked after the first turn of the game.
3. On remaining turns, players may place as many connector fences as they wish on their colored pegs only, or remove their own existing connectors/fences as necessary for their game strategy. Each player may, however, only place one new peg at a time during their turn.
4. New pegs placed do NOT have to connect to existing pegs, and may be placed anywhere on the board, aside from the opposing player's border rows.
5. Once a connector fence has been placed, it cannot be crossed by either Player. In the below example, Red has built a connector fence, and though Blue would normally be able to connect their pegs, they cannot cross Red’s connector fence. 
6. It is possible to connect more than two pegs of the same color together. 
7. The first player to connect their fence from one side to the other, with an uninterrupted link of connector fences from behind both of his or her border rows, wins the game. If neither player can accomplish this, then the game is considered a draw.
By supporting our Kickstarter project, we are offering premium and limited Kickstarter only rewards as part of our crowdfunding effort.
Collector's Edition -- $45
Elegantly housed in a solid locking Wooden Box, which itself weighs almost two pounds, the TwixT engraved Collector's Edition adds the upgrade of metal tins to house the pegs and connector fences.  
Name Recognition Package -- $150
Literally have your name written in the history books of TwixT (aka - Instruction Manual) for the first 2 years of the game reprint!  You and 29 other names will adorn the TwixT instruction manual as the Champions of this exciting re-release!
We are proud to be working with fulfillment partners on the campaign that specialize in shipping products to Europe and North America so that we can cover the VAT taxes and backers aren't hit with a surprise payment/tax when your pledge is delivered.
Please refer to the shipping costs below, which you must pay for at the end of the campaign inside our pledge manager.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The TwixT mold is ready to go, and the factory capacity is presently 10,000 units per month, which is why there is a three month window for production time should this campaign shoot through the roof. Ideally, TwixT would be ready to ship in October, but we want to set the expectation for you to receive it by Christmas Time. 

We want to keep you in the loop with our progress, pictures, stories, and any issues via a bi-weekly status update posted to Kickstarter. 

TwixT is finally back, and we are so excited to have you aboard for the ride!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Backers,
Thank you for supporting the TwixT Kickstarter Campaign. I know many of you supported the re-launched version because of the memories you had growing up of playing with your friends and family. You told me that every day in the comments, via email, and on social media.  TwixT hasn't been around for a long time, and you helped try to revive it with your backing.
It is with heavy heart that I must announce the cancellation of the TwixT Kickstarter Campaign due to the complications that may arise with fulfillment of TwixT to backers in the EU. While TwixT, one day soon, will be available in the US in a limited quantity, I cannot guarantee that no issues will arise outside the United States.

campaign.story:
Confrontation Classic is a major reference in the world of miniature wargaming. It’s a game for two or more players, which takes place in a medieval fantasy world filled with legends, heroes, and tales of bravery. Confrontation takes place in the vast setting of Aarklash.
It’s now up to you to take command of the armies and impose your rule !
    This Celebration box will be enriched with all the stretch goals and bonuses unlocked during the campaign.
And more minis yet to unlock !
 A complete and evolving world
Confrontation Classic represents a historic point in the world of skirmish miniature wargaming. With it, you will discover a living and deep setting. Nearly 1500 different miniatures were imagined by the best artists, and the authors have described in detail the vast world of Aarklash. You can lead the agile Daïkinee Elves, the powerful Ophidian Alliance, the fearsome Griffins of Akkylannia, or any of the 16 factions represented in the box! From the high mountains of Lanever to the plains of Avagddu, from the furthest reaches of the Eastern lands to the dark swamps of No-Dan-Kar, challenge your enemies, engage in battle, and become the hero the storytellers will tell stories about forever!
What about the rules ?
Confrontation Classic wil provide in the Celebration Box two booklets (in english and french) with the Core Rules for Confrontation.
The advanced and complete rules of Confrontation as well as the Dogs od War expansion (soon) are already downloadable !
They are available in french, english, italian, german and spanish. You will also find the Confrontation 3.5 errata in french and english on :
Confrontation-universe.com
You want to discover more about Confrontation ? Check the Discovery Booklet.
The community of Confrontation is global. The game was originally sold in 40 countries and was translated into 5 languages. The players gathered in clubs, held conventions, and have developed many websites to find each other, share their battlefield feats, and trade game tips. We can’t list them all here, but here are the Sans-Détour reference sites for Confrontation. There you’ll be able to find our news, resources, and meet other players.
https://confrontation-universe.com/ The Confrontation reference site: Subscribe to the mailing list in order not to miss any of our news, download rules and newsletters, etc.
https://www.facebook.com/confrontationresurrection/ The official Facebook page of the game: news, contest games, discussions, etc.
https://www.instagram.com/confminiatures/?hl=fr The official gallery: visuals of the factions, concept art, etc.
@CONF_universe To be kept aware of information live.
 Discussions and exchanges with all of the fans and players on Discord https://discord.gg/eMEkRK
The Bounty Hunter Program Get the word out about the Confrontation Classic Kickstarter over social media and earn rewards. Learn more about the Bounty Hunter program.
In 2018, we celebrate Confrontation’s 20th anniversary, which is a much awaited event for the player’s community.
Rackham
Rackham published the Confrontation miniature game between 1997 and 2007. It was translated in five languages. During these ten years, the players experienced:
Four editions of Confrontation and The Age of the Rag’Narok
Dogs of War, an additional content for Confrontation 3
An epic battle game: Rag’Narok
A board game: Hybrid, and its expansion Nemesis
A magazine: Cry Havoc
The Aarklash universe also inspired various creations, such as Arcana, or City of Thieves and its expansion The King of Ashes, but also video games. It has also inspired a role-playing game, named after one of its major cities: Cadwallon.
Editions Sans Detour
Éditions Sans-Détour have published The Call of Cthulhu in France since 2008.
In 2015, the 7th edition of The Call of Cthulhu was subject to a crowdfunding campaign which was the most successful campaign in Europe, across all categories. Sans-Détour continues to use crowdfunding and has always delivered their projects.
Our website: http://sans-detour.com/
Kickstarter Exclusive
By backing now on Kickstarter, you’re guaranteed to get the complete edition of Confrontation Classic: meaning the 178 miniatures from the launch and all of the stretch goals which are unlocked. The event box will not be available in stores. However, it doesn’t seem reasonable to us to offer it to stores with all of the unlocked stretch goals, as in that situation we’d be getting about 30% of the final sale price, which, to turn a profit on this production, would mean selling it for roughly 1200 dollars (or more depending on how many stretch goals are unlocked). The complete offer you can enjoy here is thus a Kickstarter exclusive.
The miniatures
The core box contains 178 unique miniatures from the 16 factions of the game, plus all the unlocked stretch-goals.
Check the Starting Selection Catalog here.
Shipping costs will be calculated after the end of the campaign. You will be informed of the total amount of these shipping costs via the pledge manager: these costs will be based upon the weight of the initial box and, of course, the weight of every additional stretch goal contents and miniatures that will be unlocked during the campaign, and added to the box. In order to be cost efficient for our backers, all shipments will be sent by a logistics partner based in the final recipient’s geographical area. For example: subscribers from the American continents will receive their parcel from our US based logistics partner, whereas Europeans will receive theirs from our French based logistics partner, etc.
The following spreadsheet shows low and average estimates of the shipping costs per geographical area. These estimates are based solely on the weight of the starting material featured in the Kickstarter campaign. Therefore, they may evolve throughout the campaign, depending on the unlocked stretch goals, or which Add-on contents you choose to add to your order.
Please note that international regulations prevent us from shipping parcels to the following countries: North Korea, Cuba, Iran, Myanmar, Sudan and Syria. We add the following countries to the list of countries where we will not deliver: Afghanistan, Kazakhstan, Ukraine and Russia.
We’ll present here the planned calendars for the project’s completion. For the duration of these, please remember that these are estimates which can change depending on circumstances.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The main challenge surrounding this epic project is to respect the historical work of the authors and artists who gave life to this prolific universe. The Confrontation players’ community awaits a lot from this come-back and we really don’t want to disappoint them. 

Our experience at managing crowdfunding projects significantly reduces the risks about the way we will lead this crowdfunding campaign. We will focus on every step of this project’s life, so as to avoid any mistake:
- This project is about republishing an emblematic game, therefore we know what the customers’ and players’ expectations are. We listen to what people say on social media, and consult with the most passionate players.
- We have a very clear communication plan and an excellent media relaying.
- An entire team of professionals is entirely dedicated to this project: project manager, art director, legal, communication…
- We already master the various stages to manufacture the miniatures: concept-art, modeling, master, sprue-casting or complete and assembled miniatures…
- We have contacted many manufacturers in various countries and have already worked with Chinese, German and Spanish partners. We also discuss with fellow publishers in order to identify and avoid any incidents.
- We have an already established logistics network; we know everything about transportation, customs…
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Check out what a round of gameplay looks like! Can you imagine playing this on your game nights?
Eye for an Eye is an innovative, realtime, dice driven game of arena combat. Roll your dice, allocate them to actions on your player board and tribal cards and then call these out in realtime to carry them out on the board. Move cleverly across the arena, dancing around your opponents, build up for a strong attack, or pepper your enemy with quick ones. Play for your Tribe, or team up with another Chief or two, combo-ing your abilities with each other to devastating effect.
Pledging for Eye for an Eye contributes money towards not only funding the game, but towards making it better. We will pack the game full with as many high quality components and gameplay features as we can afford. If we hit all our stretch goals in this campaign, you will be getting 12 characters and their associated components, in addition to a series of other upgrades and additions at no extra charge.
     Click here to join our Facebook Group!
  Eye for an Eye is played in realtime to a soundtrack across a number of intense, five minute rounds. There are no turns and players all play simultaneously. Roll your dice, allocate them to actions, call those actions out and resolve them. 
Play Every Eye for Themselves or Alliance mode in casual or tournament settings. One round in five minutes, a full tournament in an hour! Eye for an Eye is a game that will have you leaping out of your seat and enthusiastically yelling your character's moves as you do battle with friends and family.
Below you can watch a short how to play video and a full round of gameplay to help you better understand how to play, what the game has to offer and so you can make a fully informed decision to back Eye for an Eye!
If you want to see how the game plays out in realtime, check out one of the videos below and look for more during the campaign!
As you can see in the above image, the figures in Eye for an Eye are quite chunky and beautifully sculpted by Bob Olley. We have produced physical sculpts rather than going with digitally sculpted files because we love the quality and depth of Bob's work. 
The sculpted base is 40mm flat to flat to provide stability during the realtime matches. None of these figures are at any risk of being knocked over.
To avoid the bases warping during the process, we will be producing them in ABS plastic instead of normal PVC like the figures are. This is much more expensive, but ensures that your figures sit flat no matter how fast you play.
Click on the images below to download the rulebook and a Print and Play of the game, featuring Palaudis Chief Grublic and Hydris Chief Riparian. We want you to be fully informed and feel confident in your decision to back Eye for an Eye. So download, play, have fun and then pledge... or pledge and then have fun!
   We'd love to hear how you go! So please share photos and videos of you and your group battling! Share who wins and across the campaign we'll keep track to see who is the ultimate Occulite Chief. Palaudis' Chief Grublic? Or Hydris' Chief Riparian! Cheer for your favourite!
Click here to read the preview
                                 Click to read the preview!
                       Boardgame Exposure - Mark Capell-Helm - Coming Soon
Board's Eye View - Selwyn Ward - Coming Soon
Chief Grublic has been around since the very first Sungem Season and has always been a strong and successful leader of his Palaudis Tribe. Chief Grublic does not go anywhere without his Luftle advisor ‘Cobbie’ perched on his shoulder. The two have been inseparable since Grublic banished a rogue group of Palaudis to the Tundra wastes for the mistreatment of Luftles.
Innate Ability - *Watch Out!*
Band I Ability - Leap    
Band II Ability - *Shield Bash*
Band III Ability - Thunderstomp
Chief Riparian was originally her Tribe’s healer until the Chief was killed at the beginning of The Drums of War. Due to the way she had looked after her Tribe, nature, as is the way with Hydris, honoured her with the new leadership. Her stalks rallied behind her as she quickly worked her way up the ranks to become one of Hydris’ leading Chiefs by the time the wars ended.
Innate Ability - Healing Mucus
Band I Ability - Slippery    
Band II Ability - Lunge  
Band III Ability - Hunting Net
Chief Banksia was known by his enemies for his brutality and stubborness. During the Drums of War he would only lead his strongest members into a fight, a decision that would often leave them woefully outnumbered. This was never a problem for Banksia who saw this as a challenge. He is always had a plan that could snatch remarkable victories from the very jaws of defeat.
Innate Ability - Savage Strike
Band I Ability - Camouflage
Band II Ability - Ambush
Band III Ability - Brutal Charge
Chief Incendiary is a modest and honourable leader of the Ignis Occulites. To reduce losses to his stalks, he ensured that his Tribe never fought a battle in vain. During The Drums of War, Incendiary focused most of his attentions on defending the Ignis land borders, which he did successfully for the entire war. He only ever allied with Tribes for honourable purposes and was a key figure in brokering peace amongst the Tribes at the end of the war.
Innate Ability - Steam Blast
Band I Ability - Slow Heat
Band II Ability - Vented Heat Blast
Band III Ability - Sword Dance
Chief Pluma is known for her swift decision making and surgical precision. Sometimes thought of as reckless, her actions were always in the best interest of her beloved Nimbus Tribe. During The Drums of War, she soared high above the battlefield to ascertain troop movements, head off ambushes and if need be, intercept enemies. She is respected by her peers and feared by her enemies - the mark of a true leader in the Nimbus culture. 
Innate Ability - Gliding
Band I Ability - Will of the Wind
Band II Ability - Raking Talons
Band III Ability - Dive Bomb
Chief Echo was mentored by Chief Grublic before being encouraged to raise his own army of Luftles and Wymbrix to carve their own place in the Occulite world. During The Drums of War, he was extremely proficient and strategically brilliant, taking in all he had learned from Grublic and those around him and reimagining it in his own unique way - hence his name Chief Echo. Despite the Arena’s original intent being just for Occulites to settle disputes, with the support of Grublic and other allies, he successfully argued that Luftles should be able to settle their own disputes in the Arena.
Innate Ability - Diversion
Band I Ability - Surge
Band II Ability - Protect the Chief!
Band III Ability - Luftle Swarm!
Eye for an Eye is made all the better by every single one of our contributors. Together, we have produced what you see before you - Eye for an Eye - a labour of love, hard work, blood, sweat and tears. The amalgamation of many years of work, Shae and I would like to acknowledge and sincerely thank the following people for their amazing contributions to our game.
Click on the images to take you to their website.
As you may already know, Eye for an Eye is part of a series of games called the 'Rise of the Occulites' Saga. The very first game published in this series - Dawn: Rise of the Occulites, also takes place at the very beginning of the saga, a long time before Eye for an Eye. This narrative, scenario based skirmish game allows you to step in as Tribe Chief of your own Occulite Tribe. Powered by the Natural Selection Deck and sporting 19 scenarios, it has a metric tonne of replayability.
We've had a lot of people asking if Dawn will be included here as an add on. Instead of doing that, we got together with Eagle Games and organised for them to run a sale on Dawn alongside our campaign. The best part is that you can order it right now by CLICKING HERE! 
Find out how the Occulite Saga began and pick up the complete Dawn - Rise of the Occulites game for a great price and play it while you wait for your copy of Eye for an Eye to arrive. Get immersed in the world! 
Straight out of the box pre-paints of Dawn - Rise of the Occulites
Full contents of Painted Dawn - Rise of the Occulites
Dawn - Rise of the Occulites is available both in pre-painted and unpainted, so pick one up that best suits your needs!
Shipping is not included in any of the pledge levels for this campaign and will be charged some time after the campaign has ended. This allows us to ensure that we charge an accurate amount for shipping. It also gives us time to ensure that we get a good balance between quality and low cost shipping solutions once we know how much content is going to be produced for the game.
We have engaged Quartermaster Logistics to fulfil our project which means we are EU, Canada, Australia and United States friendly. Below you will find our estimated shipping costs. It is possible that these may change as we cannot control the global market, but we believe that these should be fairly accurate costings.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Darwin Games has been involved in the manufacturing phase for two games previously - Dawn: Rise of the Occulites (along with Eagle Games) and Survival - Frogs of South Eastern Australia. Based on these experiences and extensive research, we are confident that we are well equipped to handle this process.

We have already paid for all of the art, figure sculpting and soundtrack creation in advance (and these components are all complete). We have also been in regular communication with our chosen manufacturer pre checking files and component details. This is in an effort to ensure that the project minimises the chances for any delays and so that we can get it into manufacturing as soon as possible after the campaign ends.

Having said that, there is always the possibility of delays occurring. Shipping times and getting through customs can cause delays as can the length of time with manufacturing, especially in regards to the tooling of the figures. We have put a realistic timeline on production, but will always be striving to deliver as early as we can. We want to see the finished game in our hands too!

We have been in contact with fulfilment services who will be prepared to ship the game when it gets to them.

At Darwin Games, we value honesty and integrity very highly and as such we will be transparent throughout this process.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Come and join us! Eye for an Eye Relaunch travelling well!
updates.update_content:
G'day Tribal Chiefs,

Just wanted to do another update to let you know how we are going on the relaunch.
Currently we are 29% funded with 26 days to go! A much more solid result than last time, but we need your help to push forward and get this funded.
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/572337545/eye-for-an-eye-an-occulite-arena-combat-boardgame
At the end of the last campaign, we asked you what you wanted to see and we have worked hard to make Eye for an Eye the best possible value we can.

updates.update_userinfo: Eye for an Eye Relaunch is LIVE!
updates.update_content:
G'day Tribal Chiefs!

The day has finally come when Eye for an Eye has relaunched. We took a bit longer than we anticipated to bring it back, but it is here now. Thank you so much for your support during the first campaign, we hope that you will come on over to the relaunch and help us get the game on your table!

You can jump on over and pledge for it here:
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/572337545/eye-for-an-eye-an-occulite-arena-combat-boardgame

updates.update_userinfo: Turn Based Variant Intro and Gameplay Videos
updates.update_content:
G'day Tribal Chiefs!
Just a quick update today to share a couple of videos that we've put together to help show off the Turn Based Variant for Eye for an Eye.
We suggest that you watch the first video below before watching the full play through as it will give you an idea of the changes that have occurred for the Turn Based Variant. We'd love to hear what you think, so please feel free to comment, or ask questions below. If you know someone that doesn't like realtime, but would love this game, let them know that it now does both realtime and turn based gameplay and direct them to these videos.

updates.update_userinfo: Turns or no turns? Why not both?
updates.update_content:
G'day Tribal Chiefs,
How is everyone going? Having Occulite withdrawals yet? Don't worry, we've got you covered! But first, thank you to everyone that completed the post KS survey that we sent out. You rock! We really value your thoughts and feedback and it is going to help make our second KS run a big success.
Most of you said that you loved the realtime aspect of the game (thanks! so do we!), but there were a number of people that wanted to like the game, but felt that it would be too stressful, or too fast for them to play and that they would prefer more time to consider their decisions. In fact several people said it is what stopped them from pledging for the game.

updates.update_userinfo: Eye for an Eye Relaunch Survey
updates.update_content:
G'day Tribal Chiefs,
Thanks so much for all the support, messages and even short stories that you have all shared with us since cancelling the project. It genuinely helped boost our spirits after making such a tough call and reinforced our drive to bring Eye for an Eye to your tabletop.
To be able to have a successful relaunch of Eye for an Eye on Kickstarter, we need to gather as much information from people that backed and didn't back as possible. This will help us reframe our relaunch to be more successful and cement Eye for an Eye as Darwin Games' cornerstone product.

G'day Tribal Chiefs!
Shae and I sat down tonight after having many discussions over the last few days thinking that this might be a very uncomfortable update to write. The start to this campaign has taken us by surprise and not at all gone the way we thought that it might have. So after many discussions and much hard work behind the scenes, we have decided to cancel and relaunch Eye for an Eye. Please read through this update carefully so that you have a good idea about what is going on with Eye for an Eye in the future as a well as getting a glimpse at one of our extra characters - Tudicus Chief Emydura.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is not our first rodeo. We have successfully funded thirteen projects and have delivered hundreds of thousands of products to tens of thousands of individuals.

The art, design, and layout of Dungeon Boss is finished. Our biggest risk is calculating our delivery estimate. It took one of our projects over a month to clear European customs, for example, and we’ve experienced manufacturing delays on a few projects (which is always a consideration when producing products in China!) We’ve added several weeks to our delivery schedule to allow for similar events.

There are no serious risks to getting this game printed and shipped. Dungeon Boss is ready to roll, and as soon as we get funds from Kickstarter, files and 3D models will be sent to our manufacturers!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
All,  
One of the virtues of Kickstarter is that we get to test a product's viability before actually bringing it to market. It is clear that the Dungeon Boss board game, in the form we presented it, is not a viable product right now. All of us at Petersen Games, and our friends at Boss Fight, were very surprised at this outcome. We believe the game is fun, the miniatures outstanding, and everything was in place for this to be a success. Unfortunately, it was not, and so we have canceled the project.

campaign.story:
What's Super Chibi Round 4? It's the next step in the Super Chibi miniatures line. What is Super Chibi? It's a shared universe that spans four interesting worlds, created by MidKnight Heroes. Each world has its own style and flare but is 100% pure Chibi. What's in the Super Chibi worlds? Everything from mecha and cyborgs, to fantasy and monsters!
Super Chibi miniatures are high quality 30mm multi-part resin miniatures that can be used for board games, role-playing games or even great additions to your miniatures collection! The sky's the limit!  
This Kickstarter introduces three more characters from the worlds in the Super Chibi universe. These characters are from the world of Super Chibi Sector 7, Super Chibi Tactics, and Super Chibi Clash. In this Kickstarter, we are asking for help casting these three new characters; Nona, Tenago and Sakura. All the sculpts are done, we just need help getting them cast. This Kickstarter will cover the expense of taking them from their mastered sculpts by Heriberto Valle Martinez to the mold and casting process also help in providing us with funds to help produce additional figures, with an aim to populate the worlds of Super Chibi.  
As in our previous Kickstarters, we will be including a book, Super Chibi Round 4: Origins. This time, it will tell the stories of our three main characters in their respective worlds.The book will include three short stories that will explain the world of Super Chibi Sector 7 and Super Chibi Tactics and Super Chibi Clash. Just like all of our books, it will be published by MONOLITH and after the Kickstarter, will be made available on their website.
CORE FUNDING: $900
Stretch Goals: Damien [Unlocked], Sedi [Unlocked] Takata Bust, Grog [Unlocked]
Takata Bust Options: 
Takata bust will come with the option of two heads if unlocked.
Pledge Levels:
 Painting Pledges:
This time around, we have two studios that have offered their services to paint up the core sets for those who back at their level. This means you have a chance to get the core set (not stretch goals) painted up by some amazing painters. Let's take a look at the two studios offering their services to Super Chibi Round 4. 
**Note: Your pledge covers shipping to the painter but not for fulfillment. Fulfillment follows normal shipping policy. [See Below.] 
**Note: Painting pledge may take longer than the standard fulfillment. Once items are received by Midknight Heroes they will then be shipped to the painting studios for work. Times will vary but communaction will be maintained at all times between us and the backers.  
 So who is Moon Punch Painting? Well how about we find out...
“We paint minis!”  
Based in The Philippines, Moon Punch Painting is a commission painting service that specializes in pieces headed to the tabletop. From miniature wargames, board games or RPGs, they paint minis that they are proud to game with themselves.  
 You don’t have to play with grey!
https://www.facebook.com/MoonPunchPainting/
Feel free to contact them, let them know that Natakue from Midknight Heroes sent you.
So who is Snickernack Studios?
Snickernack Studios is a 2 person based commission studio in Las Vegas, Nv. Of which the chibi fanatic is Yeji Kim.
Yeji Kim is a miniature painter with a specialty in the realm of Chibis and focuses on using bright, bold colors. She has been painting off and on since 2011 and became a commissioned artist by name of Snickernack Studios in 2015. She is the co-founder of Models Workshop and a host of the popular painting podcast, Models Workshop After Hours. She has been teaching miniature painting at the convention level since 2016.
You can find her works at her Facebook page:
https://www.facebook.com/Snickernackstudios/
Feel free to contact her for any and all Chibi commission you need. Let her know that Natakue of Midknight Hereos sent you. :) 
Shipping: 
We will charge shipping after the Kickstarter, based on the actual costs and weight. This will be collected after the campaign ends via our pledge manager. 
IMPORTANT: DO NOT INCLUDE ADDITIONAL FUNDS TO COVER YOUR POSTAGE PAYMENT IN YOUR PLEDGE AT THIS TIME. 
Any funds collected through the KS system are reduced by 10% when Kickstarter collects their fees; this means that any funds collected to cover postage are 10% less than what is actually needed to cover postage, if the postage rates do not increase at the time of billing and shipping (postal rates have increased on us during our projects at least once prior to fulfillment; in one case, the rates increased twice). 
After the campaign ends, backers will be able to select their rewards, via the pledge manager. Shipping costs will be calculated at that time. You will also be able to select additional reward options at that time if you wish.
Postage will be calculated by region when backers make their choices via our pledge management system. All postage fees must be paid before shipment can be completed. Rewards will be posted from the United States to all backer's addresses. 
Postage ESTIMATES by region: (please note these are estimates only; your actual shipping charge may be higher or lower depending on the rates at the time of shipping). 
US $4.00 - $15.00 (1st Class or Priority Mail) 
CAN / UK / EU $15.00 - $25.00 
AU / NZ / ROW $15 - $30. 
MidKnight Heroes is not responsible for any customs duties, taxes or fees incurred as a result. 
US rewards may be shipped via either USPS 1st Class or USPS Priority mail. All International Mail is shipped USPS 1st Class International mail.
***Note: We have seen with our last set that it can be stuck in customs for a while. If this does happen there is nothing we can do outside of wait.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our core development team is made up of artists, writers, and game designers. This is the same team that first started working on the project over three years ago and has done most of the work to bring it to you. We realized early in the project that our greatest challenge in bringing our vision to life, would be finding a great sculptor. We have done our research and found the best sculptor for the job. His name, Heriberto Valle Martinez.

A big part of this Kickstarter is to gain the funding to pay for the overall production of the miniatures. We have thoroughly researched the costs associated with sculpting, molding, production, and shipping of the core set of miniatures. We are confident that we have considered all of the costs that will be associated with this project.

Our biggest challenge will be the time needed to sculpt and produce the miniatures. As the sculptors have to most of the stretch goal work after the project funds, the time-frame following the Kickstarter may be longer than we initially wanted. Please bear with us, these miniatures will be awesome and well worth the wait. We will keep you informed with regular updates on the progress of the project. We're not going to be idle while the sculptors are doing their work, however. The rest of the team will be busy developing the future line of miniatures and finishing games for future releases.

We reserve the right to modify pieces shown to meet production requirements.

YOUR BACKER RESPONSIBILITY IN THIS KICKSTARTER

Our pledge manager for this Kickstarter will be our online store. Sometime after the completion of this Kickstarter, you will receive a survey confirming your pledge and giving you info on when the pledge manager will open. You will have a set amount of time to confirm your pledge. That time frame will be relayed to you via an email. If you do not confirm your pledge in the allotted time you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received. We ask that as soon as you can you confirm your pledge to make the whole process quicker and easier.

You are responsible for all fees associated with the transit and acceptance by you to complete delivery. These include, but are not limited to: import duties or any other duties that may be payable to the relevant and taxing authorities, VAT and GST due and delivery acceptance, brokerage and collection charges.

You are required to provide correct address information and ensure this address is deliverable by normal methods before your rewards are shipped.

Rewards returned to us as undeliverable will be shipped again postage prepaid by the Backer.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
*THIS CAMPAIGN'S CONTENT IS A KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE AND THESE SETS WILL NOT BE AVAILABLE AT RETAIL! (This is your chance to participate in this celebration!) 
Missed the campaign? You can enter our Late Pledge Manager by clicking the above image. The Late Pledge Manager opens May 8th, and supplies are limited.
Now the whole Street Fighter Universe is literally at your fingertips! What are you waiting for?!  
Help Ryu on his journey to surpass all Stretch Goals! Each one we unlock is added to your pledge for Free! We've planned for 12 additional fighters & battle decks to be unlocked during the campaign! With all those unlocked you get TRIPLE the size of a Base Pledge at the Street Fighter Level!
We wanted to make our miniatures so good that even if you didn't play the game at all, your pledge would still be fully worth it for these impressive works of art alone - and at their Collectors Scale, they are wonderful pieces to display around your home or office!  
Street Fighter: The Miniatures Game uses a unique scale, the brand new "Collector's Scale"! This giant-sized scale has your models large and in charge from 65mm tall all the way up to 85mm tall on some characters all on a standardized 58mm base! We will be offering this scale for all our future Universal Tactics System Games.   
This size offers tons of advantages:
The miniatures are more like small collectable statues and makes them great for displaying around the house even if you don't play the game at all!  
The larger the mini the better the pre-paint process, our pre-painted miniatures are simply the best the industry can currently offer, rivalling that of action figures and full sized collector statues!  
Playing with larger miniatures on a board with 3D terrain gives amazing table presence when you pull this game out at any gathering! You'll be the talk of the town!  
We believe its quality over quantity, why have buckets of tiny miniatures if they don't get played packed away in expansion box after expansion box? These miniatures will get a lot of table time as your sole representation on the battlefield!  
Take a look at our featured miniatures video below!
Let us get a detailed look at each one of our fighters included in the Core Set!
Adding a NEW DIMENSION to Street Fighter!  
Destructible Stage Terrain adds a new exciting element to the Street Fighter experience and it adds a new layer of strategic depth to the game as you attempt to out outmaneuver your opponent and set them up for extra damage!  
Each round the terrain is reset and the fighter positions swapped as to offer an equal opportunity to both players, plus its just more fun to crash into more stuff. Smart awareness, positioning and baiting your opponent can easily win you the day!  
HOW TO PLAY THE GAME. IT'S SIMPLE!  
We wanted anyone to be able to jump right in and play! So we had to make learning the game simple, but yet still have the depth to please experienced gamers and fighting game fans. This was an extremely challenging task for sure, especially when you consider the game system is built not only for Versus Mode but also Free for All and Team Games, essentially three games in one! However after 2 years of development we've believe we have found the right balance between accessibility, strategy, luck and fun factor!  
It's as Simple as.... DRAW. MOVE. FIGHT!
1. DRAW! - Draw 2 cards from your Battle Deck as you start your turn. Skipping this only for the first turn you take.
2. MOVE! - Move your character up to their Movement Value in any direction.
3. FIGHT! - Take 2 Actions in any order and in any amount from these Actions:  MOVE, DRAW, or PLAY A CARD.
On defense your choice is even easier but yet still an important tension filled decision. Do you BLOCK or COUNTER-ATTACK?
BLOCK - Roll two default Battle Dice and apply results vs opponent's attack roll.  You may also discard certain cards with defensive dice values to "BOOST" your Block Roll.
-OR-
COUNTER-ATTACK - Play a Counter for a Strike, Special or Projectile, if successful discard opponents card and perform Counter-Attack Ability, usually causing damage during your opponents turn!
And that's how the game works! 
As you roll your Battle Dice & play your cards you will gain meter results which contribute to your Meter Gauge allowing you to enhance certain attacks or save these for the powerful Super and Ultra Combos that can finish your opponents instantly! Best 2 rounds out of 3 WINS!
 CLICK THE IMAGE BELOW TO DOWNLOAD THE BETA RULEBOOK!
Click the Image above to Download the BETA Rulebook!
The Boss Expansion adds in two extremely powerful Street Fighter Bosses. The power level of these bosses is so immense that other players will need to team-up to defeat them in a near hopeless final battle! Here's what's in the set in more detail!  
Street Fighter: The Miniatures Game Boss Expansion includes everything you need to introduce extremely powerful Boss characters. This expansion also includes the Boss Mode game rules in which one player controls the boss in a battle against a team of three rival players! Can you and your friends stop this evil-doer's dastardly plan?  
BOSS EVENT DECKS  
Every Boss comes with a unique Event Deck that can change the battlefield conditions dramatically, forcing the players to cooperate and strategize to deal with the new threat! Each new boss game is a different experience as only 6 to 8 of these events are drawn each game on average!
BOSS FIGHTER BATTLE DECKS
In addition to the Boss Mode, the Boss Expansion includes normal 40-Card Boss-Fighter Decks so that the boss can join in with the rabble and fight on a more even level with their opponents in Versus, Free For All, and Team Modes!
If you would like to purchase any of these optional add-on's, please click the "Manage Your Pledge" button on this games Kickstarter Page and in the pledge manager add the total amount of the items you'd like to get to your total pledge. Our Custom Pledge Manager sent out later will then allow you to pick the specific add-on's you'd like before checkout!

This Kickstarter is a celebration of over 30 years of the greatest fighting game franchise of all-time! Please enjoy this Documentary detailing the history of the game from the 25th Anniversary!  
We view this as a premium product for fans of Street Fighter, tabletop games and collectable products. The costs of manufacturing a game like this are extremely high due to a number of factors including:  
Individual "Collector Sized" pre-painted special FX's miniatures that are comparable in size to ("Nintendo Amiibos") that can retail for around $14.99 each! And we are packing 8 of them into a single box! 24 in the World Warrior Pledge!
We have planned at least 12 Stretch Goal Fighter Miniatures and their Battle Decks as unlocks, each one of these are at no cost to our backers! This cuts heavily into our margins and makes offering this many free mini's impossible at Retail! So get them while you can!
This game has among the highest number of full sized top quality playing cards in a single tabletop game ever! 428 cards in the Street Fighter Pledge and each new character unlocked in Stretch Goals adds another 40 cards, an extremely expensive and costly inclusion! With all Stretch Goals unlocked and the World Warrior pledge that's over 1,548 cards! A ridiculous amount and again impossible at Retail!
Countless pieces of professional & unique artwork for each type of attack and event cards in a Character Deck!
The only way a game like this is made possible is to sell directly to our passionate backers who are looking for a premium and high-quality product. As lifelong fans of the franchise, we simply wanted to make the best possible game regardless of the cost! So jump in on this exclusive opportunity, you never know how valuable these limited pieces can become in the future!
If demand is extremely high we may consider in the far future making a retail version of the game with a lower amount of miniatures, perhaps unpainted and at a smaller scale.
If you miss the kickstarter the game may only be available at conventions and direct from Jasco Games in limited quantities.

campaign.story:
Once upon a time the 3 Billy-Goats Gruff were stopped by a horrible troll while trying to cross a bridge. The goats destroyed that Troll, and ever since that time shepherds have weaponized their herds to become weaponized monster goats called Gruffs! Gruff is a tactical combat card game where players duel to the death with custom teams of Mutated Monster Goats! Gruff features unique positional and timing mechanics that create a constant state of attack and counter-play.
Stuff of Nightmares is a stand-alone game that is fully compatible with the Gruff rules system and other Gruff games. Stuff of Nightmares provides the same visceral competitive experience as Gruff, but adds a new faction to the game, plushy nightmare goats called The Stuffkin! 
 A Brutally Competitive Game- Stuff of Nightmares' combat mechanics create a constant state of counter-play. When an enemy attacks, you have your entire turn to dodge out of the way, mount your defenses, and launch a counterattack before the attack connects!  
A Challenging Single Player Game- In Stuff of Nightmares you will be able to battle solo against the trolls that we unlock as stretch-goals in the campaign. Each troll is a distinct challenge ranging from fairly simple to extremely challenging! 
An Awesome Co-Op Game- Players can collaborate with each other to take down the trolls that we unlock during the campaign!  Play cards to support your teammate on their turn so that you both can taste the sweetness of victory together!
A Fantastic Multiplayer Game- Stuff of Nightmares can support a four-player tournament out of a single box! It also allows for three- and four-player free-for-all matches and a two-vs.-two mode!
 Stuff of Nightmares is a stand-alone addition to the Gruff line of games. The Gruff series has been honored with several awards, including these!
The Gruff series has received a lot of praise from the board game media!
 All stretch-goals will be included in the box of the game, so any reward that gives a copy of Gruff: Stuff of Nightmares will include all stretch goals. 
  You can get an extra physical copy of Gruff: Stuff of Nightmares, Rage of the Trolls, Clash of the Battle Goats, Gruff, or the Stuffkin play-mat by adding the amount listed per item to your pledge. Follow these steps to add to your pledge: Press the blue "Manage" button. If you have not yet pledged, the button will say "Back This Project" instead. Increase your pledge amount by the amount listed on each extra add-on you would like. All copies of Gruff: Stuff of Nightmares will include all stretch-goal content! Backers outside of the US: Please add $5 per add-on item for shipping.
 Check out these cool videos explaining how to play Gruff!
 You can check out the rulebook here!
Stuff of Nightmares is a Kickstarter Exclusive project. This means that this game will only be manufactured to fulfill orders made during this campaign. Minimimal extra inventory will be created to replace damaged copies. Any excess will be sold during conventions and on our website studiowoe.com. 
 These cards and stickers will be added to the Premium, Double, Combo, and Alpha Backer Tiers! Help us unlock these goodies by spreading the word on social media. Please like, subscribe, retweet, and rate on the following links!

Shipping costs to the US are included in the cost at each tier. International shipping costs are reduced by that same amount. So, for example at the player tier it costs $5 to ship the game to an address within the US and $11 to the rest of the world, $5 is cut from the international shipping cost resulting in a shipping cost of $6. 
All orders will be sent from within the US, but in almost every case the Gruff games (even this larger sized box), are small enough that people are not normally charged customs fees. If you do get charged a customs fee contact support@studiowoe.com from your active PayPal email address with the customs receipt and we will promptly refund that amount to you.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is Studio Woe's 5th Kickstarter campaign and 4th Gruff game. There is always the potential for disruption, but we have a good bit of experience with developing this game at this point.

We are doing a couple new exciting things with this set, which potentially increase risk. This is the largest set we have produced since the original Gruff game, and this is our most aggressive production timeline on a game. Our hope is that the things we have learned over the last few years will help us handle these issues without disruptive problems.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Everybody wins!

What an amazing journey this has been so far! I have to admit I was terrified to embark on this leg of the journey. This is my first time doing "Self-fulfillment" for a Kickstarter campaign. I learned a lot along the way, but we got the job done. 
Many of you already have your games, If not they should be coming very soon! If you have not yet received a tracking number for your package, it may be for one of the following reasons.

campaign.story:
When we started Restoration Games, we asked you to tell us which games to bring back. The number one request, by far, was Fireball Island. After more than a year of hard work, we are thrilled to announce: Fireball Island is back!
If this is your first time checking out the campaign, good to see you! You'll be thrilled to know that our amazing backers have already unlocked tons of stretch goals (and more still to come). As you check out the page, keep in mind that your pledge will also include all of this amazing stuff.
On the other hand, if you know you want it all and you want it now, we've got you covered.
So what are you waiting for? Come on and join the fun!
Fireball Island: The Curse of Vul-Kar improves on the art, components, and game play of the original. If you loved the game as a child, you'll see we turned that "delightful chaos" up to the max. If you never played it before, you'll appreciate it as a fun, exciting game for kids, families, and gamers alike.
We found a way to make the new island bigger, taller, faster, and cooler -- all while fitting in a smaller box.
Tom Vasel and the Dice Tower crew sat down with Justin Jacobson, the president of Restoration Games for a full, live playthrough of the base game, which should give you a good idea of how the game plays.
Sometimes, you may face Vul-Kar the way you want...
... but even then you can't be sure which way it will come out.
Even as the marble careens down the mountain, the paths and trees can divert it one way or another.
A tree might even save your life.
While the fireballs are unpredictable, we made sure that players have more control over their actions and more meaningful choices.
On your turn, play one of your two action cards to move your pawn and perform a special action.
Grab a snapshot from each part of the island and get back to the helipad.
Earn points for collecting sets of treasure.
If you get knocked down, you'll lose a treasure but gain a useful souvenir.
If you draw a Cataclysm, Vul-Kar gets to take a turn.
In all, the game remains fast, fun, and light, but offers meaningful choices.
We've also made arrangements with Rodney Smith of Watch It Played! to do a rules video at the time of release. 
NOTE: The board in the images above is a hand-painted prototype and does not reflect final art for the island. Here is the near-final art for the island and some renders showing off the detail that will show up on the finished board.
Blades of grass and cracked stones ease your path.
A lonely crab woos visitors at Skeleton Head Beach.
There are four expansions available in this campaign, and they are fully interchangeable with the base game and each other. We've also added some amazing new components, through hitting stretch goals, with no additional charge to backers.
                                                                                                                                                                                                       The view from the poop deck.
Hope you got that snapshot, Saul.
                                                                                                                                                                                        If this is your first Kickstarter, welcome! It's easy to get involved, and being a part of the community can be a lot of fun. All you have to do is:
Click on the pledge level you want to back.
Enter your email address and “Continue as guest”.
Enter your payment information.
Click the big green “Pledge” button 
To keep things simple, there are only two tiers for regular backers.
(You can order additional copies or optional buys by increasing your pledge amount. See Shipping and Fulfillment below for more details.)
For verified brick-and-mortar stores: We also have a special pledge level that is just for you. You pledge only $20 during the campaign. When we are ready to ship the games, after the campaign closes, you will use our pledge manager to finalize your order and pay the remaining balance due. If you have any question about your status, please message us, and we will confirm before pledging. All the terms and other information about this pledge level can be found in this special update.
We've blown through dozens of stretch goals, like a fireball through a rickety bridge, and unlocked tons of great additional content. Backers get the Treasure Trove expansion pack for free, and it's already full of new souvenirs, injury cards, and more.
Unlocked sleeves (optional buy, manually add $15 to your pledge).
Painted minis (optional buy, manually add $10 to your pledge).
Maker Kit (optional buy, manually add $40 to your pledge)
Not much time left to hit those stretch goals!
Given the unique design of the game, we only have one prototype and couldn't send out review copies. We wanted a fun way to let a bunch of people play the game, so we took the show on the road! J.R. Honeycutt, our Tinker-in-Chief, set off on a 30-day, 13-state road trip, including a stop in Canada! We met up with some of the most amazing game stores, cafes, conventions, and content creators to bring you a chance to play the game in person. And, of course, we got to meet our amazing fans and backers. It was truly a special happening. Below are some videos from the trip. (Note: These videos are of the hand-painted prototype board; the final version of the board will have printed art and won't be as shiny.)
One of our backers, MAJBrown22 was able to make it to the Secret Cabal Meetup at Beermongers and wrote up his impressions in this Board Game Geek forum post. 
Chris has apparently been ensorcelled by Vul-Kar.
 Check out some epic skill shots in this supercut:
PLAY

We are using key fulfillment partners within each shipping region. There are no additional customs fees, VAT, or similar charges.
There is only one shipping charge per region regardless of what reward you get -- we're subsidizing the rest.
For the US, Canada, and the EU, we are proud to partner with Quartermaster Logistics, the premier provider of Kickstarter fulfillment in the gaming industry. Your games will be safely packed by their professional team, and you’ll be emailed a tracking number when your package ships. For Australian backers, we'll be using Aetherworks, who we used on our Stop Thief! campaign and who did a great job.
If you would like to order a second copy, just increase your pledge amount by the cost of that pledge. You do not need to add anything for additional shipping. If you want more than two copies, add the shipping charge for each additional set of one or two. For example, if you wanted to get three copies of the base game sent to Canada, you would pledge a total of $220.
We are using BackerKit, a third-party service that lets us manage ordering and shipping. This service starts after the Kickstarter campaign is over. You'll have the chance add items to your pledge at that time. Importantly, though, there will be no additional fees due after the campaign. When you pledge, it will automatically calculate and add all shipping charges. The only additional charge is if you decide to get more stuff. Both pledge levels will be available in BackerKit. You can back the campaign now at any amount and choose your pledge later, or you can back at the Feel the Burn level and upgrade to the Full Vul-Kar.
IMPORTANT NOTE: Due to the limitations of our license, we are only able to offer the game in English and in the US, Canada, EU, and Australia. Please see the FAQ for more information.
As we head into the final hours of this campaign, every point of contact and bit of buzz can help. Send the message out far and wide on social media. Use these social media avatars to show your love for the game. And, remember, sometimes the best way is a direct, personal email to that one person you just know will get a kick out of it. Every little bit helps.
Restoration Games was founded by Justin D. Jacobson and Rob Daviau on a shared love of all those great board games they played when they were kids. We knew there were a lot of great treasures hidden beneath the sands of time. When we announced our plans, the response was overwhelming. We are dedicated to restoring these games to their rightful glory, bringing the fun to those with fond memories, and publishing great games for demanding gamers.
We must acknowledge the rest of the team who put in an unblelievable effort to make this a reality. Jason Taylor is our Visual Restoration Wizard, who is the reason everything we do looks so good. Lindsay Daviau is our Production Superhero, who ensures the finished products look amazing. JR Honeycutt is our Tinker-in-Chief; he helps get a game from the idea to a finished design. Suzanne Sheldon, our Master-of-Fireworks, makes sure everyone knows what we're up to.
We had lots of talented help with the art and design of the game. George Doutsiopoulos did the fantastic cover illustrations for the base game and the three main expansions. Card art is by Victor Perez Corbella. David Kegg did the retro art that appears in various places in the game, branding, and this campaign. Jean-Louis Sirois helped with some extra foliage illustration you see on this page and on the gameboard. Additional thanks to Matijos Gebreselassie and Bill Tiller for early concept illustrations. 3D sculpting for the miniatures and island features is by Chad Hoverter. Noah Adelman of Game Trayz, LLC did the initial design work on the island trays. Design Innovation, Inc. finalized the island trays. The video work was done by Josh McDowell, and the voiceover was performed by Graham Rowat. Rulebook editing was done by the Meeple Lady. Our thanks to all of them for their unbelievable effort in bringing this project to fruition.
And, of course, we would be remiss not to mention the original masterminds behind the game, Bruce Lund and Chuck Kennedy.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our second Kickstarter and fourth game overall. Our first Kickstarter, for Stop Thief! was, by all accounts, a huge success. We received many compliments on how we handled everything, making sure everyone got their games in a timely manner. We pride ourselves on our customer service. If something happens, we'll work hard to make it right.

That said, Fireball Island is a design project unlike any other, involving three-dimensional, mechanical, plastics. Rob, Jason, and Lindsay have decades of experience working at Hasbro on such products.

This is also a licensed product. However, Justin negotiated complete creative control in the licensing agreement. Therefore, no final approval is needed to move to production.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
