campaign.story:
Starting from Easter 2017, we decided to begin creating miniatures dedicated to major holidays.
These limited edition items will delight enthusiasts, collectors and artists alike, and the models may even end up on board games if the players can use their imagination well enough!
Our concept is to bring out one or more dedicated models each year, at regular intervals, for a limited period of time and in limited quantities. After the regular sales period ends, models will enter our Legacy Vault, which will remain closed until the next event: once it's closed for good, the models inside will not be sold anymore.
But what is the Legacy Vault and how does it work?
Legacy Miniatures are fairly rare models that aren't normally available for purchase in our store. You can sometimes find them in on sale during special events and always for a very short time. The Legacy Vault is the place where Legacy Miniatures are kept after the sales period ends. Inside this Vault you will find all limited models made in past events. Be warned, the Vault may not reopen for future sales, so if you see a piece that you like and are on the fence, you'd better not risk lossing it for good, and grab it quickly. There's no guarantee it will be available again next year, or the one after that! A certificate will also be issued with each model, authenticating its number and release of issue.
A Certificate will come with every limited model that you buy from this campaign.
Models are in 32mm scale. However, bear in mind that this does not mean that they will measure 32 mm from head to toe, but rather that they will have the proportions of this scale.
Models will be made in resin and/or metal, depending on the model. Each model will come with a generic base, but we are sure that the experts among you will be able to create a small diorama for these limited editions.
FREE shipping to Europe, USA, Canada
                           FREE shipping to Europe, USA, Canada
            FREE shipping to Europe, USA, Canada
     FREE shipping to Europe, USA, Canada
     If they’re unlocked, all these models will be FREE for any pledge level from Tier 1 upwards.

If you want, you can add any number of these as Add-Ons to your pledge: just increase your PLEDGE TOTAL by the reward's corresponding amount, and you’re done. You will then confirm your choice with a post-campaign Pledge Manager system. Thank you!
     To add an add-on to your pledge, please increase your PLEDGE TOTAL by the corresponding amount. You will confirm your choices with a post-campaign pledge manager. Thank you!
             This model will join in the Legacy Vault. This mean that will be available  to purchase only during this campaign and particular events
                       DHL will be used as courier service for all packages and orders.
Shipping costs will be included (and free of charge) from Tieri 1 or higher coming from the EU, the UK, the USA or Canada. For orders coming from anywhere else in the world, the shipping costs will be 16 euros, which you will be charged for during the Pledge Manager procedure. For Add-ons or single models:
EU - UK: FREE SHIPPING  (or 10/12 € for single purchase)
USA - CANADA: FREE SHIPPING  (or 10/15 € for single purchase)
REST OF THE WORLD: + €16
For Add-ons or single model: Based on past experiences, shipping costs will be charged after the campaign through our store-based pledge manager, based on the actual cost of shipping the contents of your pledge and any additional rewards you selected. This method allows us to be fair to all our backers, as shipping is rarely a “one-size-fits-all” affair: furthermore, we can also provide you with more stretch bonuses, and (possibly) a selection of different shipping options. We will ship your rewards at our cost to our international hubs.
Please keep in mind that these are just estimates, and costs may rise based on weight increases generated by unlocked stretch goals, optional purchases on your part and your postal code. We also cannot ship to PO Boxes, either domestically or internationally. Due to the size of each package, the risk of a package “bouncing back” to us is simply too high.
The following applies to all perks:
All miniatures are sculpted by Greebo and Deadowl
All miniatures concepts are made by Matteo Spirito. 
All sets are safely shipped in padded envelopes or boxes, depending on the pledge 
All miniatures are made from metal or resin depend on model. Add-ons and freebies will be made in metal, and, sometimes, in resin as well 
All miniatures will be supplied as unassembled, unpainted and unbased kits, unless explicitly stated otherwise 
The miniatures and all additional parts are 32 mm scale 
Bust is 100 mm size
Shipping commences by January 2017
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is a very low-risk campaign, as the entirety of the project is produced by Greebo Games, and it will be made, no ifs or buts about it - provided that it gets funded! As you can see, all models have already been created, so there is no real “risk”. We have several campaigns under our belt, and all have been carried through successfully.

Some of these models can get delayed, changed or deleted: should this occur, we will gladly refund you the money you have spent to claim them, or we can provide you with a selection of any items from our catalog with an equal value.

All sets will be shipped from Italy.

Please note that while we always do our best to get you your rewards in a timely manner, you may not necessarily receive your rewards before the product makes it into distribution in your own country, or before it’s made available in conventions, physical events and for special promotional opportunities. We hope that the special price and exclusive items you will get during the Kickstarter will make up for any such possible delay. However, if this is something that is not acceptable to you, please do not back this project, and wait for the retail release instead. Thank you.

Keep in mind that these are just estimates, and the timeline may vary due to unforeseen circumstances.

REFUND POLICY 
We can refund you within 60 days of the campaign’s end, including fees. After that, we have a “no questions asked” policy, though that’s minus the Kickstarter and payment processing fees (which we can’t get back from them once 60 days have gone by).

However, if we’ve begun packaging your pledge for shipping - usually 4 to 6 weeks before the actual shipping date - no refunds are possible. 
All refunds after 60 days are processed via Paypal exclusively. Refunds within 60 days will be reversed via Stripe to your credit card.

This project is being funded in EUR, and any refunds processed will be in EUR for the exact amount received in the same currency, minus any applicable fees depending on the timeline of the refund being processed.

TERMS AND CONDITIONS 
If you do not log in and confirm your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification via email to confirm your pledge, we will consider it abandoned, and we will refund or ship on a case-by-case basis.

By pledging to this Kickstarter, you acknowledge that the final looks, materials and contents of the rewards (and the Kickstarter) are subject to changes, and may differ substantially from what has been shown while the Kickstarter project is active. You agree that our responsibility to you is to ship your order as entered into our pledge manager system, that title and risk passes to you upon delivery to a common carrier for such shipment, and that you are responsible for import duties or any other tariffs that may be due to the corresponding tax authorities, providing correct address information and ensuring that this address is reachable by normal shipping methods. We regret that we are unable to ship to PO Boxes.

If you do not accept these terms, please do not pledge to this project, but wait for the general release instead. Thank you.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Good morning everyone!
Today we’d like to take some time and talk about our Legacy Vault project.
Let’s start with a quick recap for those who haven’t read the campaign description: the models from the Legacy Vault are meant to be extremely limited in their availability and of a particularly high quality, with a general design principle tied to the season in which they’ve been released. It goes without saying that some themes are harder than others, summer being by far the most complicated one!

updates.update_userinfo: New Legacy Vault campaign will start soon
updates.update_content: PLAY

updates.update_userinfo: The Worstcard Contest : our way to wish you a great Summer!

updates.update_content:
Good morning everyone!
We’re close to the finishing line, and almost all orders have been taken care of. Almost all, but not all, so don’t be worried if you still haven’t received the perk, it’s on its way!
For all those who have had any issues and have dropped us a line, we’ll answer everyone based on when the emails were received. Please keep in mind that our desk is open from 9AM to 7PM CET, Monday to Friday, so we don’t answer emails during the weekend.

Good morning, all!  
Today we’d like to share something regarding this particular campaign with you all.
First of all, not to worry: everything’s going well. We’ve underestimated the complexity of the diorama, which is something that requires much more time than we anticipated to be checked properly, because of its complexity. This said, it is perfectly understandable for you to be impatient when it comes to your order, because under normal circumstances a project like this shouldn’t have taken more than two months to be shipped out.

Hello everyone!  
Here’s a very quick update on the Fang ’n Hood project.  
Everything’s chugging along just fine, with one very minor exception. Since the bust is bigger than our last one, we’ve been forced to switch to another type of resin in order to avoid any compromise in quality. Nothing to worry about, though: the only thing this means is that our internal timetable has been updated in order to include a delay of no more than five days.

Everything is going smoothly this week as well, we’ve already begun the shipping phase and received the first feedbacks.
Therefore, in the next 15 days or so all deliveries will be processed!

Hello everyone!  
As promised, our timetable is perfectly on schedule, and all is going well. We are able to ship all before 15 April!
Have a great week, people!  
Lorenzo and the Greebo Games crew

Hello people!
Everything’s going mighty fine, nothing out of the ordinary to report.
However we have a gift that we will add for all bakers as apologies of this delay:

Hello everyone!  
When things are going well, there's precious little to be added, and to be fair, that's exactly what's happening right now: our timetable, both for Obsidian Dusk and Fang 'n Hood, is perfectly on schedule, and production is going smoothly. Barring any unforeseeable events (knock on wood), we should be able to tell you the same in next week's update as well, but should any issues arise, we'll of course let you know as soon as possible.

campaign.story:
Step right up, my lords and ladies, and prepare to be mystified by the most bizarre, the most exotic, the most fantastic sights you have ever yet to behold! Step behind this curtain—for the merest, tiniest contribution—and your world will be changed forever! For this is the Carnival of Monsters, and it offers a world of wonders!
AMIGO Spiel + Freizeit GmbH invites you to experience Richard Garfield’s Carnival of Monsters, a new game from the genius behind such hits as Magic: The Gathering, RoboRally, and King of Tokyo.
Garfield’s most recent design, this game challenges you to explore exotic, fantastic lands and collect extraordinary monsters to display in your carnival, earning the adoration of the crowd and the fame that only a true carnival master can enjoy. Because we believe that great games deserve great art, we have teamed up with some of the most talented artists in the world of gaming today to make Richard Garfield’s Carnival of Monsters a celebration not only of great game design, but of great game art as well.
But this magnificent creation won’t be possible without help from you. By backing this campaign, you can help AMIGO and this pool of talented artists make this project a reality. Explore the sample artwork below, learn more about the game and the artists, then join us by backing this project. 
Together, we can make Richard Garfield’s Carnival of Monsters the magnificently beautiful game that we know it can be.
While we don´t think that Richard needs a big introduction, we still feel something would be missing if we did not introduce him properly. 
  As magnificent as the monsters are, it takes talented artists to really bring them to life. We have gathered this team of brilliant artists. Together, they have illustrated more than 1,000 cards for Richard’s most famous creation, Magic: The Gathering. Most of them were part of that phenomenon from the very beginning, and they are delighted to reunite with Richard to illustrate his latest game project, 25 years later.
  Richard Garfield’s Carnival of Monsters combines card drafting and set collecting for a game experience that is at once familiar and refreshingly new. 2 to 5 players begin with a small number of Lands, which they can use to play Monsters. At the beginning of each of the game’s four Seasons, each player is dealt eight cards—which can include more Lands, Monsters, or other cards they might be able to use to improve their carnival. A normal game takes around 45 minutes and we suggest players to be age 10 or older.
At the same time, all players choose one card to keep, passing the rest to their neighbor. You can play your chosen card immediately, or pay one coin to save it for later. Of course, if you can’t play it now, you’ll have to pay to keep it!
Collecting more Land cards allows you to play more and bigger Monsters.
Playing Monsters is the key to scoring points: Every Monster is worth points at the end of the game, and if you play the right kind of Monster in the right Season, you can earn more points and coins during the game.
Staff cards provide a permanent bonus for your carnival, from new ways to earn coins, to Hunters that can protect you from dangerous Monsters!
Events give you a one-time boost.
Secret Goals are kept hidden until the end of the game, when they add surprise points to your score!
The Season ends once all of the cards dealt have been chosen. Now it’s time to deal with those dangerous Monsters you’ve been putting on display!
Fortunately, the King will help out some by sending out his Royal Hunters, but you can’t always rely on them…
You can hire Hunters for your staff…
Or use Nets you have collected—but each Net can only be used once!
If your Monster gets out, the King will be most upset—you’ll have to pay your precious coins to clean up the mess.
Run out of money? No problem! Take out a Loan (or two… or three…). But be careful! Each Loan will cost you victory points at the end of the game. Get too deep in debt, and it won’t matter how magnificent your Monsters are.
After four Seasons, add up your points from the Monsters you have played, the Secret Goals you have completed, and the coins you have left. The player with the most points is hailed as the true Carnival Master!

When this project is fully funded, it will include 104 unique original full-card illustrations, including fabulous monsters, exotic lands, and talented staff members to populate your carnivals. But that is not the end of the campaign! We hope to provide 86 additional individual full-card illustrations so that every monster, land, and staff card has its own unique artwork without any duplication. In order to achieve this accomplishment, we have prepared a number of stretch goals to fund those additional illustrations.
With your help, through this Kickstarter campaign, we will be able to recruit the best artists for the job, presenting an all-new fantasy world in a completely revolutionary way.
Download-Link for the rules.
Download-Link for the cards.
Let´s have a look at what the different Editions of the game have to offer. Please keep in mind that everything you see here is still a work in progress. After all, we need your help to make this game as beautiful as we can.
         Let´s have a closer look at the individual components. Please keep in mind that everything you see here is still a work in progress.
  Here is how a game in the middle of the first season might look.
       Find all media about the game, ask questions and join discussions about it on BGG.
                     Over 35 Years of Simply Great Games!
AMIGO, the game publishing company, first saw the light of day in 1980. Successful distribution deals established AMIGO’s name and enabled it to venture into the world of board games, too. The Dietzenbach-based game publisher has developed a strong second pillar for itself by expanding into the area of licenses and distribution of Magic: The Gathering, Pokémon TCG, Yu-Gi-Oh! TCG and the new Force of Will TCG.
Thanks to the strength of popular card games like 6 nimmt!, Bohnanza and Wizard, AMIGO has practically become synonymous with card games in Germany.
In recent years, the Dietzenbach publisher has focused largely on these very strengths. Classic lines such as Halli Galli, 6 nimmt!, Wizard and Bohnanza have been expanded. Numerous events from years past, like the Wizard and Saboteur championships, as well as Organized Play for trading card games on a national level, continue to enjoy significant success.
Our partner for the production and logistics of this fantastic game is LUDO FACT. LUDO FACT is synonymous for quality in board games.
Here is a short excerpt from their company profile:
For us it's all in the name: ludere = play, facere = make. We've been bringing pleasure into the world for over 20 years: 70,000 board games per day, 350,000 games and puzzles a week and up to 17 million board games and puzzles a year - for 200 games publishers worldwide. We are the contact partners for a complete game: Production, assembly, packaging and shipping. With our subsidiary Ludo Packt you benefit from short communication channels, because with us everything is under one roof. As the first games manufacturer, we are committed to ISO 9001 certification which is a global standard of quality. We produce items in accordance with ISO norm 9001, the provisions of the law and EN71. This enables our customers to have an even more transparent view of our services. Moreover, we also want to contribute towards global, sustainable forest management which is why we have been certified by FSC and PEFC.
Our dedicated and professional staff are always looking for the best results and finding creative and functional solutions. We ensure a continuous improvement process with sustainable effects. Thus, our products retain our customer’s joy of playing even after many years.
If you want to know more about how Ludo Fact works, watch this great film our friends from The Spiel made:
     The project is US, Canada and EU friendly.
Shipping costs are not included within the pledge. We will be charging actual shipping cost via our pledge manager after the Kickstarter concludes. That way we can be as fair as possible to all of you, as we will end up with a lot of different sizes of packages.
We will ship the games and add-ons in bulk to fulfillment centers in Europe and the USA at our expense to keep shipping costs for you as low as possible and reduce customs fees and VAT where possible.
If you want to save yourselves the shipping cost all together: We plan to offer pickup of your pledges both at Gen Con 2018 and Essen Spiel 2018.
Should you wish to have your games shipped to your home, we would like to give you an idea about the roughly estimated shipping costs for a single game.  We compiled the following list together with our logistics partner.
EUROPE:
• Germany: 10 Euro
• Most European countries: between 15 and 25 Euro
• Norway, Finland, Estonia, Latvia and Lithuania: 30 Euro
• Bosnia and Herzegovina, Croatia and Serbia: 35 Euro
• Bulgaria and Romania: 45 Euro
• Greece and Iceland: 50 Euro
NORTH AMERICA:
• USA: between 10 and 15 Euro to most states
• USA – Alaska, Hawaii and Puerto Rico: 30 Euro
• Canada: between 10 and 20 Euro to most cities
LATIN AMERICA:
• Between 50 and 60 Euro to most countries
ASIA:
• China and Hong Kong: 70 Euro
• Japan: 70 Euro
OCEANIA:
• Australia: 70 Euro
• New Zealand: 70 Euro
AFRICA:
• Between 70 and 100 Euro to most countries
ANTARCTICA:
• Should somebody down there be interested, we will try to figure something out but be warned: It will be expensive. ;)
Please note that we cannot ship to any PO box, neither will we ship to the Russian Federation, Ukraine, Azerbaijan, Kazakhstan or Afghanistan.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
While we know how to publish boardgames, this is our first Kickstarter and therefore a new experience for us.

Carnival of Monsters is a special project in many ways. We are working with a big team of artists on a huge number of illustrations, for example. We may end up having problems along the way, but we are confident that we will be able to solve any problems thanks to our experience with producing games and our great partners at Ludo Fact.

We have faced our share of unexpected issues in the past, and we are absolutely certain that we will be able to overcome any problems that might come up. We are not too shy to ask for assistance, as we have done frequently in preparation of this campaign.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Art Preview: Aerie by Dennis Lohausen
updates.update_content:
Hey folks,
this post will start a weekly series of Art Previews. Every weeks post will feature a certain parts of the game. Carnival of Monsters consists of six distinct regions, all those will be featured. Another week will feature the Art for the staff members.
This first post shows a small part of the work Dennis Lohausen created for Carnival of Monsters. Dennis is however not only responsible for all art of the region "Aerie". He also created a plethora of other things like the game box, the game board, that player boards, the event cards, the mission cards, the coins and the layout of the rules. Therefore he helped to shaped the whole look of the game by a substantial margin.

Hey folks,
we have been silently working on the game in the background. It is however time for an update.
Carnival of Monsters will have its initial release this year at Gen Con. If everything goes according to plan, we will have it in our AMIGO US booth #2004 to check it out and should you be interested to buy it as well. The game is produced in Germany, so we will have to rely on our ship of choice and US customs, but all print files are delivered and approved, so fingers crossed.

Hey folks,
as promised, I would like to present our team of illustrators, now that we have the last slot filled.
Without further ado:
Dennis Lohausen - Region Aerie and Cover

campaign.story:
The Short Version
We are funded and producing (at least) three RPG miniatures for all sorts of sci-fi, post-apocalyptic, space opera, and fantasy games that feature aliens, magic, tech, survival, exploration, or all of the above. Two additional miniatures are available as Add-Ons, along with large-scale versions of all five characters.
Miniatures are true 32mm scale (a 6' person is 32mm to the eyes), expertly modeled and cast in resin or 3D printed to get the finest level of detail possible.
The up-front modeling costs are already paid as part of my contribution to this project. I'm taking zero profit from this campaign and every penny goes toward making more miniatures or making the existing miniatures more awesome.
There's a lot more history and background toward the bottom of the page, but let's continue with the big stuff:
This is as simple as it gets:  
$1 gets you access to Add-Ons.
$10 gets you one mini. 
$20 gets you two minis. 
$30 gets you three minis. 
The first 100 backers to grab a set of all three get them for only $25. If and when Stretch Goals are unlocked, this Early Bird will be good for a pick of any three standard minis, not just the core three.
$55 gets you a complete set. That's two copies each of the Tusk, Dru, and Grim, along with a Mod Kit for each. That gives you everything you need to create a couple of different configurations of each mini.
$100 gets you everything. That's two copies of each of the five available 32mm miniatures, and a Mod Kit for each. Create a whole slew of possible combinations.
Pledge any of those levels and you're eligible for Add-Ons, whether from the base list or those unlocked as Stretch Goals. 
Shipping is separate and charged during the Pledge Management phase once the campaign has closed.
All miniatures come unpainted, with assembly required. Model cuts can be seen on the individual descriptions.
Additionally, be sure to check out the additional miniatures and Mod Kits that are available exclusively as Add-Ons.
    Proof Prints
Below are some 3D printed models, just like will be used to create the "masters" before casting. I've mounted them on U.S. quarters (approximately 1 inch or 25mm diameter) to show the scale. This isn't some hypothetical product... they're right there in front of you, ready to be put into production!
More photos will be made available in an Update.
  We'll choose Stretch Goals as a group via an online poll found HERE or by clicking the poll image at the bottom of this section. Stretch Goals will come every $1000 to $1500 of funding, then be available as Add-Ons.
I've taken the liberty of picking the first two Stretch Goals out of the gate based on preliminary fan polling, so that production work can begin on them before the campaign. There are the female Elder and the male Hollow Mage. Others will follow!
UPDATE: As a response to some backer comments, we have  updated the first two Stretch Goals. These minis will be available as Add-Ons for a slightly higher price than standard miniatures. This is because at this stage, these minis will be 3D printed (still in high quality resin every bit as detailed as the cast minis) instead of cast. If, however, we hit the below Stretch Goals for price reduction, the economics will allow for these minis will be dropped to $10 and be available as part of the pledge packages. For now, they are exclusively available as Add-Ons.
And there's a lot more where that came from! Among the Stretch Goals being considered, beyond those pictured above, are a couple of larger and more expensive items. We'll continue to grow this list of options as the campaign progresses.
So, to weigh in on what Stretch Goals you'd like to see, don't forget to respond to the poll below by clicking THIS LINK or clicking through the image, below. The form requires that you log in so that you can come back and revise your answer later, but none of your personal information is shared - not even your email address.
Click to access survey form
Works In Progress
Even though we haven't unlocked any Stretch Goals yet, confidence is so high that modeling is well underway on the first two. Chances are good that if we break the threshold for the third Stretch Goal early on, we'll be able to get an early look at that one as well.
Elder WIP
Elder Mod Kit WIP
Hollow Mage WIP
Hollow Mage Mod Kit WIP
  To receive any of the below as part of your backer reward, simply increase your pledge by the listed amount. You'll clarify which minis or other products you want as part during the Pledge Management phase. As with all minis, shipping will be billed after the funding period has ended. 
Additional minis are available at the base price and include the standard pieces.
Mod Kits include only the additional pieces shown, used to modify the standard mini.
Resin bases are available in sets of three. They will be made available for print on demand via Shapeways (in various materials) after the campaign, but they are much cheaper as part of the campaign.
PDF rewards will be delivered via DriveThruRPG as soon as the funding is processed.
Until meeting the stated Stretch Goals, the Elder and Hollow Mage, and their respective Mod Kits, are available 3D printed as opposed to resin cast. Quality of the prints is every bit as detailed as when casting. 
Mega-Sized minis are the available miniatures but in larger scale, and include the pieces from the Mod Kit as well. These may be cast in resin, but likely 3D printed. Minis that are more massive (have more volume) cost more due to material expense.
Proof prints of the Mega-Sized Grim
Alien Adventurer Miniatures  
Since the Breachworld RPG was published a few years ago, I've wanted to have some minis to slide around the table, but it hasn't been in the cards. That situation changed a bit, so here we are.
These miniatures are for more than Breachworld, and will provide an interesting change of pace from the typical wargaming and fantasy minis that we typically see. This Kickstarter offers you the chance to help produce some beautiful, highly-detailed, wild and imaginative minis for your game. They'll look great on your hex grid, hand-scribbled battle map, or up on your shelf. At 32mm scale (height measured to the eyes of an average human), expertly sculpted to lifelike proportions, these resin-cast miniatures show every detail of their uniqueness and character. The larger scales available as Add-Ons offer even more opportunity for painters and collectors.
Every Last Dime  
Here is what I think is the coolest part - we're going to put every cent raised in the Kickstarter into the miniatures, with no profit taken. I'd much rather grow this project than make the few extra bucks. Not just that, but to front-load the work and keep the funding goal to a minimum, I've put forward the up-front costs for the first three miniatures as my gift to the effort.
Meeting the funding goal will cover the manufacturing costs of the first three minis, which include prototypes, molds, and material costs. Stretch Goals will cover all of the costs for additional miniatures. Because this is a "break even" campaign, I'll regularly share where we are on production costs and how we are going to spend the available surplus on additional miniatures, small additions to existing models, or giving well-deserved bonuses to the artists.
Thanks to the Artists!
None of this would be possible without the fantastic art team. Concept art is by Breachworld veteran and all-around wonder, Eric Quigley. The fantastic and imaginative digital sculptor is Kevin Cayuela Borg. Photography is by Anthony Vasser. They rule.
Shipping and Fulfillment
Shipping will be calculated on an individual basis and billed after the campaign via Backerkit.
Fulfillment will be handled through our partnership with BlackBox (from the creators of Cards Against Humanity) and will work to give the best rates to backers across the globe by using multiple shipping centers. If you want a shipping estimate, you can check out their website at blackbox.cool or look in-depth at how shipping works in THIS DOCUMENT.
So, Let's Talk About It
I'm excited to see what y'all think. Let's compare notes and see where we want this thing to head, and discuss how we can make it the greatest possible success.
The best place to discuss is right here in the Comments section, so fire away. Some other really good places are:
Jason Richards Publishing on Facebook
Jason Richards Publishing on Twitter using the #Breachworld tag
Breachworld on Google+
I'll also be blogging more about it at jasonrichards.net
If you want more Breachworld, check out the following:
The Breachworld official site
Breachworld products (many free) on DriveThruRPG; some products here, including some free ones, include the full write-ups for the various Player Races that serve as the basis for the miniatures.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We've done everything we can to mitigate any risks before the campaign was launched. The remaining major risks are:

1. A technical failure or interruption to supplies could cause delays, such as equipment malfunction, a fire in a warehouse, a shortage of materials, or similar issues. All of the partners on this Kickstarter are seasoned professionals, so this risk is minimal.

2. The project could go so well that additional resources are required, such as additional artists, manufacturers, or shipping concerns. This could potentially cause delays. If this does turn out the case, we'll know early on in the campaign and will keep you informed. If the campaign REALLY blows up we'll cap the offerings and bank the extra capital for an additional campaign once this completes.

3. Issues with modeling or casting could cause delays. However, you have seen the early modeling work, and the history of those involved, and even the preliminary 3D prints, so the capability is clearly established. Our artists and manufacturing partners are veterans of multiple Kickstarters.

4. Post-campaign pledge management and fulfillment always hold challenges, but again our partners in this endeavor are specialists. BackerKit will handle pledge management, and BlackBox (from the creators of Cards Against Humanity) will handle fulfillment.

5. If we have any minis that have very low order numbers, they may simply be 3D printed in resin instead of cast. The level of detail will be the same, but in small lots the buy-in cost for making the molds to cast may be prohibitive.

If you identify any further possibly trouble spots, please raise the flag and your concerns will be addressed.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Howdy, everyone! I hope you're all enjoying your miniatures.
If you find that you want MORE Alien Adventurers, I wanted to turn your attention to THIS GREAT CAMPAIGN by my friend and business partner, Tom Anders of Impact! Miniatures. His campaign is totally legit, and Impact has licensed the rights to produce and sell Alien Adventurers. This is great because my supply of them is essentially exhausted and this gives you a chance to add miniatures that you missed the first time around.

Is this a term used in industries other than engineering and construction? If not, it should be. You have an opportunity to start right now, because Alien Adventurers is "done done," meaning absolutely and completely finished.
The small handful of stragglers with hitches in credit card payments, order clarity, or shipping charges were either handled or forgiven and I just got notice that these were picked up by the USPS and whisked away to their new homes.
I hope you're enjoying your miniatures, or if you're one of these final shipments that you will enjoy them very soon. The team of enthusiastic professionals that brought you Alien Adventurers will be returning soon, so keep your eyes peeled for that.

It's a curse, but I don't usually get much rest after finishing one project prior to starting noodling on the next. One major possibility is a new miniatures endeavor, so I was hoping to get some feedback from you, my beloved backers.
Now that you have your miniatures, what do you love about them? What should we do differently next time?
What genre should our next miniatures cater to? More of our Breachworld-inspired minis, which are pretty unique in the marketplace? Or more widely-applicable fantasy figures? Stick with player character figures or focus on pawns and bosses for enemies to put on the map? Maybe not do characters at all, but focus on creatures and monsters?

All remaining orders for Alien Adventurers ship today, with the exception of a few backers who have an issue of some sort with their survey or payment; those will be sorted out ASAP. This has been an exceptional campaign and I want to sincerely thank you all for your incredible support.
This campaign was all about a learning experience for me. I had never taken anything through a manufacturing process and wanted to dip my toes into that part of the business. I learned more than I imagined possible! I'd definitely do a few things differently the next time around, and I look forward to doing just that.

Good morning, friends and backers. An overdue, but quick update for you on this Monday.
Everything is going swimmingly and we are on track to get everything fulfilled this month, on schedule. The bulk of the remaining miniatures have been produced and put through their quality checks, and are on their way to me now. I expect to receive them and start fulfilling the rest of the orders this week. The few straggler miniatures will be shipped to me soon after and will conclude the Kickstarter!

Dear backers, this is just a quick note to alert you that I will be locking down the BackerKit pledge manager orders on Wednesday, 14 March. So, if you need to change your address, make reward selections, or add anything to your pledge, do so in a hurry.
If you have lost your email or need a little help, you can CLICK HERE and it should get you where you need to go.
Remind your friends to preorder as well, post the link on social media, and spread the word however you can.

Just a short update for you tonight. The anticipated BackerKit "lock down" that would essentially close up orders for Alien Adventurers was scheduled for tomorrow. However, since production miniatures are still coming in, I don't see any reason to do that quite yet.
So, if you have any additions or changes that you'd like to make to your order, or if you'd like to preorder, you may still do so at https://alien-adventurers.backerkit.com/.
I'll give everyone a 48 hour notice before we lock down. Once we lock down, the orders will be shipped.

Fulfillment!
Though fulfillment was estimated for May, we've already begun filling some orders. How's that for great news?
Because the Tusk was the first miniature in hand, I sent out that reward to those who had filled out their BackerKit survey AND only had the Tusk as a reward. This is a trial run for using BackerKit and all of its nifty shipping and postage tools. The USPS picked up the packages today and they are on their way to their new homes.
Fill out/update your BackerKit survey

Everyone check your email! Your survey from BackerKit should be sitting there waiting for you. Follow the link provided to:
Finalize or change your Pledge Level
Claim your bonus if you were a Day One backer, and/or a backer of the original Breachworld RPG
Include Add-Ons, including limited items like proof and "scratch and dent" minis
Pay for shipping or any other balance you may have

campaign.story:
Over 130 adventures for 5th Edition & Pathfinder RPG!
 New cover art wrap (as unlocked with stretch goals) by Mates Laurentiu:
Mini-Dungeons are two-page adventures for 5th Edition or Pathfinder RPG which are setting agnostic and are easily inserted anywhere in your campaign. These grab-and-go adventures are great when you need something in a pinch! This tome contains 130+ adventures spanning over 270 pages (more with stretch goals)
Our goal with this project is to consolidate all our published Mini-Dungeons into a complete hardcover volume published as one book for 5th Edition and one book for Pathfinder RPG.
The layout will be completely redone from the ground up and new stationary backgrounds, graphic effects, and artwork incorporated. Finally, pending stretch goals–we'll add more content and wrap this all into a single, easy to use volume with reference tables, monster glossary, and more. With additional stretch goals we hope to add special guest authors, new artwork, and a gorgeous cover to this hardback book. 
We're starting this project with 100 adventures and 200 pages; each Mini-Dungeon Stretch Goal increases the book by 2 pages, so let's get rolling and see just how big we can make the Mini-Dungeon Tome!
Update! Thanks to our backers and unlocked stretch goals this tome will span over 270 pages with 130+ adventures!
Pending meeting our stretch goals we have some top notch industry professionals working on this project alongside our team. These individuals include Dan Dillon (Kobold Press), Liz Courts (Paizo), Rone Barton (TSR, Goodman Games, Frog God), Louis Agresta (Paizo, Frog God, Goodman Games), Jaye Sonia (Storm Bunny Studios), Ben McFarland (Kobold Press), Jonathan G. Nelson (AAW Games), Stephen Yeardley (AAW Games), Brian Suskind (Kobold Press), Justin Andrew Mason (AAW Games), Tim Hitchcock (Paizo), Richard Develyn (4 Dollar Dungeons), Michael Allen (AAW Games), Rachel Ventura (Legendary Games), Colin Stricklin (AAW Games) – with more authors to come if we unlock enough stretch goals!
         VIDEO BELOW -- Keep in mind: the collection shown in the video below are the original first-draft versions of our Mini-Dungeons. We've since refined them, updated the maps, and are combining all of these (and more) into the massive Mini-Dungeon Tome which you'll get by pledging on this Kickstarter project. Thank you for your support!
                         Fulfillment for this Kickstarter is being provided by Mox Boarding House (Seattle, WA). Mox is the region's largest tabletop gaming store/cafe and has assisted numerous publishers in delivering products in good shape and on time to backers.
Music by Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/

updates.update_userinfo: Search for the Legendary Tome... AKA Books are shipping!
updates.update_content: The day was dark, so dark you'd think it was nearly night. Close encounters with humanoids out in the wild were dangerous due to the weather-induced depression. People were angry or grumpy, short-tempered and short of patience. It was a difficult journey but we loaded up two large chests of treasure and went on our way, traveling from Snoqualmie to Seattle in search of the ultimate treasure, the Mini-Dungeon Tome in true printed format. Many sages have spoken of this tome with maps to a myriad of dungeons from across the land, creatures dangerous, and treasures beyond compare but despite all the lore and information gathered, not a single sage or adventurer was able to find this tome, perhaps it was because they sought it all alone. Then, one day, brave adventurers pooled a portion of their adventure spoils together to help find said treasure and now, it was finally all coming to fruition.

The Mini-Dungeon Tome books are sitting on a ship in Seattle!
We've received word that the freight company was delayed but will have the books to Mox Boarding House/Card Kingdom Seattle (Ballard) by November 1st. As soon as it arrives I'll be there with boxes of add-ons to meet the team and get this process moving.
You can expect your books early to mid-November depending upon where you live. Those in the Pacific Northwest will likely receive their books first due to the close proximity from where we're shipping.

campaign.story:
Tales From the Magician's Skull is a printed fantasy magazine dedicated to presenting all-new sword-and-sorcery fiction by the finest modern crafters in the genre. These stories are the real thing, crammed with sword-swinging action, dark sorceries, dread, and ferocious monsters -- and they hurtle forward at a headlong pace.
Issue #1 is complete and ready for printing. It is brimming with 72 pages and contains 7 stories, each featuring a full page black-and-white illustration. When appropriate to the tale, maps to terrifying tombs and sinister lairs are included as well. Each story has been written, edited, illustrated, and laid out in classic pulp magazine format. A bonus section translates elements from each story - creatures, magic items, and more - into Dungeon Crawl Classics game terms.
Issue #1 features fiction by James Enge, John C. Hocking, Howard Andrew Jones, Aeryn Rudel, Bill Ward, C. L. Werner, and Chris Willrich. The magazine is edited by Howard Andrew Jones and published by Joseph Goodman of Goodman Games, with layout by Lester B. Portly.
Each story is lovingly illustrated by industry stalwarts, and issue #1 features art by Jennell Jaquays, Doug Kovacs, Willam McAusland, Brad McDevitt, Ian Miller, Russ Nicholson, and Stefan Poag.
This Kickstarter funds the print publication of the first and second issues. Depending on pledge level, backers will receive their issues shipped to them in physical form. There is also an option for PDF delivery.
Issue #2 will be published in mid-2018 and is currently in production.
Ian Miller's illustration for Beneath The Bay of Black Waters
Here are the stories in the first issue:
What Lies in Ice, by Chris Willrich
It seemed a simple matter – all they had to do was outrun the iceberg. Except that the iceberg followed after, from time to time sending severed hands scrabbling onto their deck to choke the life from them. If they were to survive, Gaunt and Bone and their comrades would have to brave the depths of the iceberg, where the tower of a power-mad wizard had been entombed for millennia.
It would require all the razor-honed skills at their disposal to infiltrate the ice and confront the horrific sentience that yet survived. And some of them wouldn’t be getting out alive…
The Guild of Silent Men, by James Enge
They came for Morlock at dusk, for aid with a grim and terrible problem. A guildsman had killed his opponent then slain himself with multiple knife wounds, his face frozen in a rictus of horror.
Others might have judged the case open and closed, but Morlock soon began to suspect other hands had been involved. Worse, the deeper his investigation went, the more he was certain he himself was in deadly peril.
Beneath the Bay of Black Waters, by Bill Ward
When Commissioner Shan and General Bao set out to destroy the cutthroats behind the addictive and deadly Black Pearls, they knew they’d be challenged at every turn. But they could never have known the terrible discoveries that lay before them, or guessed at what lurked beneath the waves. Soon they were locked in a savage fight for the soul of their city, two men in retreat with a bedraggled guard force against hordes upon hordes of creatures from the deep…
Beyond the Block, by Aeryn Rudel
Matthias had but one morning left him, and it would end with a blow from the headman’s axe. He’d fought to free his sister and dethrone a sorcerous tyrant, but he was outnumbered and alone.
And then his sister’s agents offered him a choice. They couldn’t get him past the guards, but they knew a way he could seek his vengeance. So long as he didn’t mind waiting until after his date with the chopping block…
Crypt of Stars, by Howard Andrew Jones
The Dervan Empire pecked at the sun blasted rocks with an army of slaves, determined to recover the fabled wealth of Volanus. Secure in their power, they worried only about delays. Even if they’d known that the last great general of Volanus was alive and free, why should they fear Hanuvar Cabera? He had no armies left him. What could a single man hope to accomplish against an entire garrison?
But then they had never reckoned with the secrets held within the crypt of stars.
There Was an Old Fat Spider, by C. L. Werner
Karl didn’t want much – just enough coin to purchase a bed each night, just a little luck so that his animal traps weren’t spoiled. Once he’d been a skilled carver with connections to royalty. Now he was a vagabond trapper. Mocked, bullied, and abused by the townsfolk, even the woman he loved could barely stand the sight of him.
And then a chance encounter led him to a dark, webbed grove, where he found a gruesome ally and began to hatch a sinister plan…
The Crystal Sickle’s Harvest, by John C. Hocking
The King’s Hand was the king’s most feared agent, the grim troubleshooter dispatched when subtlety and speed were paramount. It seemed like his apprentice Benhus might finally be able to prove his worth when the two discovered someone had crept into the royal cemetery.
But they quickly learned that they faced no common grave robbers. For someone had broken into the crypt of the king’s sister, a woman whispered to have mastered the darkest of arts…
  Table of contents for issue #1
Maps
This is a small detail, but we think it's important. The early issues of pulp literature occasionally included illustrated maps and diagrams to help the reader understand the fantastic places being explored by pulp heroes.
Tales From the Magician's Skull does the same. Doug Kovacs, famous for his fantastically illustrated maps in the role-playing-game space, has provided illuminated maps to explain some of the stories' locations.
Map by Doug Kovacs
Pledge Levels
Most of the pledge levels are self-explanatory - either print or PDF editions.
One pledge level in particular is worth additional detail. The Legion of the Skull level is your chance to contribute to the greater community of sword-and-sorcery fans. We invite you to read more about this pledge level here!
Here's all the stuff you get at the Legion of the Skull level:
Stretch Goals
At a base funding level, this Kickstarter funds the print publication of issues # 1 and #2 of Tales From the Magician's Skull. If funding achieves certain levels, we may be able to invest even further in the product as follows!
STRETCH GOAL CLEARED! If funding exceeds $25,000, we will print issue #1 on textured, tan-colored paper stock that will have a "weathered pulp feel." If you're a collector who owns pulp magazines from the classic era, you'll know the effect we're going for.
Brad McDevitt's illustration for Beyond the Block
Learn More About the Guys Behind This
At Gen Con 2017, publisher Joseph Goodman held his annual seminar "What's New With Goodman Games." Magazine editor Howard Andrew Jones stopped by to discuss this project! This is a great chance to hear the inspirations behind the project and learn more about what you can expect. You can view the video here - Howard appears at about 9:00 in.
Hear the story behind the magazine! (Segment starts about 9:00 in)
  Shipping Costs
Physical copies will be shipped as they are ready. We anticipate issue #1 shipping in January 2018 and issue #2 shipping in July 2018.
When you make your pledge, shipping charges will be applied. They are as follows:
USA: $5 for issue #1, $10 for issue #1 and #2
Canada, UK, and EU: $8 for issue #1, $16 for issues #1 and #2
New Zealand and Australia: $12 for issue #1, $24 for issues #1 and #2
Rest of world: $20 for issue #1, $30 for issues #1 and #2
Tell Me About Issue #2
We have already commissioned cover art, shown below. This cover is by Diesel LaForce, known for his early work on Dungeons & Dragons (including his classic illustrations in B2: The Keep on the Borderlands). We are in the process of lining up a suite of excellent authors with stories just as good as issue #1! You can check out this recent update to read more about what's in issue #2. 
Cover art to issue #2, by Diesel LaForce
 What About Future Issues?
We certainly hope to publish more! If these first two issues do well we would anticipate adopting a regular publication schedule.
Game Statistics for DCC RPG
Goodman Games is the publisher of this magazine, and also the published of the Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game, also called DCC RPG. Tales From the Magician's Skull will include a short appendix at the end of each issue with DCC RPG game statistics for the monsters, non-player characters, and magic items that appear in the stories. The inimitable Terry Olson has provided the DCC RPG stats.
A Closing Word From The Skull
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Goodman Games has run and fulfilled more than a dozen Kickstarters, and published more than 200 RPG titles. If anything the only risk we anticipate is delays if the stretch goals become more awesome!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

support.descp: You have pledged yourself into service of the Magician’s Skull. You shall be called upon to carry word of his deeds to all you meet and stand ready to aid him in his hour of need. In return you’ll receive an official membership card mailed to your door, along with the occasional fictional tale narrated in a deathly rasp, and inaugural status as a member in the Legion of the Skull. Your name will be printed in the benefactors list of Tales From the Magician’s Skull #1, and you will be sent a secret membership pin. Whenever the skull announces a Secret Meeting of the Legion of the Skull, you’l be invited. Oh, and you also get a printed copy of Tales From the Magician's Skull #1, mailed to your door, plus a PDF copy. Then, later in 2018, a print copy of #2 plus a PDF copy.

News has reached me that you are hungry for information. Hear this, then, mortals! Issue 3 is well under way, and soon you shall learn the details.

Happy Holidays everyone!

campaign.story:
Voir la page du projet en français.
The 7th Continent is a cooperative game of adventure, exploration and survival, for 1 to 4 players, inspired by the adventure books where ”you are the hero“. It’s also, thanks to the support of over 12,000 backers, one of the biggest board game worlds ever created!
The game became a reality thanks to over 12,000 backers, but the cost of making such a game is so high that a retail version is almost unfeasible. However, we wanted to give you another opportunity to get your hands on it: your last chance… to get cursed.
The Expansion “What Goes Up, Must Come Down” invites you to come and discover, or perhaps return to, The 7th Continent for some fresh adventures! Two new curses are waiting, each with their own unique gameplay elements, for you to discover.
In “A Prison of Clouds” you’ll find yourself aboard a Hot Air Balloon, in search of salvation and in “The Veins of the Earth” you will delve deep below the Continent in order to triumph over the Evil consuming you.
“Easily one of my favourite games of the year. This is an amazing game and possibly the best adventure board game ever designed. Excellent!”
Tom Vasel – The Dice Tower
“The 7th Continent is the best exploration game I’ve ever played. Every decision is interesting, the sense of cooperation and collaboration is strong, the freedom to roam is liberating, and the mystery is fascinating. This is a must-buy!”
Jamey Stegmaier – Stonemaier Games
"The 7th Continent is quite simply a watershed moment in enthusiast gaming. Encapsulating all that was great from the LucasArts adventure games of the past, Serious Poulp has crafted an analog experience that continually inspires exploration and invokes a constant sense of wonder. The ripple effect of this game will be felt for years to come in the Boardgame Industry and should most definitely be enjoyed by all."
Jeremy Salinas – Man VS Meeple
“This is the ultimate survival/exploration board game. Nothing else comes close to touching it in terms of its raw, epic scope, ambition and design.”
Richard Ham – Rahdo Runs Through
"I have over 50 hours of gameplay logged with 7th Continent and I feel like I have just scratched the surface. This is easily the best game of the year, and one of the best I have ever played in my life."
Lance Myxter – Undead Viking
Play solo or in a team of up to 4 players.
30 seconds to set-up the game, 30 seconds to save it!
1000+ minutes of thrilling adventure in a single game.
Relive the sensation of the adventure books where “you are the hero” that thrilled so many of us in our childhood.
No dice rolls! Make difficult choices and face the consequences thanks to the game's innovative mechanics that determine success or failure!
Almost 1,000 cards for the base box alone with hundreds of pieces of original artwork.
Join the expedition any time, even if you missed the beginning of the adventure or died during it.
Live a different adventure every time! There are dozens of random events and several alternatives for each individually numbered card.
There are consequences to your actions. If you kill an NPC, they will remain dead for the rest of the game and any options or alternatives that you might have had by letting them live will be gone…forever. Let them live and they might help you later. Then again, they might not.
An expansion with two brand new curses, each with their own unique gameplay mechanics!
This expansion, which requires the base box, is compatible with all previous expansions.
It includes over 250 new cards, including two new curses, which you will have to overcome if you hope to leave the 7th Continent alive. Each one will provide a unique experience, pushing the survival skills of both novice and veteran explorers to the limit.
This new expansion has its own “collector’s” box that – combined with the base box – can store all of the cards of the base box as well as all of the expansions (even if everything is sleeved) and other materials. It includes:
3 Storage trays
250+ cards
1 Hot Air Balloon miniature (+ alternative cardboard standee)
1 Barge miniature (+ alternative cardboard standee)
7 new Dividers
1 rule sheet
The curse, “A Prison of Clouds”, will send you on a whirling adventure OVER the 7th Continent!
Aboard your hot air balloon, you’ll soar over the continent thanks to an innovative wind management system, which will lead you to new, unexplored tracts of land…
You can land at any time by taking the Terrain card with the same number as your current Sky card, allowing you to continue exploring on foot. When you wish to take off again, simply make your way back to the card where you landed and your aerial adventure continues.
Take care though, as each trip will tax you. Hunger, confinement and violent winds will test your nerves.
Make short trips and improve your piloting abilities if you want to stand a chance of lifting the curse that keeps you trapped in this hopeless land.
“The Veins of the Earth” will drag you down into the bowels of the earth where an underground network of serpentine waterways spans the entire length of the continent.
Aboard a barge of aboriginal design, your actions will be limited as the current draws you ever deeper. Make the right choices at the right time or you’ll end up lost and doomed in the pitch black.
As insane and suicidal as it may seem, you have no choice but to forge ever onwards into the darkness. What manner of horrors await you? It matters not, as long as you can free yourself from this curse!
"Satchel & Journal" Binder
This new accessory will allow you to store all the “Quest Item” cards that you’ll acquire during your adventures, just as if you were jotting them down in your journal!
1907. A renowned explorer, you have just returned from the first expedition on the seventh continent, a mysterious land that was recently discovered off the coast of Antarctica and is very likely the last Terra Incognita in the world.
You are recovering from your adventure when, whilst reading the daily newspaper, you realize that several other members of the expedition have disappeared suddenly, for unknown reasons.
Coincidentally, you have been lethargic for a few days, feeling feverish and finding it difficult to get out of bed. A cold shiver runs down your spine and you are in a constant state of depression and malaise.
You are going to have to face the facts: an evil is consuming you from within. When night falls, you slip into a restless sleep unaware that, for you, this is only the beginning...
You start each new game by choosing one of the available characters. Each one comes with their own set of Skill cards that represent their abilities and personality (adventurer, herbalist, doctor, mercenary, etc.).
Keelan: an explorer and keen Botanist. One of the explorers available to you with an example of her Skill cards.
“The Voracious Goddess”, “An Offering to The Guardians”, “The Bloody Hunt”, "The Dark Chest of the Damned" - Choose which curse (or curses!) has been put on you from those included in the base box (4) or those in the expansions (5).
Your goal? Find out how to lift the curses you have chosen and then purge your soul of them. Each curse offers a very unique adventure and will take you to different places. Obtain the unobtainable, discover that which is forever hidden, and strive against the impossible.
Do you have what it takes?
A Curse that you can attempt to lift and its clue.
You are now ready to begin your unexpected adventure. Similar to the books where "you are the hero”, you will explore the continent by putting numbered Terrain and Permanent event cards into play, which will gradually form the game board.
Forests, deserts, caves and mountains - you will visit dozens of different locations during your adventures as well as encounter random events that coincide with your location.
To progress through the game, you will perform the actions available on the Terrain card your miniature is standing on, the Event cards attached to it, and the Character, Skill, State and Bonus cards in your hand and the Items in your inventory.
In order to perform these actions, you will use the Action Deck that contains your Skills and simultaneously serves as your life force.
Every action makes you draw a certain number of cards from the Action Deck. These cards provide a variable amount of successes and you must obtain a specified number of them in order to succeed.
Fight action: draw 2 or more cards from the Action Deck to perform the action. Get 1 or more achievements to succeed.
Failing when performing an action may have terrible consequences and cause you to get negative State cards, forcing you to discard cards from the Action Deck, and consequently reducing your life force.
Fall off this peak and you will likely get injured.
Want to stack the odds in your favour? You may choose to draw more cards from the Action Deck to get more successes. However, every card in the Action Deck is a bit of your life force, so when the Action Deck is exhausted, so are you. From now on, every action could be your last!
Thankfully, the Skill cards that you may add to your hand when performing actions, your Bonus and Item cards, and the help from your companions will make things easier for you. This is especially true when it comes to decreasing the number of cards you must draw to perform an action or by increasing your chances of success.
A faithful companion and a precious item.
The 7th Continent is a strange land with many paranormal events, hostile creatures and inhospitable locations.
You will have to use your best survival skills to overcome the varied threats you will face in this land, so that you can eventually lift your curses:
Find or craft items to help you escape risky situations or access locations that would normally be unreachable without them.
Gather food, by hunting or fishing, in order to regain some life force, returning Action cards from the discard pile to your Action deck. Make a fire and cook it and you’ll find that you’ll get even more cards back!
Look carefully at your environment. It contains many clues and hidden numbers that can help you uncover the Continent’s many secret locations.
There are countless surprises for you to experience along your journey!
A page from your journal that now allows you to use this plant when you see it on your Terrain card.
You can download the rules (.pdf – 56 Mo) or check this video (26’) to learn how to play The 7th Continent!

Edit: cards from The Past must be returned between two game sessions.
All the expansions and optional purchases from the original Kickstarter will be available during the course of the second campaign.
How to add optional buys to my pledge?
1. Click on the “Manage your pledge” green button at the top of the page
2. On the next screen, click on the “Change your pledge” blue button
3. Then, in the current reward box you’ve chosen, increase the pledge amount by the value of the optional buy then click on the “Continue” green button
4. On the window that appears, click on the “Confirm” blue button.
5. It’s done!
6. A few weeks after the Kickstarter campaign ends, we will open the “Pledge Manager” (PM) and invite you to fill it by telling us which optional buys you’d like to purchase and in which language (English or French).
 
If you want to sleeve the ENTIRE game, including the Stretch Goals and any other content made available during the campaign, then you have to add both optional buys for a total of $79 which includes over 1600+ card sleeves (the “+” is additional sleeves included “for free” for the upcoming Stretch Goals and optional buys).
What would a Kickstarter campaign be without some Stretch Goats?
After 4 years of work, The 7th Continent became a reality thanks to the support of over 12,000 backers. Without them, we wouldn’t be here today.
The cost of making this game is high, notably due to the quality of its components. Due to this a retail version of the game is almost unfeasible.
However, we want the game to live and continue growing as well as allowing those that missed out on the first campaign and/or some of its contents to acquire them.
This campaign is no doubt one of your last chances to take part in The 7th Continent adventure...
This new campaign will allow you to expand upon the adventure we all began back in 2015. With new curses and mechanics, a whole new experience awaits you! It will also allow you to acquire any elements you may have missed from the first campaign.
For those of you only interested by the “upgrade pack”: you will be able to procure it (at production cost) at our online store at www.seriouspoulp.com when it becomes available in 2018.
Free Upgrade pack
This pack contains cards that will allow those of you possessing the first edition of the game to upgrade it to the second edition and 4 additional dividers to help you search for cards more easily (Characters' Skills, "004", "051", "109"). It includes any cards that may have been changed or corrected after the first campaign.
NOTE: This pack is included in the Veteran pledge (which is specifically for those with a copy of The 7th Continent from the first Kickstarter campaign)
New Content
If you purchased all available content from the previous campaign and wish to complete your collection, then all you’re missing is:
The expansion “What Goes Up, Must Come Down”: this expansion includes two new curses along with new ways to explore the continent.
Satchel & Notebook binder: this game accessory will allow you to store all the cards that would normally be placed under the Satchel & Journal card.
All unlocked Stretch goals that become available during the campaign.
These items are included in the Veteran pledge.
Also, new “optional purchases” will become available during the campaign (see "Optional buys" section). 
The USA, European Union, Canada and Australia will all be “Shipping Friendly”. This means that backers from these countries will not incur any import taxes.
After our experience with the first campaign, we are planning on two waves of shipping for this new project.
The First Wave will include the new "Second edition" base box and non-cards optional purchases (such as bone dice & dice bag, sleeves, etc.). This wave is slated for March 2018.
The Second Wave, due in October 2018, will include the new expansion "What Goes Up, Must Come Down", all optional buys with cards (old and new) as well as Stretch Goals from this campaign.
Shipping will be paid AFTER THE END OF THE CAMPAIGN, during the “Pledge Manager” phase. Below, you will find an estimation of shipping costs per shipping area. Despite this, we are committed to these prices being the maximum amount you will have to pay.
During the “Pledge Manager” phase, you can ask to receive everything, including the Base Box, in Wave 2 (due in October 2018) in order to reduce shipping costs significantly when compared to the cost of both waves (although still more expensive than the wave 2 shipping shown below).
*You can choose to have this optional buys shipped on wave 2 – instead of wave 1 – to avoid paying for the shipping fee associated.
**Europe (A): Germany, United-Kingdom, Republic of Ireland, Belgium, Luxembourg, Netherlands, Italy, Spain, Portugal, Switzerland and Austria.
**Europe (B): Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Hungary, Latvia, Lithuania, Poland, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Sweden, Czech Republic.
**Europe (C): Albania, Armenia, Belarus, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Croatia, Finland, Iceland, Montenegro, Norway, Serbia, Turkey, Ukraine (Note: the lower part of the estimate).
Note: recently updated for GREECE, ROMANIA and SWEDEN.
Also, South Korea is in Area 4 – lower part of the estimate
Would you like to pledge for multiple copies?
Each copy purchased includes all unlocked Stretch Goals. For areas 1, 2 and 3, shipping costs after the first pledge (up to a maximum of 7) are halved! We are still looking for solutions to get some discount for multiple copies for areas 4 and 5 as well (hopefully by the end of the campaign).
We’re two friends that love playing and making games. Also, one of us is pretty handy with a pencil.
Founded in 2010, Serious Poulp was all about seeing the games we designed come to life.
Serious Poulp Inc. is the name of the North American branch of Serious Poulp. It was created in 2017 to help us develop our business in North America.
The first Kickstarter campaign for The 7th Continent was successfully funded back in October 2015 thanks to the support of 12,103 daring explorers! Two years later, with a lot of experience from this first adventure under our belts, we’re back with some new ideas that we just couldn’t keep to ourselves!
Ludovic Roudy and Bruno Sautter
Two friends passionate about all things gaming! We’ve been working together for almost 15 years in the digital communication agency we created in 2002, then as Serious Poulp, which we founded in 2010, when the temptation to publish games became too strong to resist.
Role-playing games and gamebooks played a significant part in both our childhoods. Bruno was 5 when “The Warlock of Firetop Mountain” was published. Ludovic was 11 and already had a few prototypes on the go (one of which would eventually become The 7th Continent!).
We've been inspired by many great works during our lives, whether from board games, role-playing games or video games. When we started out in the board gaming industry, we naturally brought all of these elements with us.
We are not only the designers of the 7th Continent - Ludovic also creates all of the illustrations and visual elements for our games and Bruno, apart from writing cards and rulebooks, supervises production.
Jamie “Whelpslayer” Johnson
Jamie is the Community Manager for The 7th Continent and the scourge of small draconic beings. Rolling dice, pushing toy soldiers and trading sheep for many a moon now, Jamie is, just like you guys, a gamer at heart. He’s also a publisher himself with his own company, Holy Grail Games. Some of you may recognize him from the first Kickstarter campaign.
To our families and friends for their incredible support and patience as we created the cursed land of the 7th Continent.
To our proofreaders and translators who did an outstanding job!
To Olivier Nkweti for his great work on miniatures.
To the amazing Gary Chalk, Joe Dever, Didier Guiserix, Gary Gygax, Steve Jackson and Ian Livingstone for their inspirational work.
To all the backers of the first campaign who helped us make this dream a reality.
To you, previous and first-time backers, who will allow us to keep on dreaming!
Thank you all!
We wish you a not too gruesome demise in the land of The 7th Continent!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The re-printing of the base box does not pose any issues. 

Work on the new expansion has already begun and we are confident in our ability to meet the announced deadlines.

We will, of course, be keeping you updated about the state of the project through each and every stage. 

REFUNDS

All pledges can be refunded up to the completion of the Pledge Manager, no questions asked.

If the refund is requested more than 60 days after the end of the Kickstarter campaign, 10% will be deducted from the amount (corresponding to the charges incurred by Kickstarter and Stripe, since we will not be refunded at that point), and the refund will have to be done via PayPal instead of the Credit Card you used on Stripe.

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

All prices shown in € (Euros) are based on the conversion rate in effect at the start of the campaign (09-25-2017) which is $1 = €0.84

By pledging to this Kickstarter, you acknowledge that the final appearance, materials and content of the rewards (and the Kickstarter) are subject to change and may differ substantially from what is presented while the Kickstarter project is active.

You agree that our responsibility to you is to ship your order as entered into our pledge manager system, that title and risk passes to you upon delivery to a common carrier for such shipment, and you are responsible for import duties or any other duties that may be payable to the relevant tax authorities, providing correct address information, and ensuring this address is deliverable by normal methods. We regret that we are unable to ship to PO Boxes in most countries.

If you cannot accept these conditions, we advise that you do not back this project.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

We are delighted to announce that after more than a year of development, our new game, The 7th Citadel, is now live on Kickstarter.

campaign.story:
What is The Monster Dice?
Hi Kickstarter!
This time we made the coolest dice on Earth. Do you love playing board games? Then, our Monster Dice will make your time more enjoyable! Also, for both board game players and other people, it will be a marvelous decoration. The weight and visual pleasure will satisfy your appetite much more! Monster Dice will definitely stimulate your imagination while playing games or even watching the game.   
      Why we chose Monsters for the design? 
When we were spending time playing board games, we instantly came up with one idea. There are a lot of cool board game figures, but, why can't the dice be cool? Since we love bizarre things, we wanted to make the monsters permeate well on the dice. We were inspired by monsters that are well known to us in various myths. Each monster was redesigned by our own feelings. However, since we could not destroy the balance of the dice, forming monster dice had a lot of limitations.
   early models
  The weight of the dice should be the same in all directions without leaving the corner of the base frame.
   That was an impossible task by hand, so we actively used 3D simulation.
   Final Prototype
   PLAY

Monsters Overview 
     Maintaining Balance 
Since monsters have to be crafted in a degree that maintains equal balance(probability) of the dice, the whole process has been challenging.
We have created a well balanced dice through computer simulations and 3D printing prototype tests. 
However, the balance may be slightly tilted compared to other normal dice due to complex process of designing monsters on the dice.
If you help us to successfully accomplish our campaign, we will be able to complete the perfect balance of Monster Dice by controlling the weight of inner part of the dice. 
D10 Python Dice is the least balanced among other dice. The reason is because D10 Python Dice model has the most decorative shape which makes it harder to equalize the balance of the dice. However. we gained confidence that we can make this dice more balanced from final sample test of D10 Pyhon model.
   Probability table for 3,000 rolls.
  PLAY

 <Durability test of the Monster Dice>
Size comparison image for better understanding (on average male hands)
Details (size, material, etc.)  
Here are details of a Monster Dice set:

Contains 7 monster dice:
D4  Fire Drake (3oz, 85g)
D6  Basilisk (3.7oz, 105g)
D8  Kraken (4.2oz, 120g)
D10  Phython (4.2oz, 120g)
D10%  Dragon (3.8oz, 110g)
D12  Eblis (3.8oz, 110g)
D20 Daemon (6.3oz, 180g)
Silver, Copper, Titanium black plated.
Fully metal crafted dice (Zinc alloy)
Detailed description of Monsters
       Every dice is made of zinc and plated in three colors (silver, copper, and titanium black)
           
Christmas Delivery
I strongly believe that there are numerous backers who want to receive their products before Christmas.
We'll do our best to deliver products to backers in time.  
However, for the perfect quality of the products, a minimal amount of time is also required. 
We now know that the delivery can be delayed during the last months of the year. 
So, we decided to offer a special 'Christmas Delivery' service to backers.
If you make a pledge at 'Christmas Delivery' reward, you will receive products before Christmas with no delay. 
The first finished product is released on December 1st.
We plan to receive the initial supply first and send it to backers by air express. 
This will inevitably involve additional costs.
However, it is a minimal cost and we will cover the extra costs. 
This service is only available for 400 backers. 
If you want to meet our gorgeous Monster Dice before Christmas, please pledge at 'Christmas Delivery' reward. 
Important Info 
There are three colors available (Copper, Silver, and Titanium Black)
Information regarding shipment fee is all provided in a pledge box)
Please carefully read the information in each pledge box before you pledge.
If you have further questions about us, please leave a comment below. We will carefully check your comments.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Production & Risk .

We have long manufacturing experiences. 

As a result of such experiences, we have high considerations of how to produce products from the planning process, and design.

We control the whole production process and final process directly.

Therefore, we think that there is a little chance of low quality problems in producing high quality Monster Dice. 

However, in the first kickstarter campaign, we lacked experience with bulk shipments, so we were not able to deal with unexpected situations. 

This time, however, we have prepared various shipping plans so as not to repeat such mistakes. 

There will be no problems for your safe delivery.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
