updates.update_content:
Dear backers
How's everything? Hope all is well

As most of you know, we received the black titanium Monster Dice with serious defects of the surface. We are trying to solve the problems with those who ordered the black Monster Dice. However, we began shipping the rest dice to backers: We have sent 300 sets so far. And, in this week, we are going to send 100 sets each day. As for the backers who ordered the black Monster Dice and thankfully understood us and switched colors from black to silver, we will also send them during this week. And All messages and comments on our page, we will answer them too. Now, everything is settling and I and my only one coworker are feeling relaxed. So, we will answer the previous questions of our backers. So far, we have also been frustrated due to continuous disappointing results from our factory. But, after we began shipping to our backers, we are feeling calm.(I know it sounds strange, but it really does). 

We understand you have been frustrated or irritated. There has apparently been our hesitation and brought about lack of communication. However, we would like to kindly ask for your kind understanding about this issue. As most of you know, kickstarter campaigners start with small size business, and until some degree of successful achievement, they suffer from huge amount of workload with limited number of labor. In this case, we have had hard situation with our factory. The issue was mainly made since we definitely want high quality of the dice. However, it was difficult for the factory, and no matter how much it costs, we have demanded the better quality with no defect. As everyone agrees, we have been funded well, and were able to bring this campaign alive here. However, it came out to be no revenue left on our hands. 

Despite of this situation, we are totally fine with that. But, we are definitely sad that some of our backers are too irritated that finally lost tolerance. There was no our intention to deceive our backers, run away, or try to reduce the manufacturing costs.

Hello!
We are uploading the image of our artwork to share with you.
 The artworks are well printed out, and we surely believe that you will like them, too!
They are ready to be sent with your Monster Dice.

updates.update_userinfo: Monster Dice Arrival & Notification about shipment
updates.update_content:
Hello, Backers!

We want to present a good news to all backers!

We received the final sample of Monster Dice this morning. We were greatly satisfied after checking all dice. 
1. Details are well expressed on the surface of each dice. 
2. The feeling of grab is really nice and chunky.
3. Dice are polished well. 
4. Monsters' skin and contours are clearly molded.

However, there still are some defects that need to be improved.

Hello Monster Dice backers!
First, sorry for late response. We see many backers having trouble with the survey. Before We explain how to use the survey, We want to tell you the reason why we chose to use this software. As all of us know, we failed to reach our stretch goals. So, in a hope to give backers opportunities to get Monster Dice Accessories that were in stretch goals, we decided to work on surveys with Crowdox. That's the reason we are using Crowdox survey. We are paying for this software because we thought that it will satisfy backers more than just finishing in kickstarter. We are greatly sorry for first confusion, so we are going to explain how to use that strange survey to our backers.

PLAY

 In this video, you can see real image of the Monster Dice. We only have silver Monster dice sample at this point. After several discussion with the factory, we tried hard to improve the quality of the dice.   Copper and Titanium Black Monster Dice are going to be shown here in next week. We will progress onto production based on this quality.   Moreoever, this is very important, we are making a survey with Crowdox. This survey will be also sent to you very shortly. You will be able to check more there and if you had missed something you wanted, you can choose them there. I think it is really great :) Thank you all backers! We will come back with a new story!

We express our thankful appreciation to all backers!  
Thanks to your supports, we successfully finished our campaign.   
In return to your supports, we will do our best to satisfy all of you until you safely receive your Monster Dice. We have already progressed to make some samples. Since we found some quality defects in the samples, we are now trying to refine the parts. Due to the problem, approximately 2 weeks are delayed. We know that we don’t have enough time before Christmas. However we are confident in making no problems both in quality and delivery. Regarding EU-friendly matters, we are contacting 2 companies. We will inform you all when everything is set on the way. We will open a survey in this week. We kindly ask for your participation so all of you can receive them with no error. We are talking with ‘Crowd-ox.’ When we get a chance to open our campaign on ‘Crowd-ox,’ dice bags and single dice will be available on extra pledge option. We are greatly thankful for your previous supports, and we ask for your supports again on ‘Crowd-ox.’ We will update our progress regularly to diminish your worries. Facebook page of Monster Dice is also going on, our updates will be posted mainly on Facebook.

campaign.story:
Welcome to the world of Super Powered Legends!
In 2015, rpg artist and writer Jacob E. Blackmon began to create a super-heroic universe featuring iconic characters for use with the 3rd Edition Mutants & Masterminds rpg by Green Ronin Publishing. Over the last two years, there have been over 100 PDFs produced featuring over 180 heroes and villains to fill this world of wonder.
And now, Rogue Genius Games is collecting these PDFs into one massive tome: The Super Powered Legends Sourcebook!
At its base funding level, the Sourcebook will feature all heroes and villains from every Super Powered Legends product -- including the Disaster Day! adventure -- up to date. In addition, the Sourcebook will feature information about using each character as a hero or villain respectively.
As stretch goals are reached, the Sourcebook will expand to include additional information about different locations within the Super Powered Legends universe. This includes familiar countries like the United Kingdom, Romania, and China; and how these nations have changed to accommodate the existence of super-powered beings in their borders. Other locations include hidden worlds on Earth, such as the sunken nation of Atlantis and the mysterious City of Monsters: Agartha. Beyond Earth, exists interstellar beings of cosmic power and high adventure. These alien worlds will also be expanded upon with additional stretch goal funding.
Included in all of these expanded areas will be new art by Jacob Blackmon.
Sign up today to get the Super Powered Legends Sourcebook for M&M! Because sometimes you a need characters everyone knows, even if they're meeting them for the first time.
Cover art by Jacob Blackmon
 REWARD LEVELS
Innocent Bystander (Pledge $1 or more)
You're just here to watch. No rewards, but we appreciate the support! tell your friends, and watch out for falling rubble!
Crowd Control (Pledge $20)
No new material for you, but you'll get a bundle of all the pre-existing Super Powered Legends hero and villain pdfs! That's more than 100 two-dollar pdfs, a better than $200 value, for just $20!
Be a Hero (Pledge $25)
You receive a pdf copy of the Super Powered Legends Sourcebook. This will have all the material from all existing Super Powered Legends hero and villain files (more than 100 characters), the additional material by creator Jacob Blackmon, plus all the content from all stretch goals!
Avenging League! (Pledge $35)
You receive a pdf copy of the Super Powered Legends Sourcebook, and the ability to buy an "at-cost" hardback print-on-demand copy. These will have all the material from all existing Super Powered Legends hero and villain files (more than 100 characters), the additional material by creator Jacob Blackmon, plus all the content from all stretch goals!  
The "at-cost" print-on-demand copy will be made available thought DriveThruRPG. You'll have to pay the actual cost of printing and shipping the book, but no additional payment goes to Rogue Genius Games.
BASE GOAL
$1,500 (UNLOCKED!!) The Sourcebook will collect all existing Super Powered Legends PDFs into one book. In addition will be information about how to use each character as a hero or villain, respectively. 
STRETCH GOALS
$1,650 - Legendary Timeline (UNLOCKED!!) At this goal, a timeline will be included as an additional chapter to the Sourcebook. This timeline will feature alternate historical events of Earth; as affected by a world where superhuman beings have existed.  
$2,000 - Super Powered Legends Coloring Book (UNLOCKED!!) At this level, all supporters of $25 or more will receive a Super Powered Legends Coloring Book PDF. This will feature the existing SPL art in black and white for you to color!  
$2,250 - Super Powered Legends Art Collection (UNLOCKED!!) At this stretch goal, all supporters who have pledged $25 or more will receive a PDF collection of all of the Super Powered Legends cover illustrations in brilliant full color.
$3,000 - Atlantis Rises! (UNLOCKED!!) Expanded information about the undersea kingdom, introduces the Queen of Atlantis, and various villains of the Sunken Nation. Includes all-new art by Jacob Blackmon for each new character.
 $3,300 - China (UNLOCKED!!) The presence of super-powered beings has affected the political landscape of China and its neighboring countries. Discover more with this unlocked stretch goal; including the People's Defense Force (China's national superhero team), the city of Hong Kong under the rule of the Grand Emperor, and some of the empowered minions of the Grand Emperor. Includes all-new art by Jacob Blackmon for each new character.
 $3,600 - Egypt (UNLOCKED!!) The ancient lands of Egypt hold magical secrets under its sands. As "young gods" awake around the world, the old gods of this country seek to reclaim their power over humanity. The dark god Sutekh promises power to those who worship him; ultimately placing him on the throne as the new ruler of Egypt and throwing Northern Africa and the Middle East into a new era of conflict. The heroes of Egypt -- including the newest Winged Avenger -- attempt to remove the dark god from his throne. Includes all-new art by Jacob Blackmon for each new character.
 $4,000 - Japan (UNLOCKED!!) Since the appearance of Kaiju Island, this island nation is plagued by monster attacks. Its only defense are the heroes of the country: the Kaiju Defense Force and their transforming vehicles who battle the giant monsters destroying the cities and the magical girls who fight demons that corrupt the minds and souls of Japan's citizens. Includes all-new art by Jacob Blackmon for each new character.
 $4,500 - Romania (UNLOCKED!!) From his royal palace, Lord d'Arc schemes to bring the world under his control. Only under his rule can Earth be safe from the alien and mystical threats he sees coming. To fulfill his goals, he has gathered the worlds greatest scientists to help create new warriors and agents. Meanwhile, the undead Count Orlok seeks to usurp Lord d'Arc and use his super-science creations to expand Orlok's kingdom of vampires! Includes all-new art by Jacob Blackmon for each new character.
 $5,000 - United Kingdom (UNLOCKED!!) The United Kingdom has a storied history of heroism since the days of Camelot. Villains from that era, such as the wicked Mordred, continue to scheme their plans of taking the kingdom away from humanity. Standing in their path are the Royal Lions, the nation's foremost team of heroes. Includes all-new art by Jacob Blackmon for each new character.
 $5,500 - Faez Territories (LOCKED) Leaving Earth, this stretch goal expands upon the alien worlds of the Faez; a race of shape-shifting aliens who attempted to invade Earth after their own home world was destroyed. Their shape-shifting powers can even be magnified to mimic the powers of other super-human beings; creating the UltraKnights! Includes all-new art by Jacob Blackmon for each new character.  
$6,000 - Khor Empire (LOCKED) These expansionistic aliens believe it to be their manifest destiny to rule over the entire Milky Way Galaxy. Engaging in generations of eugenics directed by their living super-computer Primus, the Khor have become a race devoted to war and conquest. Includes all-new art by Jacob Blackmon for each new character.
 SOCIAL STRETCH GOALS
As the Kickstarer campaign expands, we will offer benefits to our supporters. The more people who pledge to the Kickstarer campaign will increase the benefits of all!
Social Stretch Goal #1 (50 Pledges) - Royal Family of Agartha PDF (UNLOCKED!!)
When 50 total people have pledged to the Kickstarter campaign, all supporters of $20 or more will receive a free PDF describing the Royal Family of Agartha, City of Monsters!
Social Stretch Goal #2 (75 Pledges) - Agartha, City of Monsters (UNLOCKED!!)
When 75 total people have pledged to the Kickstarter campaign, all supporters of $20 or more will receive a free PDF describing the hidden City of Monsters, Agartha! Included will be additional heroes and villains of the city.
Social Stretch Goal #3 (150 pledges) - Henchmen For Hire! (UNLOCKED!!)
When 150 total people have pledged to the Kickstarter campaign, all supporters of $20 or more will received a free PDF describing several villains on the payroll of the infamous Crime Czar. Some of the villains included will be Kodiak (a Bulgarian loup-garou) and Bad Bunny (the lepus-powered big sister of the heroine Chipmonk).
Social Stretch Goal #4 (200 pledges) - Disaster Day (LOCKED)
When 200 total people have pledged to the Kickstarter campaign, all suppoters of $20 or more will receive a free PDF copy of Super Powered Legends Adventure: Disaster Day!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The Super Powered Legends products are both written and illustrated by a single creator, Jacob Blackmon. this gives them a clean and consistent creative vision--but it also makes them vulnerable to severe disruption if something catastrophic impacts Jacob's ability to write or draw stretch goal material.
Obviously we have designed the schedule to allow ample time for the typical give and take of a freelance creator's schedule, and we feel confident that under any normal circumstances we'll be able to hit our estimated delivery dates. But if something well outside the ordinary occurs, it could create a situation where we must either accept a greater delay than we'd like, or find a way to have some of the stretch goal work done by a different writer or artist.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
We are still waiting on the approval for the Print On Demand version of the SPL Sourcebook. Sorry it's taking longer than we thought. I was really hoping it to be out by now. When I have a better confirmation from Rogue Genius Games other than "soon," I will let you know.
In the meantime, LJ Stephens is currently busy getting the coloring book and art book PDFs built. Those should be available to the backers soon.

Heya, Legends fans!
We hope you've been enjoying the preview PDF. The feedback has been positive so far. A couple of fans have been good enough to go through the pdf and sent us back a multi-page list of errata. So, we are currently trying to get those errors fixed up before releasing the final pdf.
On the other hand, after its long hiatus, Super Powered Legends is BACK! The newest SPL pdf featuring the giant Meta-hunting robots: The Peacekeepers has been released. You can check that out now at DriveThruRPG.

While production of the Super Powered Legends Sourcebook continues, Rogue Genius Games, and their partner Everyman Gaming, LLC is running a new Kickstarter to create the Advanced Skill Guide.
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1768030821/advanced-skill-guide-kickstarter-for-the-starfinde

After spending time away in the Seattle area, I am back to work on art commissions.
While in Seattle, I visited the offices of Rogue Genius Games and watched a while as LJ Stephens put some pages of the Sourcebook together. She showed me a cool page border that was created by none other than Crystal Frasier (Green Ronin's head of M&M development).
As far as I saw, we remain on schedule for the April release date.

LJ Stephens is busy putting together the SPL Sourcebook.
I realize it's been a while since there have been any new Super Powered Legends products. I have been making them. But Rogue Genius Games has been so busy with their backlog of other projects (including the Sourcebook) that they have not been able to release them. Hopefully we can get caught up soon.
In the meantime, I will be attending ZOECon in Bellevue, Washington this weekend (February 16-18) as the ARTIST GUEST OF HONOR (this is the first for me!). If you live in the Pacific North-West region, please feel free to swing by the Bellevue Red Lion Inn.

Progress continues on the editing and development side of things.
Y'all want to see some Khor and Faez Soldiers? Of course you do!

campaign.story:
Legendary Dungeons & Dragons® game author Frank Mentzer presents his own fantasy world, 40 years in the making!
Philadelphia PA, 1978: Singles and spouses gather to tell stories together in a game that has run for 2 years, half as old as the rules themselves. These are the new Role Players, choosing cooperative games over competition. They love the epic tales from Frank’s D&D® game...fun and exciting, the dawn of an era!
Lake Geneva, 1983: Working at TSR, publisher of the game, Frank writes the D&D “Red Box” set and a full line thereafter, selling tens of millions of copies in 14 languages.
Near Lake Geneva, 2017: After a lifetime of gaming experience, the creator of that original campaign offers it for everyone’s use.
Loxley inc proudly presents—Frank Mentzer’s Worlds of Empyrea.
Worlds of Empyrea .com
  Producer & Wordsmith Frank Mentzer
Executive Producer, Map, and Graphics Darlene
Design & Development Ted Fauster, Tim Beach
Editing Steven Winter, Anne K. Brown
Art Team Peter Bradley, Don Higgins, Mark Quire, Ogmios
Cartography Alyssa Faden, Anna Meyer
Business Chris Wiese, Kevin “Doc” Wilson
Crowdfunding Engineer Mike Myler  

Legendary Guest Authors
David "Zeb" Cook (D&D Expert, AD&D 2e), Ed Greenwood (Forgotten Realms), Allen Hammack (Ghost Tower of Inverness), Tracy Hickman (Dragonlance, Ravenloft), Harold Johnson (Lost Shrine of Tamoachan), Tim Kask (Dragon Magazine), Len "Leomund" Lakofka (Lendore Isles), Steve Marsh (D&D Expert), Douglas Niles (City of Greyhawk), James M. Ward (Deities & Demigods, Gamma World), “Skip” Williams (Sage Advice, D&D 3e), with a Foreword by Margaret Weis (Dragonlance)
Legendary Guest Artists
Clyde Caldwell, Liz Danforth, Jeff Dee
Jeff Easley, Larry Elmore, Jennell Jaquays
“Diesel” LaForce, Erol Otus, Stephen D. Sullivan
Approved by Judges Guild
Whether your game* is Dungeons & Dragons, RuneQuest, Savage Worlds, Pathfinder, Castles & Crusades, Dungeon Crawl Classics, Hackmaster, or Swords & Wizardry, this box set has the 'crunch' you want. Fans of every fantasy game system will now have a common world to share.
In the future we hope to support more game systems. Loxley welcomes contact with all fellow creators and publishers.
When you have the same scenery, it's easy to try the Intro version of another game system. It's a big world of tabletop gaming out there—take a look around!
You’ve seen the core team of 16 and the amazing list of legendary guests, 11 authors and 9 artists. You’ve heard about the plan to provide game specifics (‘crunch’) for 10 game systems. But what IS the Setting really? What’s there now, and what’s happening soon? Good question. It’s complicated. For the long version click HERE; summary below.
History: This continent is the original home of all demi-humans, who know how to get along with each other and with nature. Humans arrived, tried to conquer the place, but were forced to compromise because they didn’t have an edge. Their realm, Empyrea, has evolved for 3 centuries. Their kings followed a three-prong strategy of cooperation: Minimize technology, promote magic (obeying the gods), Work with nature and the planet for long-term stability and health, and Support knowledge, the arts, and quality of life; avoid misuse of wealth and power.
Place: Empyrea is a rectangle. The left side is a coast with sea monsters. Mountains north, with giants. East is blocked, impassible terrain. Deepwood south, with creatures, then tribes, then evil armies -- and they’re planning to visit soon.
Below is the primitive digital map that has been available to online players since 1992. Darlene is now rendering it in her unique style, Anna is transforming that into 3D imagery, and Alyssa is detailing cities and towns. Guest authors are detailing locations... Inns, ships, shops, and more.
Online campaign map 1992-present
People: The dwur claim the land below, but most dislike sunlight, so noniz handle their surface business. The olve claim the woodlands, and many hobniz are in the gourmet trade near towns. Other ‘niz (brownies and sprites and many more) are about, as are the Others, various odd monstrous races and variations.
Action: Upcoming issues of the realm will emerge as time passes. The call to arms will sound, and the fate of the realm will be decided – perhaps by your characters! Will you run and hide, or are you a real Hero?
How To Play

Start: Either your characters grew up here, or they popped in from another place. We’ll provide guidelines for both, and three kits for suggested local character backgrounds (urban, farm, borderlands). In a starting adventure the characters meet and head out seeking fame and fortune.
Your Stuff: You bring your characters, your game system, your style. Magic, monsters, gods? Use whatever you like. Empyrea will be the backdrop to your stories, just some new names at first. More is there when you’re ready for it.  
You seem to be a serious hobby gamer. Consider this a useful tool, a 'second home'. This is a complicated fantasy campaign world, and we can only describe a small part of it in advance. So if you have questions, please post them on any of several sites available. We’re still building that part of things, so bear with us, and help us grow!  
Queen Nuana and King John IV
  With the Quick Start Guides (presenting character backgrounds from city, farm, and wilderness life) and starter Adventures, you’ll be playing immediately and learning fast. Supporting materials include the Empyrea Core Book, Player’s Handbook, full color Darlene maps, 3 "Little Brown Books", and a System Book with your preferred FRP rules.
Imagine a game world that we all share, and one that you can shape. All subscribers can add their own designs to the official Worlds of Empyrea—realms that are mostly empty, waiting for you.
See your own inn or tavern come to life! Or is it a shop within a Royal City? Maybe it's an entire dungeon! (Guidelines coming soon.)
With names like Darlene, Elmore, Easley, Jaquays, Otus, Dee, and more, you know the artwork will be of the highest caliber with that "old-school" feel. Speaking of Darlene, here's the Empyreal Valley, newly rendered in her famous style (caution, flashback to 1983):
  You will receive at least 350* pages of goodness: 
 
Empyrea Core Book (perfect bound softback, full color, UV laminated) 
Empyrea Player’s Guide (perfect bound softback, full color, UV laminated)
Full Color 2-part Darlene Map detailing the entire Realm of Empyrea
Three "Little Brown Books" with special details for players and game masters
A System Book** with rules for playing in Empyrea using the RPG of your choice
* 350 pages or more; we reserve the right to add more cool stuff if we can. The bigger the Kickstarter, the more you get. Spread the word!
** Additional System Books can be acquired as add-ons (see the Empyrea Add-Ons section below).
Worlds of Empyrea dot com
  TREASURE: Some supplements are Empyreal Treasure Chests. If you pledge $5 or more, you become a Subscriber and are eligible to purchase these exclusive PDF collections at great discounts! In addition, some special Treasures will be available to Kickstarter Backers only. Treasure Chests may include detailed places, magic items, spells, and more by Frank and the design team.
Pledge $400+ and get Free Shipping!
All other backers pay actual postal cost (no handling fee) when the rewards are ready.
See the Project FAQ for estimated shipping costs.
  A bar in Outland, just days from The Wall
   Lots of additional goodies are in the works, including but not limited to:
City Guide Series 
Treasure Chest specials
Adventure Modules for all 10 Game Systems
Interactive Empyrea Website  
Novels based in the Worlds of Empyrea
And lots more!
Facebook: WorldsofEmpyrea
Twitter @EmpyreaOnline

MAP SIGNED by DARLENE ($20 + shipping): An extra map of Empyrea signed by Darlene and tube-mailed (remaining unfolded). Perfect for framing!

EXTRA SYSTEM BOOK ($10): Want to play in Empyrea in 5E and Pathfinder? Runequest and DCC? Add $10 to your pledge for each additional rulebook you want to use, and we'll send the matching System Books and their PDFs. Get all ten to be sure! (Shipping will apply if mailed separately.)

VTT MAPS ($25): If you're planning digital adventures in Empyrea, add $25 to your pledge and get high-resolution maps with your rewards!


This is the first major setting to be released for a wide spectrum of fantasy roleplaying games. Game publishers can't afford to support their competitors. By contrast, Loxley inc is a Design House, supporting the roleplaying Hobby. We sincerely hope that similar projects will follow from other creators.

In Empyrea or elsewhere, please support
Tabletop Hobby Gaming!

Western view from Northending

This is an historic step... many game systems, many legendary names. Look past the differences in your preferred fantasy games, and embrace our common interests. Empyrea is offered as a small step toward that goal.

Thank you once again for your support. Remember that some pledge levels can only accept a limited number of backers and will quickly lock. Once these rare opportunities are gone, they will never be repeated.    


* Legal Note: All game system names cited herein, and all proprietary parts thereof, are the property of the respective owners. Usage herein shall not constitute any challenge to the ownership or rights thereof. No express permissions are implied or claimed.
  RPGNetChatroom Q&A — EN World Interview
Please take a moment to actually read the following. Kickstarter requires each Project to summarize its Risks. This is good. Be careful out there.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Frank and Darlene are proud to offer a Setting with top quality art, game design, and physical components. It is the debut of an all-new method to support several Game Systems at once. This is innovative and can be cost-effective, but its success remains to be evaluated. This is truly new.

The Team have adapted as we've grown organically, but this is a Temp job for most. We have other jobs, and rich lives. Coordination and communication require constant vigilance for the next 9 months.

Finally: Loxley inc is a new company, as yet unproven... so all the Team members have extensive resumes, each with decades of experience in the RPG Industry. They are actively shaping the entire project. The Team's expertise is the best guarantee of a creative and financial success in this Kickstarter Campaign, and much more to come.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: My Quandary, and Turning Off the Lights
updates.update_content:
To find a new game we have to find an ad or hear folks talk. The talk is usually about the big sellers, the usual fare. We have to prowl to find new ideas, and carefully follow posts. The great game magazines of the past have vanished. 
I support local game stores and the network that makes them possible. I concede that lower prices (barely, with shipping) are available online. But I can’t try the game online, and sometimes I can at the local store. (Not at the Big Store, of course, forget them.) If the price is just a little higher, please support your neighbor. 
I love variety. You’ll find me playing and trying all sorts of games at most of the conventions I attend. I try to support and talk about the great variety that’s been around for 17 years (broad perspective, sorry) due to the OGL Open Game License of 2000, which produced Osric and Pathfinder and then ideas from a thousand other talents with a mutual love for tabletop gaming.

Greetings! This is Frank.
We're seriously discussing ALL your great input, and thanks again.  
I've decided to delay a relaunch (groan) until we’ve had more time to work. It's a tough call but we can't afford to rush. We've closed the Preview of the build area, mostly because that's now under reconstruction. Meanwhile, the current Kickstarter will remain open for general reference, and of course you also have WorldsofEmpyrea dotcom.

campaign.story:
Thank you for joining Rocket Pig Games in the great unveiling of the very first complete line of 3D printable miniatures! We are so pleased to release this epic line of fantasy miniatures and creatures! 
Take a look here to see a slideshow showcasing our Tilescape: Dungeons (available now or as an add-on) and our Stout Hearted Miniatures!
                                                     "painted by Rob Spoon Facebook/Pro painted figures"
Our miniatures have a unique, stylized design that makes them perfect for printing on your filament printer. Our experienced modelers design the  miniatures with high resolution so they will print beautifully with PLA or with resin. Our miniatures are filled with personality that are uniquely Rocket Pig Games. There’s something special about each one that stands out and they are a joy to paint and play with! 
HawkBear and Yeti printed with PLA
CLICK HERE for more printed Stout Hearted Heroes
                                                        PLEASE CLICK TO PICTURE to see an album of some of our Stout Hearted Heroes printed in resin. Did you know that you can order a Wanhao D7 resin printer for only $500? I've heard it does an excellent job! 
    Rocket Pig Games is known for their exquisite terrain and meticulously detailed textures, and we will be having more terrain Kickstarters! We just wanted to offer you these fantastic miniatures while we are working on our next masterpiece! Of course, our “King of Thieves” pledge from the Tilescape DUNGEONS Kickstarter will be available as an add-on so don’t fret if you missed out!  If you want to start printing your Dungeons now, you don't have to wait! You can purchase it right now from our store. To learn more about what makes our Tilescape system unique, please visit the Tilescape DUNGEONS Kickstarter page here.
                                                                                                        Everything...ALL-IN PLEDGE from our first Kickstarter!www.kickstarter.com/projects/rocketpiggames/tilescape-dungeons/
Get this miniature now RIGHT HERE:https://www.thingiverse.com/thing:2542301
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Rocket Pig Games specializes in 3D printable modular terrain and miniatures. Many people don't realize that they will not receive a physical product in the mail. All of our Kickstarters are for .stl files. These are files that you can print on your 3D printer at home or through a service that prints .stl files for you. Our greatest challenge to date has been explaining this to people who are not familiar with what 3D printing is. It's becoming more familiar to people and we are happy to help them explore the amazing world of 3D printing!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Samples of painted resins supplied by Studio Giraldez. Resin masterclass models supplied unpainted
Strap in and blast off! The Starfinder Roleplaying Game puts you in the role of a bold science-fantasy explorer, investigating the mysteries of a weird and magical universe as part of a starship crew. Will you delve for lost artifacts in the ruins of alien temples? Don rune-enhanced armor and a laser rifle to battle undead empires in fleets of bone ships, or defend colonists from a swarm of ravenous monsters? Maybe you'll hack into the mainframe of a god-run corporation, or search the stars for clues to the secret history of the universe or find brand new planets to explore. Whether you're making first contact with new cultures on uncharted worlds or fighting to survive in the neon-lit back alleys of Absalom Station, you and your team will need all your wits, combat skill, and magic to make it through. But most of all, you'll need each other.
ADVENTURE: The Starfinder Adventure Pledge level is a great entry point for the start of your collection of Masterclass figures. This pledge includes 8 Kickstarter exclusives, including Candy cosplaying as Navasi and Cola cosplaying as Quig, along with heroes from the Pathfinder RPG Legacy Races. Also included is a gang of Space Goblin Zaperators. Customize your pledge with the added 6 Hero Slots and 4 Encounter Pack Slots. Also all unlocked Freebies!
CAMPAIGN: The Starfinder Campaign Pledge level is the perfect pledge for the miniature enthusiast. This pledge includes 8 Kickstarter exclusives, including Candy cosplaying as Navasi and Cola cosplaying as Quig, along with heroes from the Pathfinder RPG Legacy Races. Also included is a gang of Space Goblin Zaperators. Customize your pledge with the added 12 Hero Slots, 6 Encounter Pack Slots, 2 Fleet Pack Slots, and 4 Creature Slots. Also all unlocked Freebies!
THE ALL-IN PLEDGE: includes one offering of every Hero, Encounter Pack, Creature, and Fleet unlocked during the campaign; including the limited editions of six Legacy Heroes, Candy and Cola, a Space Goblin Gang and Kickstarter Backer Only Seelah the Paladin.
    Stretch Goals are items that unlock as the campaign reaches new heights. More options for heroes, encounter packs, creatures, and fleets will be revealed over time. There are three types of goals: Freebies, Optionals, and Social Media Stretch Goals.
Freebies will be added to the Adventure Pledge and Campaign Pledge as soon as they unlock. Optionals will provide additional options to use on those Hero, Encounter Pack, Creature, and Fleet Slots.
Social Media Unlocks depend on the number of shares the following image receives on Paizo’s Facebook page. https://www.facebook.com/paizo/posts/10155550807787530
How the Starfinder Masterclass Miniatures Slot System Works
To offer the most customizable pledge rewards possible we have developed the Kickstarter Slot System. There are 4 kinds of Slots: Hero, Encounter Pack, Creature, and Fleet. The Adventure and Campaign pledges come not only with specific models but several types of Slots to customize the pledge. Every item option has a Slot type and cost. Additional Slots beyond those in the Adventure and Campaign Pledge can be purchased for the cost listed in the Additional Slots section. As the campaign progresses and more stretch goals are unlocked the type of Slot and cost of each unlocked model will be listed in the appropriate section.
Freebie Stretch goals add one free model or upgrade to the pledge. Additional models of that unlocked Freebie may be purchased as listed in the appropriate section.
HEROES: Each Hero represents an individual pulled from the varied Starfinder races, character classes, and themes. These heroes double as playable characters and non-player characters, providing numerous options for players and gamemasters alike!
ENCOUNTER PACK: Encounter Packs include a mix of creatures and hero-like characters that the heroes may encounter in their adventures. Each pack is designed to supply figures for a standard encounter. More ambitious adventurers may encounter larger groups so it never hurts to get multiples of each encounter pack!
CREATURES: Dangerous creatures from the Alien Archive and Absalom Station are always an exciting, if not terrifying, part of any hero’s adventure.
FLEETS: Fleet Packs are a great addition to any campaign. These packs allow the epic space battles that are an integral part of Starfinder to be played out in style.
  The Starfinder Roleplaying Game is a new science-fantasy RPG based on the Pathfinder universe and rules, but complete and standalone. It's backward compatible, so you can still use all those Pathfinder RPG bestiaries, but features all sorts of new classes, races, equipment, and other elements uniquely suited to our far-future setting.
Using a traditional grid map and minis, your heroes explore mysterious planets in the far reaches of the galaxy. You’ll also take to the stars as your team pilots their very own starship on a hex-field map with minis! Will you play as a lashunta technomancer using magic to hack the defense grid, an android assassin with a laser rifle, or a ysoki ratfolk mechanic clambering around the guts of a spaceship as you blast your way through the enemy blockade?
This is the game that let’s you be as creative as you want. There are new races you've never seen before, new worlds beyond Golarion's system that we've never visited, new twists on magic and the rules system itself—and, of course, tons and tons of cool science fantasy gear, from starships and computers to infinitely sharp zero-edge swords and rune-augmented plasma cannons.
  For more information on the Starfinder Roleplaying Game, including how to purchase copies of the books, please visit: http://paizo.com/starfinder
After the close of the Kickstarter, backers will receive an invite to our webstore based pledge manager. Shipping will be charged based on the actual cost to ship your pledge and any additional rewards you select.
We will ship your rewards from the closest of several fulfillment hubs around the world:
USA (US and South America backers)
United Kingdom (UK, EU, and Rest of the World backers)
Canada (Canada backers)
China (Asia Pacific backers)
Australia (Australia and New Zealand backers)
Below is the general schedule once the Kickstarter ends so you know when to expect money to be taken and our overall shipping plan. Again these are estimates:
KICKSTARTER CAMPAIGN ENDS:
0 Day – Pledges are charged.
1 Week – Survey sent confirming emails.
1-2 Months – Pledge Manager access will be emailed to backers allowing backers to confirm their pledge and select spend their slots on figures and taking payment for shipping.
1 Month Before Shipping – Pledge Manager deadline - Backers need to finalize their pledge by this time to ensure delivery of their rewards.
Wave 1 Shipping - Estimated for May 2018.
Wave 2 Shipping - Estimated for Aug 2018.
Wave 3 Shipping - Estimated for Nov 2018.
There will be three shipping waves for this Kickstarter. Each wave will have a specific list of items that will be included in the shipment. The first wave will contain the base pledge models and several additional items. The second and third waves will comprise the rest of the available models. The purpose of the waves is to begin delivery of as many models as possible as early as possible. There are a huge number of sculpts in this Kickstarter. Rather than waiting until all models are sculpted, approved, and manufactured, we will begin fulfilling the first wave while the second wave is being finalized and so on. Once we have the data from the close of the Pledge Manager we will provide a full list of the first wave models. As we move through development and production of the rest of the models we will provide a list of what will be available in the second and third waves.
Backers of this Kickstarter who pledge during the campaign will have their product shipped before people who pledge after the Kickstarter campaign closes.
To help minimize your shipping and customs costs, we will ship rewards to multiple international shipping hubs at our cost (US, EU, CN, and AU). These hubs ship all rewards to backers in their region. Depending on your region, this will help reduce or eliminate any additional import duties you will be required to pay.

Paizo Inc. is publisher of the award-winning Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, Pathfinder Adventure Card Game, Pathfinder Tales novels, Starfinder science-fantasy Roleplaying Game, as well as board games and accessories.
In August of 2017, Paizo released Starfinder, its science-fantasy roleplaying game. Starfinder quickly turned into Paizo's best-selling product ever released at the Gen Con game fair, selling out within the first 6.5 hours of release. To learn more about Starfinder, visit: http://paizo.com/starfinder/.
Paizo.com is also a leading online hobby retail store, offering tens of thousands of products from a variety of publishers to customers all over the world. You can explore the wonder of the store at http://paizo.com/store/.
In the 15+ years since its founding, Paizo Publishing has received more than 100 major awards and has grown to become one of the most influential companies in the hobby games industry.
Ninja Division Publishing brings high quality board games, card games, and hobby models to tabletops around the world. Ninja Division’s diverse catalog features the ground-breaking Super Dungeon®: Explore, Ninja All-Stars®, Rail Raiders Infinite™, the fan favorite party game DrunkQuest™, premier licensed properties including My Little Pony: Tails of Equestria®, award-winning family game Luchador™, and many other amazing products. Ninja Division Publishing provides rewarding game experiences for families and gamers of all ages!
    Ninja Division would like to thank the kind folks at Lazy Squire Games for their expertise and support in creating and running the Starfinder Masterclass Miniatures Kickstarter campaign.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Ninja Division Publishing is very experienced with the production and manufacturing of miniatures. However, there is always the possibility of delays in any project, including: Development Delays, Manufacturing Delays, Customs Delays, and Shipping Delays.

REFUND POLICY

Refunds requested within 14 days of the closing of the Kickstarter campaign will be granted in their entirety. After 14 days, but before the closing of this Kickstarter’s Pledge Manager, we will refund your entire pledge minus any applicable Kickstarter and Processing Fees incurred. Once the Pledge Manager closes, all refund requests are subject to review and may or may not be granted based on our discretion.

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

By pledging on this Kickstarter you acknowledge the following:

1. Items shown during the Kickstarter are prototypes and the final product, including models, look, materials, and other content may vary from those shown while the Kickstarter is active.

2. It is Ninja Division Publishing’s responsibility to ship your rewards to you. It is your responsibility to provide Ninja Division Publishing with a correct address in a timely manner, and to ensure that the provided address is deliverable by normal methods and standard regional postal services. You accept that the shipping date is only an estimate, and that due to the logistics of worldwide shipping, backers in different countries may receive their rewards sooner than others, or that the product may make it into distribution in your own country or into special promotions before your reward arrives. Further, you agree that you are responsible for import duties or any other duties, taxes, or fees that may be payable to complete delivery of your items.

3. You have read and agree to the shipping details provided in the Shipping Information section.

If you do not accept these terms, please do not pledge and wait for retail release. Thank you for your understanding.

YOUR RESPONSIBILITY AS A BACKER

It is your responsibility as a backer to confirm your pledge in our Pledge Manager while it is open to receive your pledge. If you do not log in and confirm your pledge in the Pledge Manager prior to the closing date of the Pledge Manager, you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received. However, we may, at our discretion, refund or ship your pledge if you contact us and confirm your pledge after the closing date.

You are required to provide correct address information and ensure this address is deliverable by normal methods before your rewards are shipped. Reshipping pledge rewards that were undeliverable will be subject to an additional shipping charge.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: Starfinder Masterclass Miniatures Partnership

Greetings Ninjas,Over the past week, we have gotten many emails with questions regarding your past customer accounts. We'd like to take a moment to answer the most common ones we have received. 
Sodapopminiatures.com Accounts
We have had several concerned emails about customer's inability to log in and see your account information for Soda Pop Miniatures. We want to assure you that your sodapopminiatures.com account information, any outstanding orders, and Kickstarter pledges have  been lost. Everything is intact and we are working on migrating all that information to this new website so it's all available for you to access again.Once those accounts and account information has been migrated over, we will post an update here. At that time, you will then also be able to change your shipping address if you need to.

Hey everyone, 
As part of the process of updating our site, we are updating the SSL certificate, and that is taking a little time. You may experience some difficulty in getting on our website.
We are estimating resolution in the next 24 - 48 hours. We didn't want to worry anyone, to think we are going anywhere.

Greetings backers,

After a rocky start to the year, we are currently exploring new opportunities to move the Starfinder Miniatures Kickstarter forward. We don’t have any major announcements to make on that front, but want to give you visibility on what we’re working on:
Financing: We are working with investment groups to find the right financial partners to fulfill our obligations  and move Ninja Division forward. We have several options for moving the resin line forward and hope to be able to reveal more details as our plans finalize.

February 18, 2019
Boise, ID.
Ninja Division Company Update

campaign.story:
* Please read the FAQ section at the bottom of the page.
* Please note: we will NOT have a pledge manager. When I mentioned it in the Peasant pledge I should have said KICKSTARTER SURVEY. When you calculate your total pledge, it must be the correct and complete total and it must be pledged NOW, not after it's over. So, if you want add-ons, you'll add them to your base pledge level and that is your pledge amount. When I send the survey, that is when you'll tell me which add-ons you paid for.
Thank you for joining Rocket Pig Games in the great unveiling of the very first complete line of 3D printable miniatures! We are so pleased to release this epic line of over 200 fantasy miniatures and creatures! 
The excitement doesn’t stop there. As an extra special surprise, we have decided to incorporate our next Tilescape project into this one to create a Kickstarter that is twice as epic, twice as fun, and completely amazing!
With a sundry of stylized terrain tiles, you’ll have countless variations of the most sought after types of environments ranging from mountains to swamps and everything in between!
You’ll have gorgeous environmental pieces and props specific to different terrain areas.
You will have over 200 unique fantasy miniatures to fill your world and bring your adventures to life! There are creatures, monsters, and player classes ranging from Halflings to Nobles with many varieties to choose from in the four main miniature core sets as well as a plethora of miniature add-on sets.  
"painted by Rob Spoon Facebook/Pro painted figures"
We have added additional DELUXE terrain add-ons that will add dimension and flare to any fantasy setting! Do you dare to venture into the dangerous Orc WarCamp? Will you seek the knowledge and wisdom of the elves in the ElfWood Tree City? Perhaps you’d like to rest your weary head or grab a pint with the Halflings in the Hillside Village. Anything is possible!
Our miniatures have a unique, stylized design that makes them perfect for printing on your filament printer. Our experienced modelers design the terrain and miniatures with high resolution so they will print beautifully with PLA or with resin. Our miniatures are filled with personality that are uniquely Rocket Pig Games. There’s something special about each one that stands out and they are a joy to paint and play with!
OwlBear and Yeti printed with PLA
  Amazing High Resolution modeling and great detail on FDM printer
   CLICK HERE to see more printed Stout Hearted Heroes!
  This was a huge undertaking for our small studio and we really dedicated ourselves to get this released. We are still perfecting some of the renders and concepts and these will be noted with an “images coming soon” text. Rest assured, if you’ve purchased our terrain in the past, you know you will not be disappointed! We chose to do it this way rather than release them as add-on’s only so we could give you the best possible price in the “all in” pledges. 
Of course, our “King of Thieves” pledge from the Tilescape DUNGEONS Kickstarter will be available as an add-on so don’t fret if you missed out! To learn more about what makes our Tilescape system unique, please visit the Tilescape DUNGEONS Kickstarter page here.  
All of our Tilescape terrain is compatible with each other and will connect together using our patent pending system.

Don't let these 200+ miniature and creature files get lost forever...back today to help bring this amazingly unique project to life!

As promised, we've already added another add-on and you can expect more every day (FREE for King pledges) and stretch goals (included at the Prince level and up) Let's get this funded guys! Spread the link wherever you think people will be interested!

campaign.story:
How Much Time Do You Spend Typing?
If you spend your work days in front of a computer, you have likely felt some discomfort after a long day of typing. While spending less time on our computers would be the ideal remedy for this problem, that is not a realistic solution for most people. X-Bows was designed to limit the stress on your hands and wrists while also providing a productive and stylish typing experience.
 The Normal Keyboard Works Fine. Why Redesign It?
The traditional staggered QWERTY layout was not designed to be comfortable. Its design comes directly from typewriters of the 1800s and very little about it has changed since then.
The traditional keyboard layout causes our wrists to flex inwards at an unnatural angle while we type. With over-exposure, this wrist angling very often leads to discomfort or injury. We designed the layout of X-Bows to conform to our natural wrist angle and arranged the keys in an ortho-linear fashion (fancy way to say straight line) because that better aligns with the natural extension plane of our fingers. The reason that typewriters originally popularized the staggered key layout was so that their levers wouldn't jam - not exactly a modern concern.
 Design
X-Bows was designed with three criteria in mind:
Enhancing the comfort and ergonomics of the keyboard
Limiting the learning curve for our new layout
Creating an attractive design
Every decision we made was to fulfill one of these criteria. Here’s what we came up with:
Cross-Radial Design
The most noticeable and unique feature of X-Bows is certainly its key layout. The key columns are angled to promote a more natural angle for our wrists.
Moving the ENTER, Backspace, SHIFT and ALT keys into the center of the keyboard achieves two things:
First, it limits stress on the pinky, our weakest finger. The thumb is very underused on traditional keyboard layouts so repositioning these keys utilizes it without adding undue stress. 
Second, it makes these keys much easier to reach. On traditional typewriters these keys didn’t exist, had limited functionality, or had completely different functions. They were simply tacked onto the side of the keyboard. Making these keys easier to reach allows you to get more done when you’re typing and reduces the need to move your whole hand to reach a key - one of the most fatiguing acts in typing.
We think it looks pretty cool too. 
Limited learning curve
Do you remember when you were learning to type? It takes a lot of time and practice to develop the muscle memory in our fingers that allows us to type quickly and accurately.
X-Bows is not the first ergonomic keyboard ever created. Plenty of people have identified that the keyboard layout that we use could be dramatically improved. The biggest impediment to these keyboards gaining broader acceptance is that they require users to learn a whole new layout. Busy people inevitably get frustrated and revert back to their old keyboard when they need to work faster. Despite best intentions, a lot of ergonomic keyboards end up in a drawer never to be used again.
With X-Bows, we were dedicated to making that learning curve as manageable as possible. The letter keys have not moved from their QWERTY layout. Your right index finger is still hitting “J” and your left ring finger is still responsible for typing “W”. You don’t need to memorize a new key layout, your hands already know where all of the letters are on X-Bows.
The keys that we did move- ENTER, Backspace, ALT and Control- can also be found on the right side of the keyboard. We call these our “training wheel keys”. While we think that the keys in the middle are more convenient, as you’re beginning to type on X-Bows, it is no problem if you find yourself reaching for the backspace in the top-right. They are there while you adjust. Since X-Bows' keys are fully remappable, once you find yourself no longer needing these training wheel keys, you can program them to become shortcuts or macros; increasing your productivity even further!
While you won’t be able to take X-Bows out of the box and feel 100% comfortable typing on it immediately. Our testers have all reported adjusting to the new layout in under a week, some in as little as two days. Compared to other ergonomic boards that can take a month or more to adjust to, X-Bows makes ergonomic typing more accessible than ever before.
  Johnny, a developer in San Francisco was one of our first Facebook fans. We sent him a pre-production X-Bows and he reported being comfortable with the new layout in under a week
Stylish
We didn’t want X-Bows to look like something that your doctor prescribed to you. We didn’t want it to look completely alien to the rest of your desk set-up. We designed X-Bows to have a minimalist aesthetic and a manageable profile. You can easily carry X-Bows with you for a day of work on your laptop outside of the office.
      Our design has already caught the attention of some media:
  Want to write about X-Bows? You can find media resources here
Build Quality
You can have a great design, but it can’t help anyone if the product is not well built. We carefully selected all of the materials used to construct X-Bows in order to optimize durability and comfort.
 Mechanical Switches
Gateron is a relative newcomer to the mechanical switch game. Expert reviews of Gateron switches are overwhelmingly positive. The switches have an estimated lifetime of 50 million clicks- the highest on the market.
With X-Bows you have the option of 4 different switch types ranging from loud and clicky to quiet and linear.
Gateron Red switches are quiet with a linear feel and a 45gf actuation force.
Gateron Blue switches have a tactile and auditory click when you press them (you can hear it in our video). 55gf actuation force.
Gateron Black switches are linear, like the reds. They require a slightly heavier actuation force at 50 gf.
Gateron Brown switches offer a tactile bump when pressed but don't have the auditory click that blues have. They require a 45 gf actuation force.
New- Gateron Green switches- The Gateron Greens (my personal favourite) are a heavy, clicky switch. They are comparable to the Blues but with a higher actuation force of 80gf.
New- Gateron Clear switches- The Gateron Clears are a very light lienar switch. Similar to the Gateron Reds or Blacks, only the Clears have a lower actuation force of 35gf.
New- Gateron Silent Red Switches- A brand new switch, released just a few months ago. These are among the most silent mechanical switches on the market. They sound almost the same as typing on a laptop keyboard. They are a linear switch, requiring 45gf actuation force, just like the ordinary reds. To add the Gateron Silent Red Switches to your order, please add CA$20 ($17 USD) to your pledge.
Body Construction
The interior of X-Bows features an aluminum alloy plate to prevent board flex and makes for a very solid feel while typing. The bottom of the keyboard is ABS plastic with 5 rubber pads to ensure that the board won't move around while you're typing. X-Bows weighs ~0.8kg. 
Keycaps
X-Bows uses ABS+PC two colour injection molding keycaps. In plain terms: they're nice, durable keycaps and the letters will never fade from them. 
USB Cable
X-Bows connects by a USB type C port. We will include a 150cm (just under 5 feet) long USB-C --> regular USB cord in the box.
RGB Backlighting
RGB backlighting is a controversial issue in the keyboarding community. Often, subpar boards try to make up for their deficiencies with a lot of bright, flashing lights. For this reason we don’t want to spend too much time on our lighting effects, but c’mon, these are pretty fun.
PLAY

X-Bows' start-up lighting sequence.
X-Bows has 15 lighting movement effects with controllable brightness, speed, direction and colour. Of course, you can also turn them off.
PLAY

Using our software, you can also set individual keys to be lit in a designated colour. This is ideal for people who want to highlight their shortcut keys or those who like a creative, personalized lighting scheme.
An example of custom lighting on one of our older prototype boards.
Features
Software
X-Bows has downloadable software for you to program the keyboard to your own specifications. You can rearrange the layout of the keys (DVORAK anyone?), set a key to become a shortcut (quick access to your inbox for example), or set a macro - one key to serve the function of a key combination (for example, if you’re mistake prone, you can set the pgdown button to become control+z). You can also set specific keys to have designated lighting - gamers might like a glow under WASD (though, we've found that ESDF works best for gaming on X-Bows) or designers might want to highlight their most frequently used shortcuts.  
At the moment, X-Bows' software is compatible with WIndows. We are currently working on capatability with Mac and Linux and anticipate it being complete before the end of the campaign. 
A look at the X-Bows software. The interface may change before we ship.
Anti-Ghosting
“Ghosted keys” occur when several keys (usually 6 or more) are pressed at the same time and one or more strokes is lost because of the abundance of information going to the computer. Most people will never need to press 6 keys all at once, but for those that do, losing one or more of those key strokes is a major problem. X-Bows is 100% anti-ghosting in order to accommodate any key combination that you could possibly throw at it.
Add-Ons
It has been great to hear from everyone who reached out to us in the run up to our Kickstarter campaign. We have received some really useful feedback and ideas. 
We are always open to more ideas. If there's another feature or add-on that you would like to see included in our campaign, please mention it to us in our backer comments or social media.
Mac Keycaps
Due to overwhelming demand, we will be including the option for Mac keycaps. We have reached out to some keycap producers and Mac keycaps are no problem to produce. We will include this as a free option in our backer survey.
Apple Layout with Numpad
  Blank Keycaps
Some keyboard enthusiasts have reached out to us asking for a blank keycap option, with a dot to let the backlighting through. We're happy to oblige. This will also be a free option on the backer survey.
NEW- Regional Layout Keycaps
We will be offering UK, German and Nordic as regional layouts. We apologize to those of you who require other regional layouts as we just don't have enough demand to create the molds for them yet. After our campaign is finished, we will be able to offer additional regional layout keycaps on our web store with a significant discount to our Kickstarter backers. 
UK Layout
  German Layout
  Nordic Layout
 Wrist Rest
How can an ergonomic keyboard not have a wrist rest? We heard you on social media and we completely agree. We have contacted manufacturers and will be creating the design pictured below. If you would like to include the wrist rest with your X-Bows, please add CA$30 ($25 USD) to your pledge.
The rest is made from alcantarra and ABS plastic. It feels solid while also being soft. 
    Numpad- New!
This is a *GRAPHIC RENDERING*. We will release real photos of the numpad as soon as we can
**Important edit- The numpad can connect wirelessly through a magnetic transmitter to the main X-Bows keyboard. As the connection is magnetic, the numpad should be in close proximity to the keyboard when working wirelessly.  
**Important Clarification- X-Bows purchased with the numpad will come with two magnetic connecter transmitters built into them (one on each side). This makes wireless compatability with the numpad possible. X-Bows purchased without the numpad will not have the magnetic connector transmitters. 
Our new numpad will be fully programmable and backlit, just like X-Bows. It is standalone and can work on the right or left side of X-Bows, as the connection is magnetic, the numpad should be closely positioned to the keyboard itself. There is also another USB-C connection on the numpad if you would like to use it separate from X-Bows. The numpad's backlighting effects are synchronized with those of X-Bows.
A sketch of X-Bows with our new numpad
The numpad will connect to X-Bows via a wireless magnetic transmitter or by a separate USB-C cable. If you use the magnetic transmitter, it will not require the use of a second USB slot on your computer.
This is a *GRAPHIC RENDERING* of the numpad's wireless magnetic transmitter
The numpad will be available for an additional pledge of CA$60 (~$50 USD). If you would like the numpad, you can make an adjustment to your existing pledge and then check off numpad on the backer survey at the end of the campaign.
Stretch Goals- Updated!
We have unlocked the silver X-Bows colourway! It will be an available option on the backer survey.
The standalone numpad has been unlocked! Please see above for details.
We've unlocked a free X-Bows carrying case with all orders.
Our Story
X-Bows founder, Dr. Sigo Wang, is a medical doctor, specialized in medical imaging. In his practice, Dr. Wang was seeing a similar injury over and over again. Office workers, writers, and programmers were repeatedly coming to him complaining of pain, weakness and fatigue in their hands, wrists, forearms and shoulders. These are the easily identifiable symptoms of RSI- repetitive strain injury, caused by stress on joints from typing for prolonged hours on a standard keyboard. Dr. Wang sought to find a preventative solution for his patients. 
Over many months of determining the medical strengths and weaknesses of other ergonomic keyboards both past and present, Dr. Wang began to form his own opinion about the ideal design for a computer keyboard. The problem with ordinary keyboards was obvious to Dr. Wang - they weren’t designed to conform to the natural structure of people’s hands. The problem with the ergonomic keyboards currently on the market was simply that people were not using them. Dr. Wang recognized that the main deterrent of most ergonomic keyboards was the steep learning curve; most workers did not have the free time to spend weeks or months learning how to type on a new, often radically different keyboard layout. 
Raising money on Kickstarter will allow us to manufacture at the scale required to produce X-Bows at a reasonable cost. Our design is finalized and our prototype units are fully functional and have been successfully produced at a small scale. Now, we just need a kickstart to scale up our production.
X-Bows' Team
Thanks: Ryan, Lucy, Johnny, Esther, Andrew and everyone else who contributed their incredibly valuable feedback, expertise and opinions to this project! Thanks to Chris' Mom for proof-reading the wording on this page :)
 This project is promoted by Jellop, a direct­ response online advertising agency specializing in Kickstarter campaigns on Facebook Ads and Google AdWords.

updates.update_userinfo: Shipping From Our Alabama Warehouse to Begin Next Week
updates.update_content:
Hi Everyone,
Our shipment has arrived at the warehouse in Alabama! The freight forwarding process was a lot more opaque, complicated, and expensive than we had anticipated, but it’s finally completed.
I’ve had a few meetings this week with our warehouse partners and this final leg in the shipping process should go a lot more smoothly. The units have all been inbounded, and the delivery details have been uploaded into our 3PL’s system. All of the units will begin shipping early next week and tracking information will be sent to you.

Hi Everyone,
Just a short update today. Our shipment is still on the way to our Alabama fulfillment center. It should be arriving very soon and then will take a few days to be inbounded and then a few more days to get sent out. We’re getting very close.

One small note- this was the first large container shipment that we’ve ever done and our shipping partner had some concerns over the Windows key on our layout:

Hi Everyone,

I just wanted to share a quick update on shipping for the last of the crowdfunding orders.
The Obstacle

Up until now, we have shipped units individually, from China, as soon as they are ready. Due to a major customs backlog in China, this is not possible for us at the moment.

updates.update_userinfo: Shipping Update and A Personal Note
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone,
This is Chris Fleguel. I’m very happy to have rejoined the X-Bows team. I’m going to be helping out with marketing and communications as we move into our post-Kickstarter chapter and as we work to get things back on track. I’m still getting up to speed with everything that has happened on Kickstarter in the past two years, so please bear with me.
Shipping Update

updates.update_userinfo: Update Apr.5th: production status and shipping schedule
updates.update_content:
Dear backers,
Greetings!
The most time-consuming fuel injection keycaps were shipped to the assembly plant on April 2.

updates.update_userinfo: Progress Report and Sales of New Product
updates.update_content:
Hello, my dear supporters,
The good news has come.
Most of the materials have arrived and our engineer is now orderly guiding production on site of the factory.
Because of the uniqueness of X-Bows’ patented key layouts, there will be no automated production equipment deem suitable. Assembly, testing, packaging and all the other process are done manually, so the progress won’t be fast as producing standard keyboards. It’s slower, but it’s going, and we won’t end it till all orders are finished.

Dear backers,
Greetings!
We are writing this update to share our recent progress with you. We have good news here: we have signed an official contract with the factory, that they will provide a dedicated workshop and  a specialized production line for X-Bows keyboards. Meanwhile, the factory has been closed temporarily due to Chine New Year holiday, they will resume work in about 2 weeks. We have placed orders of all necessary materials before CNY, they will come in after the holiday as well.

updates.update_userinfo: Nov. Update：Follow-up production plans and what we have been doing
updates.update_content:
Dear backers,
Greetings!
We received most of the feedback from testing units, we are sorry that people don't seem to like our spherical OEM keycaps. Most of you want keyboards with RGB backlights and keycaps with transparent letters, so we could proceed to mass production soon.

Dear backers,
Greetings!
We have received some of your feedback, which is the meaning of why we sent out the "testing units", we want to hear about your honest thoughts and opinions about the product, whether good or bad. In addition, the backers of the "testing group" will also receive our final version after mass production.

Dear backers,
Greetings!
We've sent out the testing units after our last update, some of the backers have already received their keyboard and started using them. We are now collecting feedback from these backers, see what we could improve. If you are one of those backers, we would appreciate it if you could send us your thoughts and how you feel about the keyboard to email: support@x-bows.com.

campaign.story:
Note: If funded we will make Spanish and Italian rules available via PDF
Summon Your Power!  
Dawn of the Archmage is a small unit (miniatures) skirmish game for 2 to 4 players. Each mage will represent a school of magic, summoning powerful monsters to the battlefield. Pitting their fearsome creatures in gladiatorial battle, one mage will reign victorious, ascending to the title of Archmage.  
Do you have the strength and strategy to defeat your enemies? Will you become the Archmage?    
    PLAY

Dawn of the Archmage continues the rich fantasy world of Archmage Origins. Once the rulers of Sorcado, mages have fallen from power. Challengers arrive from every corner of the land. Knighted Paladins, land-hungry Lords... all seek to dethrone the mages. But mages don't go down easily. It's time to fight back!   
Each mage uses summoning powers to bring new and dangerous creatures to the battlefield. Expending massive mystical energy, their battle grows in frenetic power as monstrous beasts fight for the mages who control them, seeking to destroy all challengers in a magic-fueled frenzy. 
Mages of Sorcado
Ultimate power hangs in the balance as ferocious monsters shake the earth with battle-lust.
In addition to summoning fearsome creatures to fight, mages posses a selection of powerful spells. With a single word, the battle can shift. Manipulating odds, controlling movement, and countering rival's spells, the mage's strategy will determine the supreme ruler of Sorcado. 
The battle rages everywhere. Modular map tiles allow the mages to customize the battle area. Large, sprawling battlefields or close, confined ones... the fight is different every time. Will it be the Arena? The Forest? The Ruins? Or even Underground?
  Please be aware that this is a Work In Progress. All is not final. Art and sculptures may still be slightly altered. If you see anything here that isn't the same later, know that the intent was to improve the game during the Kickstarter process due to input from our backers.
   To add any of the add ons below, just manually increase your pledge by the indicated amount for the add on (and the shipping for the boxes of miniatures). The price listed is per add on item.
Please be aware that this is a Work In Progress. All is not final. Art and sculptures may still be slightly altered. If you see anything here that isn't the same later, know that the intent was to improve the game during the Kickstarter process due to input from our backers.

  SolarFlare Games contributes approximately $12USD towards the shipping costs for ALL backers. The additional charge for various countries reflects the cost after this subsidy. We are estimating the box will weigh between 6 to 6.5 LBS.
We bulk ship our international orders to the UK for fulfillment from the UK, with some areas direct shipping from China. This is done to reduce the shipping costs around the world and prevent VAT costs for EU backers. This makes the international shipping as backer friendly as possible.
The following is a list of rough estimates for shipping a base game package (just under 4kg weight).

Unfortunately, different import laws and customs from some specific countries have made it impossible for SolarFlare Games to ship games to them. *WE DO NOT SHIP TO:* Russia, Ukraine, Kazakhstan and Afghanistan.
  We like to support game stores around the world by offering the special pricing of the game to retailers during the campaign. We treat retail backers just like other backers in that they receive their rewards before we release regular retail games into distribution and include all unlocked stretch goals.  
If you're a retailer, please contact Dave at capstern@gmail.com during the campaign for pricing information or pledge $2 to the MERCHANT level and we will contact you. Retailers will need to provide some documentation to validate retailer status.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
SolarFlare Games has worked in gaming and publishing in various capacities for many years and has the experience to ensure that everything goes as smoothly as possible.

We believe in quality above all else and have chosen to use a well-established production organization with a deep experience in game production. They are an organization that have a proven record working with independent game developers. 

This is our 7th Kickstarter. Our last six projects were successfully funded and delivered (5 on time, 1 one month late and one 2 months early). When funding ends, production will quickly begin and we will provide timely updates through each stage of Dawn of the Archmage production, all the way until it hits your table.

We believe that honesty is paramount for our supporters. Our exacting standards and desire for quality and fun mean that you're guaranteed a game that looks just as good as it is fun to play, while offering many years of family fun!

The estimated delivery date is July 2018, but keep in mind this is only an estimate. Also, due to the logistics of international shipping, backers in different regions of the world may receive their rewards sooner than others.

There are some vagaries in terms of timing when it comes to anything produced in China, such as: 
Production delays 
Shipping delays 
Customs delays


TERMS AND CONDITIONS

By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that the final look, materials and content of the rewards (and the project) are subject to change and may differ from what is presented while the Kickstarter project was active.

If you do not log in and confirm your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification via email to confirm your pledge, you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received. 

However, we may, at our discretion, refund or ship your pledge if you contact us and confirm your pledge after the 8 week window has elapsed. Unconfirmed pledges make it difficult for us to plan production and logistics, and could lead to project delays. For this project we do not intend to allow this to happen, which may mean if you confirm your pledge too late, special order items may not be produced in sufficient quantity for your pledge.

If you confirm your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification via email, you agree that our responsibility to you is to ship your order as entered into our pledge manager system, that title and risk passes to you upon delivery to a common carrier for such shipment, and you are responsible for import duties or any other duties that may be payable to the relevant tax authorities, providing correct address information and ensuring this address is deliverable by normal methods. 

If you do not accept these terms, please do not pledge on this project.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
