updates.update_userinfo: Shipping, An Error and Big News!
updates.update_content:
Shipping:
As of now all shipping has been completed.  I have a list of about 5 people that I am reaching out to the UK fulfillment to validate your shipments went.  Sorry for the delay, we try to get it as right as possible out of the gate.
They did suggest that if you are international - please double check your spam folder the shipping notices sometimes end up in people's spam folders.

Shipping Complete
As of this morning all shipments we had addresses for have shipped.
USA - finished last week.
International - Finished yesterday.

Shipping  
USA  
As of today all the USA based backers (that we have an address for) have been shipped. Please note that if you ordered any kind of mat or mat combination, they were shipped parcel post in a solid cardboard tube to keep them safe.

Things We Know or Have Found
The manufacturer forgot to shrink wrap Udder Terror and the Poker cards on the box but the cards are shrunk inside.  If you have any issues with any of the non-shrunk boxes please let us know.
No the AI cannot be sleeved and put back in the box - this was known and discussed previously.  We are trying to keep the shipping costs as low as possible to make the game as friendly in cost as possible.  We also wanted it to meet the form factor of the previous game and the next one that is coming - Monstrous Horde.  When we get to the finale game Darkness Rising (approx 2019) we will see if we can offer a big box that can hold all four games. ()

We just wanted you to know that the shipping of both Archmage Origins and Nightmare Forest: Alien Invasion have started in the USA. The first shipment goes out tomorrow. We expect the international shipping to start this week, waiting on verification from GamesQuest in the UK - but all the product is in their hands now.

(This will be sent to Archmage Origin Backers as well sorry if you see it twice and thanks if you see it twice)
Status
International: Games and other bits are in customs.  Expect to clear in the next few days.  I will check with GamesQuest when they will start shipping but we are planning for that to be next week. I will update further if this changes.

(Apologies to those who back both Origins and Alien Invasion as you will get both updates at about the same time.)  
On the Water  
Nightmare Forest: Alien Invasion is on the water and is expected to arrive in the UK on August 15 and in the USA on August 18th. We are still subject to possible customs delays but that is the current estimate from the importers. If all goes as planned, we will be getting all the games and other project items out before the end of August.

campaign.story:
PLAY

We've added an Example of Play slideshow, depicting a single round of a game, as a video.  The images for the slideshow are taken from a .pdf file and fed into Power Point.  
The details are more clear on the .pdf linked below, but we've included the slideshow for those backers who prefer to coast on easy mode.  Here is a link to the Example of Play as a .pdf.  The .pdf is not a slideshow:
https://www.dropbox.com/s/y8jsp4u7jqrk6hv/Example%20of%20Play.pdf?dl=0
Jonathan Nadaeu of the Crowdfunding Cast interviewed us for episode #550 of his podcast series. In a fifteen minute interview we talk about our game, the Traveller IP, and the Kickstarter Campaign. Check out the link and give it a listen!
http://crowdfundingcast.tk/crowdfunding-cast-episode-550-travler/
Traveller is a card game adaptation of Marc Miller's classic Science-Fiction role-playing game. Players assume the role of ship Captains plying the mains of the Third Imperium.
The game has been designed to accommodate 2-4 players, but it also supports solo play and we anticipate releasing special solo play scenarios and game modes.  Single and two-player games should last about 30 minutes.  Three or four will go for 45-60 minutes.   
Traveller is non-collectable. There's no random allocation of cards, and no rarities. Every product is a fixed set, so you always know exactly what you're getting.
Our basic mechanics are an icon-driven race game, with ample opportunities to interact with, and even engage in piracy against, other players. All Captains must also contend with a hostile galaxy and the looming threat of insolvency.
In the graphic above, we illustrate an example of Contract completion. The Scout provides a Passage/Survey Capability, which may be used to resolve Contracts that require either Survey (as seen here) or Passage.
Read on to see more details on our current backer rewards.  Please note that the final production versions may vary from the concept art.
We have calculated shipping costs into our campaign funding goal, so we are not charging any additional fees.  We have also committed to working with an EU-based distributor, to allow backers to save on VAT charges.
However, while we are not charging extra for shipping, we have created two Add Ons specifically designed to defray the associated costs.  If you're interested in helping, please check out the Shipping and the Shipping & Handling promo cards.
  A Ship Deck comes with 81 cards:
1 Ship Card
20 Adventure Cards
60 Captain's Cards
Enough cards to begin your Traveller exploits.  
Backers may choose between one of four Ship Decks: 
Scout
Free Trader
Far Trader
Subsidized Merchant  
Each deck is distinct, containing its own list of cards, though some may be common to multiple decks.
The perfect way to start your Traveller Customizable Card Game hobby, this box comes with two Ship Decks (Scout and Free Trader), 60 additional cards, a rule book and counter sheet.
For the discerning Traveller, we're proud to offer a Collector's Edition Starter Set.  It has the same two ship decks as the Two-Player Starter Set, but the ship cards come foil stamped.  There's also an additional 90 cards (the same 60 as the Starter Set, and then 30 more), rule book, special counters, and an exclusive Norah Wells promo card.
Proudly display your TAS card.  Membership has its perks!
We're also offering a number of unique opportunities to contribute to the Traveller Customizable Card Game project.  Backers can have their favorite characters appear in the game, or even provide the basis for a card themselves.
One lucky backer can grab the chance to decide the next ship we release! 
Please note that depending on the nature of the reward and the specific interests of the backer, it may not be possible to include custom items with initial fulfillment.  There may also be restrictions on what can be done as a custom item due to content, mechanics or legal issues.  
Due to the variable nature of these rewards, anyone interested would be encouraged to contact us directly.
            Not pictured:  Traveller card-back themed mat.  See the Traveller card-back sleeve to get a sense of what it would look like.
              With your support, we hope to make a Traveller card game a reality.  If we are so fortunate as to merit pledges in excess of our goal, we have some great options in mind.
            Traveller is a registered Trademark used under License from Far Future Enterprises.
    Click above to visit web portfolio
                                                     Video Credits
Host:  Brittni Barger (http://www.brittnibarger.com/ ; http://www.imdb.com/name/nm5832649/)
Director of Photography, Editor:  Donald Turner (https://www.facebook.com/donald.turner.5076)
Directed and Written by Jeff Yin (https://www.facebook.com/jeff.yin.92 ; https://www.kickstarter.com/profile/1670179421)
Location provided by Mark Stout Photography: http://markstoutphotography.com/
Location for the Demonstration of Play video by Collector's Legion:
https://www.facebook.com/collectorlegion/
Music in the videos provided by: http://www.bensound.com/royalty-free-music/2 
                                          How We Got Here
The idea for adapting Traveller into a card game came from a discussion my dad and I had on a lazy Saturday, during one of my visits to the Bay Area.  Between the two of us, we have six decades spent affectionately exploring the Third Imperium, and it seemed like a natural setting for a card game.   
I quickly sketched out a basic framework for modeling the adventure, commerce and exploration inherent in Traveller, and it became clear that what we wanted the card game to feel like was something similar to playing the RPG.  Fast paced, high stakes exploits in a grounded, realistic universe.
After tinkering with it for some time, I approached my friend Ian.  I had an idea.  I had a framework.  But I knew in Ian, I could find someone who could take those pieces and make them whole.  We started working in earnest on the nitty gritty of card game design.  
What are the rules?  How does timing work?  What kinds of things do we like about card games, that we want to add in, and what should we avoid?  From those discussions, the game took concrete form, and we began to push what we had to playtesting.  As a result of playtesting, we improved.  We cut what didn't work.  We added what we thought was needed.
It's still being playtested, and always will be, progressing through internal playtesting of basic concepts, then specific sets, then specific builds and specific cards. Then pushing that process out to external playtesters, first in the local gaming scenes and then to the online community at large. 
We're playtesting future cards, to see how they interact with current ones, and current ones to see how they can be made better and clearer for release.  We playtest during development.  We playtest during crowdfunding.  We will playtest during production, and after release, and after the next release, because card games are living things, that must be constantly managed. 
When we thought we really had something, we approached Marc Miller for a license.  It was a little intimidating, contacting the writer of one of our favorite IPs right out of the blue, but Marc took to the idea quickly, and we've been fortunate to benefit from his support and advice all through development.
Which brings us here.  We're honored just to have the opportunity to put this in front of our fellow gamers.  Your support has been truly humbling, and one of the best parts of the entire process.  
Thank You!
                                             Who We Are
Jeff Yin (Lead Designer) is a gamer, writer, and attorney licensed by the State of California. After being called to the bar, he worked in criminal defense and indigent legal services at places such as the Santa Clara County Public Defenders and the Bay Area Legal Aid Domestic Violence Restraining Order Clinic. After that, he entered private practice, primarily focused on indigent representation for Alameda County. 
He is also a published author, having done the English language adaptations for various Japanese animation and manga titles, such as Eyeshield 21, Shouen Jump, Kirby, Pokemon, and more. Some of his other clients included the Tokyo University of Science, Mitsubishi and Japan Air Lines. Jeff was also involved in editing the Second Edition Fading Suns Game Master’s Guide, though the chapters he worked on were not ultimately part of the release. 
Sample Link: http://link.houstonlibrary.org/portal/Eyeshield-21-Vol.-25-Perfect-player-story-by/u06glXPvQTk/ 
He has been gaming all his life, first as a mascot and henchman in his father’s gaming group, then a full member, before eventually becoming a game master of his own groups. Some of his favorite games include Traveller, RuneQuest, Through the Breach, Shadowrun, Vampire: The Masquerade, and Fading Suns. 
For the last 10 years, Jeff has been Assistant RPG Coordinator for Kublacon, one of the West Coast’s largest gaming conventions. He can usually be seen at the major Bay Area cons. 
In 2012, Jeff moved to L.A., began shifting to legal consulting and contracting work, to focus on screenwriting, completing UCLA’s Professional Program in Screenwriting in 2013. His first short film, H.U.R.D. (Human Undead Resources Department) has been seen in Bay Area film festivals, and is a “Notable Project” on Amazon Studios (https://studios.amazon.com/projects/10289).
Ian Lee (Lead Developer) started playtesting CCGs in the late ‘90s, eventually working on more than half-a-dozen games sold by several publishers. He then worked on the design team for the Precedence CCG titles, Babylon 5 and Wheel of Time, during which he acquired experience in managing the interplay between CCG mechanics and maintaining the thematic draw of licensed IPs. 
In addition to having been a certified judge for Magic: The Gathering competitive events, Ian was active in several CCG competitive play circuits, achieving Top Ten world-wide rankings in Babylon 5, Ultimate Combat and Vampire: The Eternal Struggle. 
He brings over 20 years’ experience, having participated in numerous CCGs in virtually every role, from player, competitive player, playtester and design and development. A fixture on the Northern California gaming convention circuit, he has been running a variety of RPG, CCG and board game events at local cons for over two decades. 
Recently, he has acquired an unhealthy interest in True Dungeon. 
When not gaming, Ian works as a Business and Planning Analyst in the San Francisco Bay Area. 
Tony Yin (Project Manager) is a 'first generation' gamer who played Chainmail and Greyhawk at the infancy of D&D. He also played Runequest in its early days, in the campaign of one of its authors, Warren James, at the old San Jose area gaming cafe, The Bandersnatch. Tony also began his adventures in the Third Imperium at about the same time. He still has a full set of LBBs, all with price tags showing just how much further a buck went in 1981. 
In addition to RPGs, he was a fierce competitor in the board games Star Fleet Battles and Squad Leader. Having attended the first PacificCon, his passion for gaming remains strong to this day, especially for MMORPGS such as Eve and World of Warcraft, and 4x titles like Master of Orion and Civilization. 
Tony has over 30 years of experience in the Silicon Valley, and has had extensive dealings with contract manufacturers (CM) in Asia since the late 90's. He has decades of experience developing and launching consumer and commercial products, including packaging, print, logistics, traffic, and material management. 
As a native born Chinese speaker, Tony is able to handle not just the planning and management of a project, but direct communication with various manufacturers and distributors.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have researched the risks and challenges associated with game design, production and crowdfunding, and are confident we can achieve our goals within the time allotted. 

However, when you are dealing with art, overseas manufacturers, freight, distribution and shipping, there's lots of moving parts. A breakdown at any stage could slow down overall production. 

As the basic elements have been designed and we have already identified artists we want to work with, the primary challenges are related to how fast they can work, how quickly we can get their work approved by our Licensor, and then turn around times for printing and shipping.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
This update only applies to backers at the TAS Member and Patron levels!
Two 60-card sets, "Rogue's Gallery" and "Central Supply Catalog" have now been shipped from us to all TAS Member and Patron level backers, except for one unfortunate backer in Hawaii that we're getting out soon.
These sets complete the remaining pledged individually-inspired cards.  We know it's been a long wait, and we can't say enough how awesome you've all been through the process!

A short follow up to yesterday's post:
As many of you have noted, but as we failed to appreciate yesterday, the BackerKit addresses are locked.  This happened automatically when we marked the rewards as shipped originally, so you can't change them even with the link.  But we can, so you can always message us with any changes.
However, please note that the free pack distribution is only open to backers at the TAS Member and Patron levels.  These were the $250 and $500 levels, respectively, and the total population of these two levels is 24 people.

tl;dr:  TAS and Patron level pledges were entitled to a backer card, and we published a new set to include all the backer cards that hadn't been in other sets.  We also made a second, non-backer set.  TAS Member and Patron level pledgers will get both sets for free.  So it is essential that all TAS and Patron level backers double check their BackerKit shipping address and update it if it has changed.
We are going to start shipping these out the week of February 8th, so please don't tarry!

tl;dr:  Backer set and another set are at the printers, in queue.  No firm ETA on them, but they're making their way through the line.  All TAS Members and Patrons will receive the entire Backer Set, instead of just their cards.
If you are a TAS Member or Patron backer and you have changed addresses, please contact us!
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

tl;dr  60 card set containing remaining backer cards due out late summer/fall.  TAS cards shipping, should all be shipped out by end of week.  Traditional retail expansions coming, but we are also going to be releasing Print-on-Demand "minipacks."  First minipack, the Gazelle Close Escort, likely out late Spring.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

tl;dr  TAS card update, Backer card reminder, also news on the new Kickstarter, Traveller CCG Online!
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Traveller CCG Online
Today is a big day for the Traveller Customizable Card Game.  We've launched our second Kickstarter, !  We're taking the physical card game and making an online version you can play with anyone, at any time, anywhere all over the world!

As we head into the Thanksgiving holiday, just wanted to give a brief update.
Main reprint shipping should be complete.
We are now trying to resolve the "problem cases."  If you have reached out to us, great!  You're on our radar and we're trying to fix it.  If you haven't received your cards yet, or you have an issue and you haven't told us about it, please let us know as soon as possible!

The reprint shipping process is taking longer than we hoped, but people are daily reporting receiving their cards.  If you haven't gotten yours yet, we ask you hold on a little longer.  
If the reports have dried up by mid-November, we'll then start collecting any of the problem cases and do our best to resolve those.
Also, we've created a new subforum on our boards.  The Lone Wolf Lounge is dedicated to the Traveller CCG solo play experience.  If you haven't been to our forums yet, consider checking them out!

campaign.story:
Timothy Daffinrud
Click play to listen to my interview with Ashley Adams on The House of Cards.
  The 52 cards represent the 52 weeks in a year
  The 4 suits represent the 4 seasons in a year.
My name is Timothy Daffinrud and one year ago I started designing CARDology, because I realized that millions of people knew the deck of cards like the back of their hand and still did not know about the hidden calendar in standard playing cards. There are 52 cards in a standard deck. These 52 cards represent the 52 weeks in a year. The 52 cards are divided into 4 suits Spades, Hearts, Clubs and Diamonds. These 4 suits represent the 4 seasons in a year. Each suit consist of 13 cards Ace through King. These 13 cards represent the 13 weeks in each season. 
Standard playing cards hidden calendar.
There are many more hidden variables that depict the correlation between the playing cards and the calendar. One of the most intriguing variables is when you total the value of each card in the deck you will find the sum to be 365, plus an extra joker for leap year. 
A celestial calendar with-in a deck of cards
I have spent a great amount of time researching and designing CARDology to reveal this hidden calendar.
The deck I am kickstarting with is Celestial Edition. This is a 52 week celestial calendar, so you can anticipate these events from one week to the next
    The back of the cards and the 2 jokers are original drawings by me.
    CARDology uses each card to reptesent the 52 weeks in a year and explains major events to come. Celestial Edition, illustrates and explains astronomical events that will occur each week throughout the year. The dates of each event corresponds to the cards numeric value and suit that the standard decks consists of. 
The 9 represents the 9th week and the hearts represent summer. Events for the 9th week of summer are revealed
    The 9 represents the 9th week and the diamond represents the winter. The events for the 9th week of winter are revealed.
  The Ace representing the 1st week of each season and the season, ending on the 13th week represented by the 13th card "the King". The order of the suits starts with spades as spring, then follows as hearts as summer, clubs as fall and diamonds as winter. The Ace of Spades begins the chronological order of events for the year.
Spades represents spring.
  Hearts represents summer.
  Clubs Represents autumn/fall.
  Diamonds represents winter.
The entire deck of the Celestial Edition will guide you through all of the major celestial events from the spring equinox on March 20, 2017 though the astrological year as earth makes its way around the Sun. You will know when to expect full moons, meteor showers, and planets approaching Earth. 
This is not just a calendar, but is a tool to inspire curiosity in some of the worlds greatest mysteries. CARDollogy is exploring annual events in a scientific way, with this ancient tool.
        Fishing Edition
  Lunar Edition
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
To design, market, and obtain Trademark, copyright and video production on my own has been a long process and very challenging. I have proven to myself that I am committed to CARDology and its success. Since the completion of CARDology Celestial Edition I have been excited to show my designs and see the public's reaction. I spent 9 months to see to it that the cards were complete before I introduce them to the world. CARDology101.com is a website I personally designed that offers a more detailed description of the scientific path that we want CARDology to stand for. I think the price is higher then I wanted to charge but to keep the shipping on schedule without problems this will cover the margin.

When this kickstarter succeeds, I will explore other subjects as well,. one of of the most intriguing subjects I am working on is Phenology Edition. Phenology is the study of the ways plants and animals react to seasonal changes, such as nesting, blooming, spawning, migration, hibernation, estivation and how the world is connected through the cycles of life. 

One of the most difficult decks for me to create has been the Planisphere Edition. A star and planet finder that animates as you flip through the 52 cards. Each card consist of a map of the sky during the time that correlates to the CARDology calendar. 

In short, the challenges are high, but the risks are low. The rewards will be much more then a deck of cards. This project is diving into an endeavor that you have the opportunity to join and help guide CARDology to a successful path. 

The cards are in your hands.

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!!!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Miss out on backing Fidget Cube?
  What is Fidget Cube?
Fidget Cube is a desk toy for anyone who likes to fidget.
        30 seconds of your time could make the difference in growing the Fidget Cube community. Hit one of the buttons below and tag a friend or coworker who can't stop fidgeting!
        How do I use it?
It's simple. Fidget Cube (patent pending) has six sides. Each side features something to fidget with:
              Fidgeting that matches your style.
Fidget Cube is available in 10 different color schemes:
Dice, Graphite, Midnight, Aqua, Sunset, Berry, Fresh, Retro, Kickstarter Edition, and Backer Designed (design voted on by the Fidget Family!).
            Why fidget?
We love this question. It's not uncommon to hear fidgeting being spoken about negatively. It's often labeled as unprofessional and deemed as anti-intellectual behavior.
But in reality, the exact opposite has been suggested to be the case. Below are just some of many resources highlighting the work that's being done to learn more about this behavior:
The Science Of Why We Fidget While We Work
Squirm With Purpose
Stress Toys: Mindlessness With A Purpose?
The Benefits Of Fidgeting For Students With ADHD
Why Do We Fidget?
Using Stress Balls To Focus The Attention Of Students
We believe that the way we look at fidgeting needs to change.
This behavior isn't one that should continue to be stigmatized and mocked as unbecoming or inappropriate. We are passionate about the idea that fidgeting is a process that, with the right tools and outlet, can have positive and real-life applications.
  Where can I use Fidget Cube?
  It was incredibly important to us that the design of Fidget Cube was one that would look great on any desk, whether that desk belonged to a student or a CEO.
There are really no limits to when and where you can use Fidget Cube. Use it while listening to a lecture, or while studying for that upcoming test. Use it in the next meeting you have to attend (or lead). Use it at your desk while working on projects. Enduring a lengthy commute and need to relieve some stress? Fidget away. Marathoning a Netflix series? Yep, you can fidget then too.
  But I already have a pen. Do I really need Fidget Cube?
Pens (and the wonderful clicking they do) were a huge inspiration in the design process of Fidget Cube. They are probably one of the most commonly used fidget "tools". We like to see Fidget Cube as more of a fidget "toolbox". You don't have to be constrained to simple clicking, you can pick your poison based on your mood. Yes... We are very serious about our fidgeting.
  I don't really fidget. Would I enjoy Fidget Cube?
We think so! Not everyone fidgets the same amount. But spending the last few years deeply interested in the process of fidgeting, we've observed the fact that almost everyone fidgets to some extent, in a variety of ways.
Maybe you're not the type of person who uses objects like paper clips or pencils to fidget with. If that's the case, it's very likely you fidget in some other way, such as bouncing your knee up and down, tapping your foot, or picking at lint in your pocket.
We believe that Fidget Cube provides a tangible way to capture your floating attention, regardless of whether you fidget consciously or subconsciously.
  Rewards.
For believing in our vision, we want to thank you! Check out our rewards below:
    Stretch Goals.
         The Team.
  We're Antsy Labs, and more specifically, Matthew and Mark McLachlan - brothers that have a passion for designing solutions to problems we come across in daily life.
Where are you in the process?
After handfuls of prototypes, we've tweaked every last detail to arrive at the Fidget Cube you see today. We've got a number of working units, but in order to make enough for you to have one as well, we need to place a substantial minimum order for the first production run of Fidget Cube. That's why we're offering Fidget Cube to this awesome community before anyone else.
What does your timeline look like?
Fidget Cube has been an idea we've been dying to bring to fruition since it was first conceived in 2012. The product you're seeing in this project is the result of innumerable hours of iterating and reiterating. We're perfectionists, and we wanted to make sure we got this one right.
Below, you'll see a brief outline of the journey we're on with Fidget Cube, starting from the first discussion about it to when all of you joined the story (and where we go from here)!
We are insanely excited to get Fidget Cube into your hands. So you can be sure that we're going to continue to work day and night until the very last Fidget Cube has shipped.
  Help Out By Sharing Fidget Cube With Your Friends! (#fidgetfever)
Like what you're seeing? Great! Don't be shy about sharing Fidget Cube with your friends. We've made it super easy. Just hit one of the buttons below (or at the top of the page).
The more people who know about Fidget Cube, the larger our community will become! And the larger the community, the better we'll be able to make Fidget Cube!
We can't do this without you!
        Questions?
Ask away! Shoot us a message or post a comment and we'll do our best to get back to you with an answer.
Feedback?
Got a creative idea you think we should implement with Fidget Cube? Don't hesitate - let us know! Fidget Cube is being made possible by you, and we want you to be a part of the creative process as well.
International Backers
This project isn't just for backers in the United States. We'll be shipping Fidget Cube worldwide!
That being said, there are unique processes that apply specifically to international backers that we'd like you to be aware of. Please note that there is no way for us to charge any additional amount on our end for any applicable VAT/duties that may be a result of a specific country's local tax code. Therefore, these fees may be incurred upon receipt of your reward. These fees are the responsibility of each backer, and additional information regarding VAT/duties can be found in our FAQ below.
In addition, due to first class shipping fees and the dimensions of Fidget Cube, shipping rates may seem a bit high for some international locations. We calculated shipping rates beforehand, and are able to swallow some of the shipping costs on orders of 1 or 2 Fidget Cubes. Please note that shipping becomes completely free when you pledge for 5 or more Fidget Cubes.
Some Final Thoughts.
While we strongly believe in the many benefits of fidgeting, we aren't claiming to cure any illness or condition. Fidget Cube is a fun, unique way to customize your fidgeting. When designing Fidget Cube we were inspired by research that claims fidgeting might actually help individuals focus their attention. We have personally found that it helps us stay focused in boring meetings and while working on projects.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This isn't our first rodeo. We've brought several Kickstarter projects to life in the past, and have learned from our experiences. While we have been relentlessly concerned with the details throughout designing, prototyping, and planning for production, there is always the chance that pesky Murphy guy may make an entrance with that law of his.

In the event that things don't go as planned, whether it's a delay in the manufacturing timeline, shipping date, or something else, we promise to communicate honestly with you and work around the clock until we correct the issue.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: We Just Launched A $7, 3-Day Kickstarter Project!
updates.update_content:
Hey Fidget Family,
  With only 3 days left in 2020, we wanted to say so long to this year in an Antsy Labs sort of way.
So we're launching a surprise, 3-day Kickstarter project to fund the tooling for a new limited-edition standalone IRLA (that's only $7).
Introducing the A.D. 2020 IRLA:

updates.update_userinfo: Introducing our most unique project since Fidget Cube...
updates.update_content:
Hey Fidget Family!
We'll just jump right into it and let you know that we just launched our latest invention right here on Kickstarter. We think it's the most unique idea we've had since Fidget Cube, and we are giddy to finally be sharing it after two years of developing it!
IRLA: In Real Life Achievements

updates.update_userinfo: Introducing our next project... Storm the Gate: Woodland Warfare 🐰🦊🐻
updates.update_content:
Hey Fidget Family!
For the past several years, we've been designing our latest game and can finally share it with you all...
Meet Storm the Gate: Woodland Warfare!

updates.update_userinfo: We made a party game based on our experience making Fidget Cube (Introducing our next Kickstarter!)
updates.update_content:
Hey Fidget Family!
This week marks the 3 year anniversary of the launch of Fidget Cube, how has time flown so fast!?
Over the last year, we've been designing a board game that is loosely based on our experience making Fidget Cube and funding it on Kickstarter.

updates.update_userinfo: Half kitten. Half Fidget Cube. Fully awesome.
updates.update_content:
Hey Fidget Family,
We are excited to introduce you to our friends over at Exploding Kittens. We have gotten to know them, and they are a really great team that are working on their newest project as we speak. For that reason, we wanted to give them the floor... we hope you all enjoy this art as much as we did!

Hey Fidget Family!
We’ll keep this brief.
We have heard from MANY of you over the last couple years that you wanted to know the moment G4MER Fidget Cube was available again. This is a very short update to let you know…

To our amazing backer community: 
Two years ago, you helped us bring Fidget Cube from dream to reality (thank you for that!). 
Now, we’re back with a completely new project on Kickstarter for the first time since 2016. 
Introducing... PIXL: A Magnetic Building System

Happy New Year to the Antsy Labs community!
We wanted to thank you all again for your support in bringing Fidget Cube to life and to show you what we’ve been up to lately (see below).

updates.update_userinfo: Oh What A Day, What A Lovely Day!
updates.update_content:
Fidget Family!
When we launched the crazy idea of Fidget Cube to the world in August of last year, we had no idea what the following days would hold. This has truly been an insane journey, and we want to thank you again for all your support and patience with us.
We wanted to touch base with you again today for a brief and exciting update.

campaign.story:
Holdude Door and Book Stopper are Kickstarter Exlusive, then you will not find them on the market in future, production is limited to this Kickstarter and only bakers of this project will have it.   
There comes a day in the life of every nerd when a hero is needed who is able to hold down certain situations. That day is today... and Holdude is that hero!
 Are you are afraid of losing a defenseless die rolling itself around on the table or worse in a snowy wilderness? Holdude knows what to do.  
Are your books are getting excessively confident with your shelf and expanding themselves on it? Holdude will put them back into line.  
Is the wind and / or hordes of unwanted humans or worse, undead, besieging the gates of your home? Holdude is the Lord, the King of the doorstops!  
Polished, skilled and a good eater, goes in an loop easily if subjected to too many sound stimuli but oh, this is Holdude: a humble, simple and indispensable best friend for all true nerds.  
THE COMPANY 
 Let's keep it short and sweet: Active in the craftsmanship sector for more than 30 years, fans of our work have always been in step with the latest production technologies, and where we can't arrive we employ a competent external staff who are highly specialized so as to offer our customers the best product. 
 THE PROJECT 
 As you can see, we would like to develop more gadgets dedicated to Holdude, ranging from miniatures to "connoisseur" furniture. 
With this project, we would like to try to cover all the costs of the minimum order, moulds and materials that are necessary to produce the best product possible!
 We turn to all of you for this: if you like the idea and think it is valid, help us achieve it!
  Door Stopper it's a Kickstarter Exlusive
 Many different parts to have an unique custom door stopper! Watch below some example of compositions!
   Holdude will block your doors so well that... that... that you only need to tell him once! Just one piece of advice: warn your guests to arrange their expression of "amazement" before coming into your house and seeing him! You will also be allowed to say, "haha, I have one and you dooooon't!" to all non-participants in this campaign. Heveresto cannot help but take to the field to lend a hand (actually, just a finger) to keep doors and books locked! Limitless, surprisingly strong, unbeatable.
This is a doorstop extremely customizable, choose your combination: Do you like a Sombrero? Maybe a man like Santa?
Choose your prefer combo! Many different parts available and during Pledge Manager you will make your choice!
Door Stopper eg. assembly

 During the Pledge Manager you will be able to customize your model choosing Head and Body you prefer!
Zoom on two assembly sample

   Perfect to carry the burden of all your lucky dice. 35 mm from ground to eyes, this model will keep your dice safe... The highest quality molding from a fifteen-industry company, white metal and standard bases for the needs of all Wargamers. Surprise your opponents and friends with an unexpected ally!
Dice Holder eg. assembly
You will receive a model that can fit with EVERY fantasy medieval game as villager or lumberjack or everything you like. During the Pledge Manager you will be able to customize your model choosing Head and Body you prefer!

   This is the Pen Holder, will come with plastic base, model is unpainted and unassembled. 35 mm eye to ground. This stretch goal is a Kickstarter Exlusive, so production is limited to this kickstarter or to particular festival. You can add any number of Pen Holder to your pledge for 8 EUR each one.
cli
   This Diorama will come, unpainted and unassembled. 30 Mm ground to Holdude 's Eye. This stretch goal is a Kickstarter Exlusive, so production is limited to this kickstarter or to particular festival. You can add any number of Pen Holder to your pledge for 10 EUR each one.
SHIPPING AND INFORMATION
Based on past experience, shipping will be charged after the campaign through our store-based pledge manager, based on the actual cost to ship your pledge and any additional rewards you select.  
This is so we can be fair to all our backers as shipping is rarely one size fits all, and also give you more stretch goodies and possibly a choice of carrier options. We will ship your rewards at our cost to our international hubs.  
IF YOU WANT ONLY MINIATURE weight is lesser and price change:
EUROPE : €10    
USA - CANADA: €10  
CINA - JAPAN : €10  
OCEANIA: €15
If you order also Doorstopper, Bookstopper etc, this are the prices.
We are waiting for the Amazon response, in this case shipping price will change and be lower.
EUROPE : €15
NORWAY : €30
USA - CANADA: €15
CINA - JAPAN : €15
OCEANIA: €30
Keep in mind these are just estimates, and costs may rise based on weight increases from unlocked stretch goals and any optional buys you choose.  
We also cannot ship to PO Boxes domestically or internationally. Due to the size of each package there is too great a risk of the package being bounced back to us.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are some vagaries in terms of timing when it comes to anything produced in China, such as: 

Production delays 
Shipping delays 
Customs delays

The estimated delivery date is December 2016, but keep in mind this is only an estimate. Also, due to the logistics of international shipping, backers in different regions of the world may receive their rewards sooner than others.

REFUND POLICY

We can refund you within 14 days of the campaign’s end, fees included. After that, we have a policy of no questions asked, though that’s minus Kickstarter and payment processing fees (which we can’t get back from them after 14 days). However, if we’ve begun packaging your pledge for shipment (usually 4 to 6 weeks before the actual shipping date), no refunds are possible. If a component cannot be delivered AT ALL, we refund that completely, including fees.

All refunds after the 14 days close of the campaign may be processed via Paypal or reversed via Stripe to your credit card at our discretion. Refunds within 14 days are reversed via Stripe to your credit card.

This project is being funded in EUR and any refunds processed will be in EUR for the exact amount received in EUR, excluding any applicable fees depending on the time of the refund being processed.

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that the final look, materials and content of the rewards (and the project) are subject to change and may differ substantially from what is presented while the Kickstarter project was active.

If you do not log in and confirm your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification via email to confirm your pledge, you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received. However, we may, at our discretion, refund or ship your pledge if you contact us and confirm your pledge after the 8 week window has elapsed.

If you confirm your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification via email, you agree that our responsibility to you is to ship your order as entered into our pledge manager system, that title and risk passes to you upon delivery to a common carrier for such shipment, and you are responsible for import duties or any other duties that may be payable to the relevant tax authorities, providing correct address information and ensuring this address is deliverable by normal methods. We regret we are unable to ship to PO Boxes.

If you do not accept these terms, please do not pledge on this project but instead wait for the general release.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Welcome to the reboot of the Super Chibi Round 2 Kickstarter by MidKnight Heroes.
What's Super Chibi Round 2? It's the next step in the Super Chibi miniatures line. Super Chibi is a shared universe that spans four new and interesting worlds, created by MidKnight Heroes. Each world has its own style and flare but is 100% pure Chibi. The Super Chibi worlds have everything from mecha and cyborgs to monsters and even fantasy.
So, what can you use these miniatures for? Anything! They can be used for board games, role-playing games or simply collector's pieces. The ultimate goal is for the miniatures to have their own game, and this Kickstarter project takes important steps in that direction.
 The Super Chibi Round 2 Kickstarter introduces two more characters from the science fiction world in the Super Chibi universe. These characters are from the world of Super Chibi S.E.E.D., and can be used in any board game or Role Playing Game, as well as future game titles. In this Kickstarter, we are asking for help in creating these two new characters; Takata and Jaxx. This Kickstarter will cover the expense of taking them from mastered designs to completed molds and figures, and helps in providing us with funds to help produce additional figures, with an aim to populate the tech worlds of Super Chibi.  
ebook Story Book: Super Chibi S.E.E.D. Origins [Reboot Pledge only]
Just like in our first Kickstarter, Super Chibi we will be including a book in Super Chibi Round 2 - Reboot , Super Chibi S.E.E.D. Origins. This time, it's not an art book. It's a storybook. The book will include three short stories that will explain the world, Super Chibi S.E.E.D. (Synthetic Enhanced Engineered Destroid) and the backstory of Takata and Jaxx. Just like the last book, it will be published by MONOLITH and after the Kickstarter will be sold on their site. This is something we want to do more of and you will be seeing more of this as we move forward.
So what is Super Chibi S.E.E.D.? S.E.E.D. stands for Synthetic Enhanced Engineered Destroid. In the world of S.E.E.D. Destroids are mecha that can either be worn as power armor or in some cases be much bigger and piloted by a human or cyborg pilot. At a certian point in the history of the world a young sicentiest created a synthetic computer to control these destroids to reduce the loss of life in the wars. Little did he know that he created more than just a computer but he created a brain. The new destroids were now aware of their sourndings and clamined that they were in fact alive. It became a heated issue and casued major termoil. A war broke out between Biologics vs S.E.E.D.s. In the end the S.E.E.D.s lost but there are still plenty of them out there casuing trouble and somehow they are increasing there numbers.
*Note: Five random people that pledge at the Super Chibi Round 2 - Reboot pledge will get a printed version of the Super Chibi S.E.E.D. Origins book. 
New Caster:
We always strive to be the best we can be and this time, this Kickstarter will feature a new caster. This caster has over 25-years of experience and has cast for companies like Reaper miniatures, Avatars of War and has even done work for Adepticon as well. We feel that they are a perfect fit for the Midknight Heroes family.
Each of our miniatures will be scaled at 30mm, cast in resin and will require assembly and paint. All miniatures in this Kickstarter are intended for play in our upcoming Super Chibi A.C.E. game, launching via Kickstarter, next year. [See the bottom of this page for more info on A.C.E]
Current Goal: $2,000
Current characters seeking to fund:
Me'Thule, The Robotic Knight [Unlocks at 2,000]
INITIAL Funding goal: $1.250, FUNDED!
Takata, the Cynobi assassin: FUNDED!
    PLAY

 Jaxx, S.E.E.D. Special Forces Officer. FUNDED!
     PLAY

    Don't want both? That's fine, all core miniatures can be added to your pledge as an add-on, of $10 per character. Also, other add-ons will be allowed from our first Kickstarter, Super Chibi. Want a Midknight miniature? Get her. How about a Damien Kane? He's all yours! Just add an extra $10 to your pledge and they will be yours. Any stretch goal from Super Chibi Round 2 that's unlocked can be added as well in this manner. 
*Note: Any miniature that is purchased as an add-on that was part of the Super Chibi Kickstarter will be from our first cast and therefor not cast by our new caster. 
 **Note: Chibi Elvia is not offered as an Addon, but if you chose the Mega Chibi Pledge she will be included.
  Shipping:  
We will charge shipping after the Kickstarter, based on the actual costs and weight. This will be collected after the campaign ends via our pledge manager.  
IMPORTANT: DO NOT INCLUDE ADDITIONAL FUNDS TO COVER YOUR POSTAGE PAYMENT IN YOUR PLEDGE AT THIS TIME.  
Any funds collected through the KS system are reduced by 10% when Kickstarter collects their fees; this means that any funds collected to cover postage are 10% less than what is actually needed to cover postage, if the postage rates do not increase at the time of billing and shipping (postal rates have increased on us during our projects at least once prior to fulfillment; in one case, the rates increased twice).  
After the campaign ends, backers will be able to select their rewards, via the pledge manager. Shipping costs will be calculated at that time. You will also be able to select additional reward options at that time if you wish.  
Postage will be calculated by region when backers make their choices via our pledge management system. All postage fees must be paid before shipment can be completed. Rewards will be posted from the United States to all backer's addresses.  
Postage ESTIMATES by region: (please note these are estimates only; your actual shipping charge may be higher or lower depending on the rates at the time of shipping).  
US $4.00 - $15.00 (1st Class or Priority Mail)  
CAN / UK / EU $15.00 - $25.00  
AU / NZ / ROW $15 - $30.  
MidKnight Heroes is not responsible for any customs duties, taxes or fees incurred as a result.  
US rewards may be shipped via either USPS 1st Class or USPS Priority mail. All International Mail is shipped USPS 1st Class International mail.
***Note: We have seen with our last set that it can be stuck in customs for a while. IF this does happen there is nothing we can do out side of wait.
Super Chibi A.C.E. Playtest
So some of you are probably wondering what is this Super Chibi A.C.E.? Well, that's a good question. You see we just don't want to make miniatures, we want to make games as well. Super Chibi A.C.E. (formerly Super Chibi Clash the game) is our first step in that direction. Why bring it up now? Well these miniatures as well as our first Kickstarter miniatures will be apart of that game. Watch this quick video as we explain what Super Chibi A.C.E. is.
We want to say: Thank You!  
Thank you so much for your interest in Super Chibi, and doubly so for backing it if you chose to, as well! This can't be done without all of you. You're the ones who make MidKnight Heroes what it is today, and for that, we say thank YOU. If this campaign is funded, it will be because of your generous support and encouragement, and that means we get to not only produce it but also share it and make it available to the fantastic tabletop community. We want to give special thanks to, CPOP and MONOLITH they have been a huge partner and friend through this whole process.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our core development team is made up of artists, writers and game designers. This is the team that first started working on the project and has done most of the work to bring it to you. We realized early in the project that our greatest challenge in bringing our vision to life, would be finding a great sculptor. We have done our research and found the best sculptor for the job. His name, Heriberto Valle Martinez.

A big part of this Kickstarter is to gain the funding to pay for the sculpts and overall production of the miniatures. We have thoroughly researched the costs associated with sculpting, molding, production and shipping of the first set of miniatures. We are confident that we have considered all of the costs that will be associated with this project.

Our biggest challenge will be the time needed to sculpt and produce the miniatures. As the sculptors have to do all of their work after the project funds, the time-frame following the Kickstarter may be longer than we initially wanted. Bear with us, these miniatures will be awesome and well worth the wait. We will keep you informed with regular updates on the progress of the project. We're not going to be idle while the sculptors are doing their work, however. The rest of the team will be busy developing the future line of miniatures and finishing games for future releases.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Thank you and check out Super Chibi Round 3.
updates.update_content:
Backers, it's true when we say you are our heroes. With out you guys and gals, we could not be doing what we do. And for that we thank you. SUper Chibi Round 2 made some major progress for us and just like all our kickstarters we learned a lot. We have now carried those experiences over to our new Kickstarter Super Chibi Round 3.
We wanted to take the time to tell you that Round 3 is now live on Kickstarter. Yes it has a low funding level and that's because of you. Your help on round 2 allowed us to get a few more characters done but we still need help with the mold and casting. Out side of the core set, we want to focus on more fantasy this time so, that why the stretch goals this time will be mainly fantasy based. We have some really good goal planned including our first ever character bust. Take a look at the campaign and let us know what you think.
